loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita works hard to support her family. Perlita is married, and she has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years.

She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan amount to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Perlita would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Tiwen

texts.en:
This is the story of Anisa, daughter of Tiwen:

My name is Anisa, I live in a village called Kawunganten. I am the youngest child and have brothers. My parents income per day is less than Rp. 50.000. My house is made of wood. I go to school using public bus transportation. The distance from home to school is about 1.5 miles. I was given pocket money by my parents Rp. 3,000 - Rp. 2.000 - for transport home and to go to school, and the remaining Rp. 1.000, - for pocket money, but if my money runs out, I will go home on foot. With the Student Loan program, I am very grateful to the lenders. These funds will be very useful for me and my family in helping the economy.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is 48 years old and is married with three children. With all three children currently in school, Monica works very hard to provide for them.

Monica runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, canned goods, noodles, shampoo, cooking oil, etc. Monica has requested a loan of PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional groceries to sell in her store.
 
In the future, Monica would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell, such as detergent soap, canned goods, noodles, shampoo, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Tuginah

texts.en:
This is the story of Mikun, the son of Tuginah:

Mikun is my name. I live in Ujungmanik village, Kampung Laut, a coastal village on the island of Java. It is quite far away from the city of Cilacap. I go to and from school using public transport in the countryside. The distance from home to school is about 10 miles. Every day after my activities at my school I do housework to help my parents. My parents are farmers, but do not get work every day, because it depends on the weather and natural conditions in the village. Due to unpredictable conditions, the economic circumstances of my parents has declined, and my father now works in the city of Bogor as a handyman (to make brown sugar), even though my parents income is not fixed. However, the results of tapping is enough to help the economy. I followed the program to get a Kiva loan for education expenses in order to ease the burden on my parents. I am very grateful to the lenders because the program is very helpful to me so that I can continue school.

loans.use: to pay for her son's education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Hardworking mother Josefina is from Cangmalalag, Siquijor, Philippines. Her husband is a carpenter and the wage that he gets from his carpentry work is not sufficient for their needs. 

She sells juices, soft drinks and various beverages at her own home. She has made a meager income of PHP 2,000 per month that she has saved for the payment of their electric and water bills. 

Recently, Josefina thought of raising pigs in her own backyard. She applied for a loan to purchase piglets and feed. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family in addition to the income of her husband.

loans.use: to buy additional heads of piglets and bags of animal feed and vitamins

loans.name: Dolorita

texts.en:
Dolorita is a 50-year-old married woman with six children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Dolorita has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and has been in this business for 12 years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

In the future, Dolorita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Annalyn

texts.en:
Annalyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Annalyn is 36 years old, and all of her children attend school.

Annalyn has a general store business in the Philippines. Annalyn has requested a 20,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase items such as sugar, shampoo, canned goods and other groceries.

Annalyn has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Annalyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sugar, shampoo, canned goods and other groceries.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling ready to wear clothing in the Philippines.

Rebecca requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of ready to wear to sell.

Rebecca has been in this business for nine years now.

In the future, Rebecca would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready to wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.en:
Ignacia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years now.

Ignacia requested a loan of PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Ignacia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy onion seeds for planting.

loans.name: Nyabusese Twimuke Tukole Group

texts.en:
Deo is hardworking man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer growing maize among other food crops, and at the same time brews waragi and sells goats. He faces a challenge of limited capital. Besides that he hopes to have a better standard of living.

He acquiring a loan to hire and weed a garden in preparation for the next season.

loans.use: to hire and weed his garden.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Las calles de Suchitepéquez es testigo de los colores más vistosos impregnados en las blusas, cortes y fajas típicas.  Es imposible que cualquier turista deje de admirar este producto, pararse y hacer una buena compra de ello, es la actividad que Maria realiza de 24 años de edad soltera que está decidida a luchar por la vida, ella tiene un hijo de cuatro años de edad y es estudiante de la escuela de la comunidad.
		
La actividad que ella desempeña es la elaboración de güipiles, cortes y fajas típicas, ella viene realizando dicha actividad durante 3 años ella ha venido realizando un gran esfuerzo para poder elaborar sus actividades de la mejor calidad y diversos estilos para poder atraer a más clientes para tener un mejor ingreso económico para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

El uso respectivo que ella le dará al crédito es para la compra de materia prima como hilos de diferentes colores y otros insumos que se requieren en la elaboración de su actividad para poder tener un ingreso económico. Uno de las grandes aspiraciones de Maria es tener un local propio para poder brindar un servicio mejor a sus clientes y graduarse en la universidad par ser alguien mejor en la vida.
texts.en:
The streets of Suchitepéquez are witness to traditional blouses, cuts of fabric, and sashes impregnated with most attractive colors. It is impossible for any tourist to resist admiring these products, stopping, and making a good purchase of such an item. This is the work that Maria does. She is 24 years old and single, and she is determined to work hard for a living. She has a son, age 4, who is a student in the school in the community.

Her work is making güipiles [traditional blouses], woven lengths of cloth, and traditional sashes. She has been doing this work for 3 years. She has been making a great effort to be able make her work with the best quality and in a variety of styles in order to be able to attract more customers and to have a better economic income to improve the living conditions of her family.

The respective use that she will give to the loan is to buy basic materials such as threads of different colors and other supplies that are needed for her work in order to be able to have an economic income. One of Maria's great aspirations is to have her own shop in order to be able to offer better service to her customers and and to graduate from the university to be someone better in life.

loans.use: to buy basic materials to weave traditional clothing

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma is a 48-year-old married mother of six children from Concepcion, Iloilo. Wilma has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 30 years now. This is the source of their income.

Wilma is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and to make additional payments for their fishing boat. Through this, Wilma and her husband will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Wilma hopes of making their business a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the educational expenses of their children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and to make additional payments for their fishing boat.

loans.name: Janem

texts.en:
This is the story of Safita, the daughter of Janem:

Safita my name, I live in Bojong Giri Jaya village. The distance from home to school is about 2 km. My biological father had died due to illness, now I live with my mother and stepfather. I live in a half-permanent house, with a fence made of bamboo and half-bricks. Every day I go to school using public buses, with an allowance of Rp 5.000. My parents work as farmers, but their income is uncertain. Due to the weather conditions that are sometimes not good, the yields are erratic. However, my parents are very concerned for my education and that of my brothers, because with education our future will be so much better. After school I help my parents to do housework. I say many thanks to the lenders so I can continue to go to school. 

In the picture is Janem, Safita and Safita's grandmother.

loans.use: pay for her daughter's education fees at the vocational school.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma has mastered her hog raising business in Cangmalalag, Siquijor, Philippines. This is how she makes a living and is able to support her family. She was at her lowest point when she didn't have enough capital for her business. When she joined PMPC, she was truly grateful to avail herself of credit to fully support her business. Just the way she takes care her hog raising business, she does with her membership in PMPC. She wants to maintain her membership in good standing so she can always request financing needs. Now, the loan of PHP 10,500 will help her to increase the number of hogs she has to sell. Alma hopes that her business will grow and she will be able to help her family to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
Cleofe is 53 years old and has five children. She is married and has one child who is still in school.

Cleofe is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Cleofe has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vaccines, feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mavuno Group

texts.en:
Musa is in his late twenties. He is married and has one school-aged daughter. For three years, he has run a business selling second hand clothes, known as Mitumba. He sells from 8am to 5pm daily and is able to realize a good profit each month.

This is his third credit request from Kiva partner's Tujijenge Tanzania, to be apportioned among MAVUNO, a group of five members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. With his previous loans, that he has since paid back successfully, he used to buy more stock which he resold. Musa managed to receive an extra income which he used to cover school fees and household expenses. He dreams to manage a big shop selling clothes.

Musa will use his portion of credit to buy stock of clothes.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothes.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 42-year-old married woman with three children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Rebecca has a cafeteria business in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a loan of 7000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her cafeteria business.

Rebecca has been in this business for five years. In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her cafeteria business.

loans.name: Rando

texts.en:
Rando wants to become a ship captain in the future. He studied to be a Seafarer at CMTI and wants to become successful in his career. He is the son of a farmer and has seven siblings, five of whom are already married. He is determined to find success in his career in order to support his family in the future. 

Rando borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku MPC to pay his school tuition fees for the first semester. Rando is thankful to GDMPC for giving him a chance to continue.

loans.use: to pay his school tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Resty

texts.en: Resty is a 30-year-old married lady with two children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a retailer and at the same time grows onions and tomatoes. She faces challenges of  debtors who take long to pay. However, she hopes to buy a plot of land for expansion of her plantation. Resty needs a loan to buy sugar, salt and soap among other items for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar, salt and soap among other items for resale.

loans.name: Seezi

texts.en: Seezi is a 38-year-old married man who lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He deals in selling produce alongside farming to raise income to meet his family's demands. He is challenged by weather changes hindering transportation of his products, but through hard work, he hopes to grow his business. Seezi is requesting a loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize for selling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his horticulture farm to plant more tea and other crops

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a fisherman from the town of Concepcion, Iloilo. He is a widower with four young children, ages 10, 7, 5 and 4. Francis has been in the fishing business for almost 15 years now. Francis needs to work hard knowing that he has four young children to support.

As of now, he is asking for a loan to buy a new boat engine, fishing nets and lead weights. Francis will be able to improve his fishing business through this loan. He believes that through hard work and perseverance, he will be able to support his children, especially for their schooling.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine, fishing nets and lead weights

loans.name: Medy

texts.en: Medy is a 36-year-old mother who has four schooling children. She is engaged in buying and reselling pigs within the local community to help her husband gain income. She aims to make her business profitable to help her husband gain income. She wants to acquire more pigs to sell but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she would like to avail herself of a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy more stock of pigs to resell. Through this financial assistance, Medy believes that she will further improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to resell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a 62-year-old married woman from Concepcion, Iloilo. She has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than three years now. This is the source of her income.

Editha works hard to support her husband in their fishing business. As of now, she is requesting a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and floaters. Through this, her husband will be able to improve his catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Editha wants to improve and sustain their business.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, and floaters

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita settled for a living in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, with her family. She has been selling snacks in their village and is raising pigs to make a living. With these activities, she was able to provide for the needs of her family and has repaid successfully her previous loan used for purchasing livestock to raise. 

With her generated revenue, she was able to put up a retail store where she is earning daily. To have more inventory capital, she borrowed a new loan from Gata Daku MPC to purchase more grocery goods for her retail store. Improving her business is her dream, for she wants to ensure a better source of income for the family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods for her retail store

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Matwopig Group

texts.en: Celestine is married with four children and lives in Masindi, Uganda. She has a drug shop that earns income. She also has poultry that generate more income. However, competition from non-professionals who open businesses are a challenge. She has a dream of developing her drug shop into a pharmacy. She is a member of the Matwopig group, where members guarantee each other to acquire a loan. Celestine wants a loan to buy more drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy more drugs to sell.

loans.name: Natalie

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Natalie works hard to support her family.

She has a dried-fish-vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from frozen foods. Natalie is borrowing 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell to customers.

Natalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 50-year-old married man with eight children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer growing coffee and onions. He faces challenges of price fluctuation, but besides that, he has hopes of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. 

William needs a loan to pay for labor and buy a tarpaulin for drying coffee beans.

loans.use: to pay for labor and buy a tarpaulin for drying coffee beans.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet needs a loan to improve her maize and beans plantation. She lives in Masindi, Uganda. She grows maize and beans to earn a living. She desires to build a permanent house for her family. Inadequate capital is a major challenge.

loans.use: to improve her maize and beans plantation

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia is a fish vendor from the town of Concepcion, Iloilo. She is married and a mother of four grown up children. Nemia has been in the fish vending business for more than two years now. Her husband is a fisherman.
 
Nemia is asking for a loan from CEVI of 30,000 PHP to buy more fish to sell. With a loan, Nemia will be able to sell more fish to the market. In the future, Nemia hopes to make her business a success.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Mkatajika Group

texts.en:
Hassan is 29 years old, not married and has one daughter who is at school. For 18 months now, he has run a butcher shop selling meat. He works from 6:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to earn a good profit each month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is his first loan to be shared among Mkatajika, a nine-member group. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 

Hassan will invest his portion of loan to buy stock of meat for his butcher shop. His desire is to grow his butcher shop more and live a better life.

loans.use: to buy stock of meat for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Milton

texts.en: Milton is a 50-year-old married man with 10 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a farmer growing onions and at the same time earns a salary. He faces challenges of weather changes and a limited market. Besides that, he has hopes of educating all his children to higher levels of learning. Milton needs a loan to purchase seeds, rent land, plough, plant, weed, and buy herbicides for his farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, rent land, plough, plant, weed, and buy herbicides for his farm.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
To be young and starting a new family with a fragment of land is a challenge for people in the Kericho area of Kenya. For Joseph, the father of one boy and three girls, he has overcome this challenge and has been practicing mixed farming for the past 10 years. His primary source of income has been selling eggs, tea and milk, and some personal business he engages in to supplement his meager income. 

Joseph passionately loves poultry farming and feeding his poultry makes him very proud. Waking up every day in the morning to collect eggs from his poultry makes him feel fulfilled. Although this humble father makes a profit through selling poultry, the biggest challenge he faces is meeting the demand of the market that is available. He is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. 

Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is an institution that serves poor, small-landholding farmers, Joseph has acquired both financial and technical training. With the loan, he intends to increase his egg production from one crate a day to three crates a day. A crate of eggs goes for 450 KES, and with three crates, he will be making 1,350 KES per day. With the loan, he will be able to increase his income and move from subsistence to more commercial farming. With this loan, he will be able to improve his living conditions and enhance his food security and that of his community.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Nsagasa Farmers Group

texts.en: Joshua used the previous loan to buy sprays for his gardens. He grows tomatoes, onions and cabbages plus has a retail shop for additional income. He started this business so as to raise income to meet his family’s increasing demands. He faces challenges of weather changes and inadequate capital to expand his farming enterprise. However, he is determined to educate his children at university. Joshua has asked for a loan to improve his agriculture enterprise. He is a member of the Nsagasa Farmers Group where members guarantee each other to get a loan, as they don't offer security.

loans.use: to improve his agriculture enterprise.

loans.name: Mwambisi Group

texts.en:
Fatuma, who is in her late 40s, is single with one grown-up son. She has been a food vendor for two years now. She works from 4 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Fatuma's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy maize flour, rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, charcoal and firewood for food vending.  She dreams of taking her son to college.

Fatuma will share this loan with her loan group, "Mwambisi," which consists of 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, rice, sugar, beans, cooking oil, charcoal and firewood for food vending.

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth, a 34-year-old mother settled in Zamboanga del Sur with her family. She has her farm of rice and has been cultivating it for over eight years to make a living.

Her previous loan, used for buying organic pesticides and fertilizer, was repaid successfully. She works hard because she dreams of providing a better education for her child. She took a new loan recently to purchase additional fertilizer. She plans to expand her farm and to use the organic method of farming.. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en:
As a way of gaining income, Cresencia has been engaged in a hog-raising business within the local community. She is 39 years old and blessed with three children attending school. She and her husband help each other in gaining income to sustain their necessities and finance the education of their children. 

She aims to make her business profitable in order to earn a higher income. Having inadequate capital, she would like to avail herself of a loan of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy hog feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs. She is hoping that this financial assistance will enable her to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy hog feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her hogs

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Erick, a 30-year-old husband and father to three good-looking children. He is based in Kimulot, a remote village in the Litein area of Kenya, which is an area with high poultry production and consumption. 

For five years he has been actively involved in mixed farming as a source of income. He has a beautiful and supporting wife who helps him with his farm work and domestic chores. His primary source of income is from milk, tea and some personal business that he does to make ends meet. He passionately loves poultry farming and this can be noticed in how he takes good care of his poultry birds and feeds them. When asked what he enjoys about poultry farming he replied that he enjoys “picking the eggs every day in the morning.” 

However, this humble and honest man faces challenges of not meeting the demand for eggs and also not satisfying his ever-increasing client base. That is why he is requesting a loan - to buy good quality breeds of poultry. Poultry farming is a very profitable business venture and the demand for chicken is always high, being such a popular meal for so many people. Other than increased profits he will benefit from poultry manure hence saving more money that could have been used in buying fertilizer. Through increased income from eggs, selling poultry meat and feathers, he will permanently change his living conditions and secure the future of his school-going children.

loans.use: to buy good quality breeds of poultry.

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
After you’ve met with Jason and his wife, Amber, you’ll feel like you’ve gotten an education on the possibilities for environmentally sustainable landscaping. A married couple of social entrepreneurs whose earlier nonprofit idea was killed by big business, they are looking to change the way small businesses operate in America, and they want to lead by example.

Jason and Amber’s first business idea involved getting consumers to opt-in to have their recycling picked up by the company, which would then invest the CRV proceeds to a charity of the consumer’s choice. Unfortunately, Waste Management (WM) has an exclusive contract from the city to collect recycling door to door, making it effectively illegal for any other entrant to attempt to gain market share in this sector, which they quickly enforced on Jason and Amber upon hearing of them.

Undeterred, Jason and Amber have a new business idea that will allow them to effect a positive change on their community. They are now running a green landscaping business, using everything from propane mowers to a smaller geographical area of operations to minimize their carbon footprint.

They will use their Kiva loan to purchase new professional uniforms, and pay for advertising costs and replacement parts for their tools. 

With the help of Kiva lenders, they will change the way business is done in America for the better.

loans.use: to purchase new professional uniforms, and pay for advertising costs and replacement parts for the tools for an environmentally sustainable landscaping business

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza, a 40-year-old mother, settled for a living in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, with her family. She has been selling fish in their village for many years and she earns better income from this. She was able to put up a retail store and is earning very well from this. 

She has repaid successfully her previous loan used for her fish-vending business. Her husband is a fisherman. To increase sales, she is taking a new loan to purchase more grocery goods for her retail store. She is saving a portion of her revenue for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods for her retail store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a quality dairy cow.

loans.name: Nestor Jr.

texts.en:
Nestor Jr. wants to have a stable job in the future and he believes that it will happen when he finishes his studies. He has four siblings and his parents are working in order to make a living. 

Nestor Jr is studying at CMTI taking up Deck Watch Keeping. To continue studying is the best way to success and he is thankful to GDMPC in making him a part of it. He borrowed a new loan to pay the tuition fees for the first semester. He hopes to become successful in the future.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fees for the first semester.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, 55, is a father of six who practices small-scale dairy farming in Itibo in the Nyanza region of Kenya. The area is popular for tea and banana farming. He has 25 years of experience in farming. His primary income sources are milk, eggs and tea. He grows bananas too for making 'Matoke', a sumptuous traditional delicacy made out of boiled bananas.

James stated that he enjoys dairy farming most because it is the most profitable of all the farming activities. He would like to grow the business but he is experiencing financial constraints.

James is seeking a loan to construct a cow barn. The housing structure will provide adequate bedding and enhance good milking hygiene. The biggest complaint of his is the cost of the building material. His highest monthly expense is farm inputs.

Make a loan and help James improve the state of his dairy farm. He will make more income as a result and repay the loan with no difficulty. Profits from the investment will go to expansion of the business.

loans.use: to construct a cow barn.

loans.name: Kicuucu Tweyimukye Group

texts.en:
Joseph used the previous loan to buy salt, soap, rice, and flour to sell. He is a member of the above mentioned group in which each member guarantees the others in accessing a loan. 

Joseph operates a retail shop alongside farming, and with the proceeds, he has been able to pay school fees for his children. Price fluctuations and the high cost of rent are his major challenges, while his dream is to own a wholesale shop. Joseph intends to use the loan to buy salt, soap, rice, and flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy salt, soap, rice, and flour to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the repair of the fishing boat and buy new fishing nets.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is married with five children. 

Charles has a produce business that sells ground nuts, rice and beans. He also has a transport business that adds onto his daily income. He started all this to be able to cater for the family and maintain the standards of living of his family. He dreams of educating his children, though inadequate capital affects his business. He needs a loan for construction of his house.

loans.use: pay for the construction of his house.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria is aged 55, married and blessed with six children. She has owned and managed a transportation business in their village for almost seven years and earns a net income of PHP 350 daily. Her income on this business is usually spent on their daily expenses. Due to insufficient funds she would like to avail herself of a loan amounting to PHP 13,000 to pay for the repairs and maintenance of her motorcycle. She's hoping that her business will continue to become more profitable.

loans.use: to pay for the repairs and maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Josphine. She is thirty-four years old, married and the mother of seven children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2013.

She earns her living by practicing maize and bean farming as her economic activity. She has benefited much from Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training on enterprise and financial management, which has enabled her to manage her business more effectively. She is borrowing a loan to expand her business by buying seeds for planting and fertilizer so that she can increase her income. This will assist her in catering to the family needs such as food and education.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to buy seeds for planting and fertilizer.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva Lenders! Meet Patrick from Bungoma, Kenya, who is a man from a community not known for farming (Luo), but he is earning a living through agriculture. He is happily married and together with his wife is blessed with five lovely children. 

For the past 2 years, he has been practicing mixed farming, and because of his experience he commands a lot of respect from fellow farmers and is regarded as a mentor. Income from milk, eggs, and running a posho mill have allowed him to earn a decent living. To make the extra coin, he also engages in small personal business. 

Patrick passionately loves dairy farming and the animals on his farm have been given names. Milking and feeding 'Browny' (the name of his cow) makes him very proud. Through milk selling, he has had quite good returns and demand for milk has been growing. He uses his mobile phone a lot, firstly to receive orders from customers, and then to send an SMS to them when the milk is ready for collection. Because of using ICT he has had a competitive edge in his dairy business.

Demand has been overwhelming and he now needs another cow to fully satisfy demand. Therefore he is requesting a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. Patrick does not intend to buy just an ordinary cow, but he wants to buy a distinct breed that is easy to manage and has a natural ability to produce rich creamy milk. The dairy cow will produce between 15-20 litres of milk a day. The increased milk production will translate into more income and Patrick will be able to improve his living conditions and secure the future of his school-going children. 

When anybody listens to Patrick speak, one cannot fail to see that he is an expert in dairy farming. With his passion and determination, he intends to beat all odds. This loan will permanently change Patrick's living standards and there is no doubt that you can find rewarding employment in dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es:
Luis es un joven emprendedor, padre de familia de un pequeño niño, trabaja como Obrero de Campo en su ciudad natal, Ica.
Es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora. En sus tiempos libres le gusta jugar fútbol y cuidar a su pequeño ya que es el motor de su vida.
Debido a los fuertes deseos que tiene de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, Luis va a utilizar el crédito para poder comprar artefactos como una cocina para poder reemplazar la que tiene que ya está en malas condiciones y puede ser un poco peligroso utilizarla. Con esto Luis se sentirá mucho más tranquilo y más adelante podrá terminar de construir su casa para mayor bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Luis is an enterprising young man and a father to a young boy. He works as a farm labourer in his native city of Ica.

Luis is very responsible and hard-working. In his free time he likes to play football and look after his son, as he is Luis' motivation in life.

Wanting to improve his family's quality of life, Luis is going to use this loan in order to buy items, such as a cook, in order to replace the ones he already has, which are not in good condition and potentially dangerous to use. With this item, Luis will feel much calmer. In the future Luis will be able to finish building his house for the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy a cooker for his home.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia works hard to support her family. Florencia is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Florencia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Florencia has been in this business for years now.

In the future, Florencia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius used his previous loan to buy maize and beans to sell. 

He is a farmer and at the same time a retailer. He started his business in the hope of earning a living. He faces the challenge of price fluctuations of agricultural products. He needs this loan to improve his farm in terms of weeding and mulching, among other things.

Julius hopes to increase his capital and have an educated family.

loans.use: to improve his farm in terms of weeding and mulching, among other things.

loans.name: Bosque Del Lirio Group

texts.es: Al grupo solidario Bosque del Lirio lo integran cuatro socios laboriosos, y es coordinado por la señora María Marcelina, quien tiene la edad de 52 años, acompañada, se dedica a la comercialización de leche, hielo y helados en su domicilio desde hace tres años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de quintal de azúcar, vainilla, galones de leche, bolsas, frutas, etc. Con los créditos anteriores la socia ha logrado mantener su negocio, aunque existe días que las ventas son bajas. Otra de las socias es la señora Isabel quien tiene la edad de 63 años y se dedica a la hecha y venta de tortillas en su domicilio desde hace tres años, la señora Iluminada de 68 años de edad, comerciante de ropa de segunda en las principales calles de la capital y el señor Julio Nicolás de 21 años de edad comerciante de frutas en el mercado más populoso de la capital, y por ultimo pero no menos importante Julio Cesar, quien tiene la edad de 25 años y se dedica a la comercialización de frutas y verduras en el mercado más populoso de la capital.
texts.en:
The "Bosque del Lirio" loan group has four hard-working members and is coordinated by 52-year-old María Mercelina. María has a partner and has been making a living selling milk, ice and ice-creams from her home for three years. She is applying for this loan in order to buy a hundredweight of sugar, vanilla, gallons of milk, bags, fruits and more. With previous loans, María has been able to keep her business going, even though there are days when sales are low.

Another member of the group is Isabel, 63 years old, who has been making and selling tortillas from her home for three years. Iluminada is 68 yeras old and sells secondhand clothes on the capital city's main streets. Julio Nicolás is 21 years old and sells fruits and the capital's busiest market and, last but not least, Julio César, 25 years old, also works selling fruits and vegetables and this same market.

loans.use: to buy a hundredweight of sugar, vanilla, gallons of milk, bags, fruits and more.

loans.name: Abed Alnaser

texts.en:
Abed Alnaser is 44 years old and lives with his wife and seven children in Gaza. 

He has been working as a building contractor. His family have been affected by the recent war in Gaza, and his house has been partly destroyed, so he has applied for a loan to rebuild his bathroom and kitchen, and repaint his house. 

He hopes to be able to provide his children with the best living conditions, and he is very grateful to everyone who helps him.

loans.use: to rebuild his bathroom and kitchen, and repaint his house.

loans.name: Veneranda

texts.en:
Veneranda is a woman who stands out for searching for any possible way to obtain resources that will allow her to feed her family. 13 years ago she began making a living selling groceries in her village. 

Veneranda is asking for a loan from Gata Daku MPC to purchase more goods to sell in her retail store. She wants to improve the business as well as the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en: Nilo is married with three children, 50 years old, and resides in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. He operates a general store to make a living, which he has run for six years. He earns a good living to support the needs of his children.  He borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery products to sell. He hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for his family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery products to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of five children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Teresita is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell for her business.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 23 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell

loans.name: Dúo Villa Lobos Ll Group

texts.es: Dúo Villa Lobos ll este grupo esta conformado por la señora Martha Josefa de 53 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de comida y a elavorar costuras, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años,en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para elaborar comida para la venta tambien nececita un poco de telas para la elaboracion de costuras, espera que le puedan ayudar con el credito que esta solicitando Kiva.
texts.en: Martha Josefa, 53, is a member of The Dúo Villa Lobos II Group.  She earns a living selling food and working as a seamstress, having been in business for several years.  On this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to make food to sell.  She also needs fabric for her sewing activity.  She hopes to receive your help through a Kiva loan.

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Emilda

texts.en:
Emilda is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Concepcion, Iloilo. Emilda has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 23 years now. Fishing has provided them the income that they need.

Emilda is asking for a loan to buy a new boat engine and plywood to repair their fishing boat. This loan could help Emilda and her husband to improve their catch, which they can sell in the market. Emilda hopes of improving their standard of living soon.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine and plywood to repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Nsuura 1 Savings And Credit Group

texts.en: Alfred used his previous loan to buy bananas, Irish potatoes and vegetables for resale. He is a member of Nsuura 1 Savings And Credit Group where members guarantee each other in order to access credit, and members hold each other accountable for loan repayments. His main business is selling fresh food and produce. He also works as a farmer in order to boost his income. The main challenges that Alfred faces are price fluctuations and low demand for his products. Despite these challenges, Alfred is accessing credit to buy bananas, Irish potatoes and vegetables for resale.

loans.use: to buy bananas, Irish potatoes and vegetables for resale

loans.name: El Maguey Group

texts.es:
El Maguey es un grupo integrado por 7 mujeres que habitan en una comunidad rodeada de plantaciones de caña. Por las tardes, los jóvenes se reúnen para jugar volibol y lotería. La mayoría de los habitantes siembran maíz y limón en el patio de su casa o a orillas del cerro ya sea para vender o para autoconsumo. 

Las integrantes del grupo son:   
Yolanda- Venta De Refrescos
Aracely- Calzado Por Catalogo
Aidee- Venta De Ilusión
Primitiva-Panadería
Angelina- Venta De Pan
Francisca- Calzado Por Catalogo
Vanessa- Venta De Abarrotes

La señora Primitiva es casada y tiene un hijo que recientemente se casó. Primitiva es muy alegre y trabajadora. Ella está a cargo de una panadería en la cual se procesan cerca de quince costales de harina al día para tener una producción de 2000 piezas de pan (en una temporada de ventas baja). En la panadería de Primitiva, el pan se prepara en un horno de piedra y con fuego de leña, lo que le otorga un sabor muy único al producto. Sin embargo, no son sólo los ingredientes ni el material lo que hacen a cada pieza algo especial. Los 5 trabajadores siempre escuchan música durante la elaboración del pan, comentan que también es una manera de olvidar un poco todo el calor que se guarda en el lugar. El equipo  de panaderos comienza a trabajar la masa a las 8 am, a las 10 am prenden el horno, a las 11 am introducen las charolas y a las 3 pm se tiene pan de diferentes nombres para que a las 4 pm los 7 repartidores (también empleados de Doña Primitiva) lleguen con sus canastas para cargar el pan y comenzar a vender en distintas comunidades. 

Con el préstamo, Primitiva comprará: harina, leña, manteca vegetal, azúcar, colorante natural, ajonjolí, queso, bolsas de papel y más charolas, pues los tiempos de lluvia se aproximan y con ellos una mayor demanda de pan.

El grupo da las gracias a VisionFund México por otorgarles una nueva oportunidad para crecer, incrementar sus ganancias y otorgar una mejor calidad de vida a sus familias. 

*En la imagen: Primitiva viste de blusa rosada y esta parada detrás de la joven de blusa blanca.
texts.en:
The Maguey Group consists of seven women members who live in a community surrounded by sugarcane plantations.  In the afternoons, the youth get together to play volleyball and the lottery.  Most of the locals grow corn and lemon in the backyard of their houses at the foot of the mountain.  They either sell their crops or use them for home consumption.


The members of the group are:   
Yolanda- Softdrink sales
Aracely- Shoes by catalogue
Aidee- Lingerie sales
Primitiva- Bakery
Angelina- Bread sales
Francisca- Shoes by catalogue
Vanessa- Grocery sales

Primitiva is married and has a son who recently got married.  She is very cheerful and hard-working, and runs a bakery which processes around 15 costals of flour a day to produce 2,000 loaves of bread (in the low season).  In Priscilla's bakery the bread is baked in a stone oven with firewood which gives it a unique flavor.  However it is not only the ingredients or method used to make each special loaf.  The five employees listen to music while they make the bread.  They claim it is also a way to forget about the heat where they work.  The bread team begins making the dough at 8:00 a.m. and at 10:00 a.m. they fire the oven.  At 11:00 a.m. they put in the trays and at 3:00 p.m. they have different types of bread prepared for the delivery people to pick up at 4:00 p.m. (Primitiva also employs these people).  They fill their baskets with bread and start selling it in different communities.

Primitiva will use the loan to buy flour, firewood, shortening, sugar, natural food coloring, sesame, cheese, paper bags and more trays because the rainy season is approaching and there will be more demand for bread.

The group is grateful to VisionFund México for giving them this new opportunity to grow, increase their earnings and give their families a better quality of life.

* In the photograph, Primitiva is the one wearing a pink top and standing behind a young woman in a white top.

loans.use: To buy flour, firewood, shortening, sugar, food coloring, sesame, cheese, paper bags and more trays.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a laptop computer to start his education.

loans.name: Sumaya's Group

texts.en:
Sumaya's group is comprised of two hard-working women. Sumaya is 17-years-old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala south region of Uganda. For the past two years, Sumaya has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells fresh food. 

To help expand her business, Sumaya has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more fresh food to sell and will help her generate greater profits and pay rent for the working place. Sumaya hopes that in the future she will be able to own a beauty salon. 

Sumaya is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase for more fresh food to sell.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
Poultry farming is one of the profitable business ventures in Kenya. George, 65, is a mixed farmer from Bungoma, a rural town in Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. This hardworking father of six earns his livelihood through selling milk, crops and some personal business he engages in when harvests are low. He passionately loves poultry farming, and rearing chickens is his hobby. Every day he wakes up in the morning to collect eggs and feed his chickens, and he finds this very fulfilling. Neighbors have been flocking to his compound to buy eggs and through word of mouth, news has spread like fire in the whole village that he has quality eggs. The demand is so high, he cannot fully satisfy it. 

He is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Through the loan he will be able to satisfy the demand, and this will translate to increased income levels. Through Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders, George believes that small-scale farmers like him will be able to benefit from financial solutions. Poultry meat is a very popular meal among many people in his village, and this translates to improved income and better living standards. George will sell eggs for commercial purposes and for home consumption. Increased income will allow George to provide nothing but the best for his family and improve his living conditions. Other than profits, he will benefit from poultry manure and poultry feathers, which will help improve his life.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Ayélé

texts.fr: Ayélé est mariée à un comptable. Elle est âgée de 37ans et n’a pas d’enfants en charge. Elle revend des bazins riches qu’elle achète chez les grossîtes venus du Mali, du Sénégal et autres à ses clients qui se trouvent dans les différents coins de la ville de Lomé.  Son activité qu’elle A démarré en 2007 se déroule de façon ambulante. Elle sollicite de WAGES un troisième prêt pour s’acheter des marchandises (bazins) afin de mieux satisfaire ses clients. elle veut disposer d’aune boutique pour mieux répondre aux sollicitations des clients et prendre soin de ses futurs progénitures.
texts.en:
Ayélé is married to an accountant. She's 37 years old and has no children in her care. She buys "bazin riche" (damask) fabrics from wholesalers coming from Mali, Senegal, and other countries, and sells them as a traveling saleswoman to her customers who live in various neighborhoods of Lomé. She started this business in 2007.

She's seeking her third loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy fabric supplies and better satisfy her customers. She would like to have a shop to better meet her customer's requests, and take care of her future children.

loans.use: to buy "bazin" (damask) fabrics.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 40 shirts, 25 pairs of trousers, and 40 ready-to-wear suits

loans.name: Ericka Del Socorro

texts.es:
Ericka del Socorro es originaria del municipio de El Sauce es una joven de 36 años, madre soltera de una niña en edad escolar.
Se desempeña como secretaria desde hace más cinco años en la escuela de la comunidad La Palma ubicada a 5 kilómetros de dicho municipio.
Ericka no ha tenido una vida tan fácil, ya que desde pequeña se ha sacrificado por trabajar y ayudarle a su madre porque desciende de una familia muy humilde y hoy en la actualidad que es madre soltera la cual tiene que asumir todos los gastos de su hija porque no cuenta con el apoyo del padre.
Desde que su hija inició la escuela hace el sacrificio de llevarla a la escuela donde ella trabaja, viajando en motocicleta para estar puntual en su centro de trabajo, ya que a la hora que ellas viajan no hay autobuses para esa zona y así aprovecha para estar pendiente de su hija.
Ericka en este momento tiene la necesidad de un préstamo para comprar uniforme y zapatos escolares de su hija para las festividades patrias donde todos los alumnos tienen que participar porque es un día que se conmemora en toda Nicaragua.
Espera que los inversionistas de Kiva a través de Ceprodel le apoyen financiándole este préstamo para llevar a cabo su inversión.
texts.en:
Ericka del Socorro is from the town of El Sauce. She is 36 years old and the single mother of a school aged girl. She has worked as a secretary for more than five years in the school of the community of La Palma, located 5 kilometers from El Sauce.

Ericka has not had an easy life. Since she was young she has made sacrifices to work and help her mother because she comes from a very humble family and now she is a single mother and has to assume all of the household expenses because she doesn't have support from the father. 

Since her daughter started school she has made the sacrifice of taking her to the school where she works, traveling in motorcycle to get to her workplace on time. At the time they travel to get there there are no busses in that area so she does that to be able to watch over her daughter. 

Right now, Ericka needs a loan to buy a school uniform and shoes for her daughter for the national festivals in which all of of the students have to participate because it is the day they commemorate Nicaragua.

She hopes that the Kiva investors through Ceprodel support her financially to make this investment.

loans.use: to buy a school uniform and school.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco  tiene 46 años de edad, es soltero y tiene cuatro hijos, el primer hijo que el tiene ya tiene familia separada y a sus tres últimos hijos son excelentes estudiantes de la escuela que les queda cerca de la comunidad, los hijos de Francisco se ha convertido en el motivo de la lucha de trabajar cada día para brindarles un futuro mejor y una mejor condición de vida.
	
Durante 20 años ha venido trabajando con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación en el trabajo de panadero en su casa de habitación ubicado en su comunidad, también teniendo una segunda actividad como agricultor en su comunidad. 

Los fines con que el desea realizar un préstamo, es en la compra de materiales de construcción tales como block y hierro para la construcción de su vivienda y  es para  la realización de su más grande sueño en la construcción de una vivienda para tener las condiciones de vidas adecuadas.

Una de las más grandes aspiraciones de Francisco es poder vender sus productos en su comunidad para que las personas conozcan del trabajo que el y sus hijos realizan, he dar estudios a sus hijos para que lleguen a profesionales
texts.en:
Francisco is 46 years old. He is single and has four children. The oldest son already has his own family and the three younger children are excellent students in the nearby community school. Francisco's children have become the reason he fights day to day to offer them a better future and a better quality of life. 
	
For 20 years, he has worked very hard and with a lot of dedication as a bread baker in his house in the community. He also has a second activity as a farmer in his community.  

The reason he wants to take out a loan is to buy construction materials such as blocks and iron, to build its house. Building his house is his biggest dream, so he can have good living conditions. 

One of Francisco's biggest dream is to be able to sell his products in his community so that people will know the work he and his children do, and to educate his children so they can become college graduates.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Solidario Princesa Group

texts.es:
Solidario princesas
Este dúo está formado por doña María Juana de 38 años de edad, ella tiene 38 años de edad y se dedica a ala agricultura desde ya ase varios años, y regularmente se dedica a  la siembra de ejote, arveja, y siembra de  suchini, ella es originaria de san Mateo Milpas Altas, ella esta solicitando el crédito para la inversión de compra de semilla de ejote y arveja así como abono y foliares, su deseo es que fape la siga apoyando y esperando en Dios tener buenas cosechas para esta temporada.
texts.en:
Solidario Princesas

This duo includes María Juana, aged 38. She has worked as a farmer for several years. She has regularly grown green beans, peas and zucchini. She is from San Mateo Milpas Altas and she is asking for the loan to invest in buying green bean and pea seeds and foliar spray. She would like for FAPE to keep supporting her and she hopes to God that she will have good harvests for this season.

loans.use: to buy green beans and pea seeds and foliar spray for the crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: María Santana

texts.es:
María de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta 2º grado, es madre de 3 hijos.  Su esposo trabaja como jornalero.

Ella elabora y posteriormente vende tortillas en su casa y todos los días, desde hace 7 años, actividad que aprendió de su madre y en los ratos libre le ayuda su hijo a repartir las tortillas en la comunidad, ella también vende platos típicos .

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar maíz, gal y leña,  para la elaboración de tortillas y poder producir mas para tener mas ingresos para sus gastos y poder cancelar la deuda, también cancelara un crédito que tiene pendiente.

   Los sueños de María son preparar académicamente a sus hijos  y hacer crecer su negocio y que Dios le de salud para poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
María is 41 years old, she studied until the 2nd grade and is the mother of 3 children. Her husband works as a day laborer. 

For 7 years now, she has been making and then selling tortillas in her home every day. She learned this business from her mother and in his spare time, her son delivers tortillas in the community. She also sells traditional foods. 

The loan she is requesting is to buy corn, lime and firewood, to make the tortillas and be able to make more, in order to have more income for her expenses and pay off the debt. She will also pay off a loan that is pending. 

María's dreams are to prepare her children academically and make her business grow and that God gives her health to keep on working.

loans.use: To buy corn, lime and firewood, to make tortillas and to be able to make more, in order to have more income for her expenses.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda, is age 60, married, and blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a transportation business in their village for almost three years, and earns a net income of PHP 400 daily. Her net income on this business is usually spent on their daily expenses at home. 

Due to insufficient funds for her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to  pay for the repair and maintenance of her business vehicles. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: To pay for repair and maintenance of her business vehicles.

loans.name: Reuben

texts.en:
Reuben, 35, is a smallholder farmer based in Kipsaiya village, which is situated in the North Rift region of Kenya. He has been doing this work for the last six years to provide for his family of three children. His primary income sources are milk and crops.

Reuben enjoys farming a lot. Looking after his cattle, however, is quickly becoming a serious challenge. His cattle stray from time to time from the designated grazing area into other people's farms. The consequences of this can be very severe, leading to disputes which can escalate to violence and hostility. 

Reuben is seeking a loan to pay for a fencing wire to fence his farmland.

The $25 dollar loan you make will enable Reuben to have small paddocks created by fencing to make stocking more intensive. The paddocks will also be spelled to build up feed supply, which will also force the stock to graze a wider range of plants, and allows the plants to recover after grazing. The fence will also protect his crops from pests such as hares. 

When asked how the loan would benefit his family, he replied, "Improves security in my compound, improves stock management, and keeps my neighbours happy."

loans.use: to fence his farmland

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Concepcion works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Concepcion is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, milk, etc for her food vending business.

Concepcion has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, milk, etc

loans.name: Harukooto Tweimukye Group

texts.en:
Jane has a grocery store where she sells a wide range of food items and firewood. With the money she earns, she has been able to pay school fees for her children. Her major challenge is a lack of preservation equipment for the perishable goods. 

Jane used the previous loan to buy sweet bananas and soda to sell. Her dreams are to operate a wholesale business and to buy a refrigerator.

She will use this loan to buy maize flour and firewood to sell.

loans.use: to buy firewood and maize flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts and accessories needed for the maintenance of the  motorcycle

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa has been helping her husband in their fishing business to make a living. She sells fish in their village while her husband does fishing. Her previous loan used for this business was repaid successfully. She took a new loan recently to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets in order to improve her fishing business. 

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks & nets

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Hello, lenders! Duncan is 62 years of age, ever smiling, and one of the most hardworking men in his village of Kutus, in the area of Kerugoya in Kenya. He has a wife and five children, and wanted to lay a good foundation for his family and grandchildren to come. That is why he started farming and has been practicing mixed farming for the past 36 years. His primary sources of income have been eggs, crops, and some personal business that he does so as to accumulate more wealth. 

Duncan is very passionate about dairy farming and, as he always says, “dairy farming is close to my heart.” He has nicknamed his dairy cow “Wamweru.” Dairy farming in Kenya has seen an upsurge in growth, and milk prices in the recent past have skyrocketed. This has translated to increased earnings for farmers. Duncan, being a very hardworking and visionary farmer, will want to take advantage of the ready market; that is why he is kindly seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to buy a good-quality breed of dairy cow. Duncan has already decided what type of dairy breed he requires and, because of his immense knowledge on preparing hay, his cows will have plenty of food and will produce more milk. 

Duncan projects that the cow he acquires through the loan will be producing more than 10 liters a day. Because there is a ready market for milk, he does not worry too much about competition, and marketing the milk will not be a challenge. He will be selling it directly to the market as well as to big dairy-processing firms, which will result in increased earnings.

Additionally, Duncan has planned that instead of selling the milk in its raw form, he will be packaging the milk, and this will also improve his income. Profits from selling milk will enable Duncan to be very successful. He also plans that through accumulated profits, he will be able to construct a biogas digester to produce energy that he will use in cooking and other domestic chores.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of cow

loans.name: Franteza

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Franteza works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from dried fish vending. Franteza is borrowing PHP 27,000 through NWTF to purchase more boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Franteza has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of fish

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel is a 60-year-old medical practitioner who operates a drug shop as his main business. He is married, and has four children between the ages of  25 and 17.

He operates a drug shop in a rural area. Being an employee of a government health facility, he saw how much people were struggling to get service and decided to begin a private drug shop so that he could provide those services, because he realized there was a need for the services. He is sure with the restocking through the loan that he will realize profits. He supplements this income with small-scale farming. He is hardworking and focused. 

Angel's dream for the future is to see all his children finish school.

loans.use: To buy drugs

loans.name: Ditoma

texts.fr: Femme de 36ans, Ditoma est mariée à un employé d'une société de la place et maman de 03 enfants. les deux premiers âgés de 8 et 6ans sont scolarisés. Elle revend depuis 2004 du charbon de bois, des céréales(mais, haricot...) à domicile. Elle sollicite son second crédit pour acheter plus de marchandises afin de satisfaire les demandes des clients. A l'avenir, elle espère réinvestir dans l'activité et entretenir la famille.
texts.en:
Ditoma, age 36, is married and the mother of three children. Two of them, aged 8 and 6, go to school. Her husband is employed by a local company.

Since 2004, she's been reselling charcoal and cereals (corn, bean, etc) at her home. She's seeking a second loan to buy more supplies in order to meet customer demand.

In the future, she hopes to reinvest in her business and provide for her family.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal, corn, and rice

loans.name: Centro Group

texts.es:
Centro es el nombre del grupo constituido por 7 mujeres responsables, alegres y trabajadoras. El grupo está ubicado en la cabecera municipal. El nombre del grupo se debe a reuniones del grupo se llevan a cabo en el centro del municipio.

Las integrantes del grupo son:

Eugenia-Panadería
Felipa-Venta De Ropa Y Cosméticos
Nisha-Venta De Comida 
Estela-Venta De Ropa Por Catalogo 
Lorena- Venta De Ropa Por Catalogo Y Casual 
Pragedes-Renta De Cuartos 
María-Venta De Ropa

Doña Eugenia tiene 47 años de edad, está casada con el señor Jorge quien se dedica a trabajar en el campo por las mañanas y por la tarde a vender pan para ayudar a su mujer. Desde hace ya 3 años doña Eugenia se dedica a la elaboración del pan es por ello que construyó un pequeño cuarto al lado de su casa donde tiene el horno de gas. Con ella trabaja un sobrino además de su esposo. Con las ganancias obtenidas y sueldo de don Jorge, han remodelado el cuarto poco a poco. Eugenia sueña con tener una panadería más grande que se convierta en una gran fuente de empleo para las personas de su comunidad. Eugenia utilizará su crédito para comprar charolas, harina, rodillos, manteca, azúcar y otro tanque de gas para continuar con la elaboración de pan.

"Gracias por brindarnos nuevamente la confianza y con ella, las ganas de seguir trabajando" comenta Eugenia.

*En la imagen: la prestataria de nuestra historia viste blusa floreada y falda color café.
texts.en:
The group "Centro" has 7 members, who are responsible, cheerful and hard-working women. It is located in the head of the municipality and takes its name from the fact that meetings take place in the municipal center. Group members are: Eugenia (bakery), Felipa (clothes and cosmetics sales), Nisha (food sales), Estela (catalog clothing sales), Lorena (catalog and casual clothing sales), Pragedes (room rental) and María (clothes sales). 

Eugenia is a 47-year old woman who is married to Jorge. Jorge works in agriculture in the mornings and helps his wife to sell bread in the afternoons. Eugenia has been making bread for 3 years, which is why she built a small room to keep the gas oven next to her house, and counts with the help of one of his husband's nephews. Thanks to the earnings she obtains and Jorge's salary, they have been able to make improvements to the room. Eugenia dreams with a bigger bakery that would offer job opportunities to people in her community. 

Eugenia plans to use the loan to buy trays, flour, rolling pins, butter, sugar and a gas tank to make the bread. "Thanks for trusting my business and for motivating me to keep working", says Eugenia. 

*In the photo: the borrower is wearing a flowered blouse and a coffee color skirt.

loans.use: to buy trays, flour, rolling pins, butter, sugar and a gas tank.

loans.name: Edisson Rodolfo

texts.es:
Edison es un joven de 29 años, vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo. Su domicilio queda ubicado en la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, un sector muy conocido por ser una zona muy productiva y comercial. 
Edison desde hace 11 años se dedica a la venta de mariscos, este negocio lo aprendió de su padre con quien comenzó a trabajar, luego de varios años se independizó. Ahora él viaja a las playas de Manabí y Esmeraldas tres veces a la semana a comprar toda variedad de pescado, y en la tarde viene a distribuir el marisco en el mercado central. Le ha ido muy bien ya que también tiene el apoyo de su esposa.
Edison se acercó a solicitar crédito a Fundación Alternativa, porque vecinos del sector han sido beneficiados y le recomiendan por los servicios que brindan. Edison está feliz porque Fundación Alternativa y Kiva pudo ayudarle, con este dinero comprará más mariscos para aumentar sus ventas y poder capitalizarse. Está muy agradecido porque le ayudarán mucho a sus ingresos, luego con estas ganancias desea comprar más mariscos para abrir mercado en otras zonas.
texts.en:
Edisson is a 29-year old young man who lives with his wife and son. They live in the city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados, which is well known for being a very productive and commercial area. Edisson has been selling seafood for 11 years. He learned the business from his father, with whom he worked before becoming independent. He now travels to the beaches of Manabí and Esmeraldas 3 times per week to buy a wide range of seafood, and then sells it in the central market. Things have gone well, given that he also has the support of his wife. 

Edisson requested a loan to Fundación Alternativa after seeing how some of his neighbors had been beneficiaries and following their recommendation. Edisson is glad Fundación Alternativa and Kiva are able to help. He plans to buy more seafood to increase sales and to capitalize. He is very grateful because thanks to the earnings he will obtain he could buy more seafood and expand the business to other areas.

loans.use: to buy seafood and capitalize the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Alindor

texts.es:
Alindor tiene 29 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado se su cónyuge y dos menores hijos de 4 y 1 año de edad, el de 4 años esta en Pronoi de caserío Santa Rosa en el distrito Santo Tomás, tienen casa propia de material rustico un piso, Alindor y su cónyuge son nacidos en caserío Santa Rosa; viven en armonía familiar y en comunión con los miembros de su caserío, viven en la parte rural del caserío Santa Rosa del Distrito de Santo Tomás; provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Alindor es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1,5 has. Variedad catimor, plantación esta en primer año de producción y para 2015 estará en segundo año de producción; tiene terreno agrícola propio donde esta parcela de café, actividad la realiza hace 03 años en caserío Santa Rosa Distrito Santo Tomás, cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café, producto lo vende en su distrito y alrededores.

Adicionalmente cliente se dedica a la actividad pecuaria cría de ganado vacuno y también al cultivo de caña de azúcar para elaboración de aguardiente y productos de pan llevar, todo esto lo realiza en terreno propio en caserío Santa Rosa distrito Santo Tomás. El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento de 1,5 has. de café en producción, con ello asegurara mayor y mejor producción para campaña 2015 y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Alindor is a 29-year old man who lives with his wife and two children, ages 4 and 1. His older son is at Pronoi de Casería Santa Rosa in the district of Santo Tomás. They have a house made of rustic material. Alindor and his wife were born in Satan Rosa. They live in family harmony and in communion with other inhabitants of the small village. Their house in located in the rural part of the village Santa Rosa, district of Santo Tomás, province of Cutervo, Catamarca region, north mountains of Perú. 

Alindor works in coffee plantations and owns 1.5 ha. This is the first year for the current plantation (catimor variety) and 2015 will be the second year. He has some field to cultivate, an activity that he has worked on for 3 years. He has experience in coffee crops and sells the product in his district and surroundings. He also breeds cows and cultivates sugar to make liquor and bread in his own space at Santa Rosa, district of Santo Tomás. 

He will use the loan to cover maintenance for 1.5 has of coffee, which will guarantee a bigger and better harvest in 2015, as well as higher income. This way he will be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to cover maintenance for 1.5 ha. of coffee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase blocks, cement, sand, and iron.

loans.name: Fatima Del Carmen

texts.es:
Fátima, se dedica a vender pescado, conchas, camarones, etc., frescos, el negocio lo aprendió por su cuenta en busca de una fuente de ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares, el negocio lo desempeña desde hace 4 años, no tiene ayuda del extranjero; Fátima comparte su vida con su esposo y sus tres hijos de 9, 7 y 6 años de edad.  
Solicita la ayuda de un crédito para comprar pescado y camarones frescos, aumentara su inventario, atraerá nuevos clientes, tendrá oportunidad de tener mejores ganancias, además contara con capital de trabajo para abastecer su negocio cuando sea necesario.
Sus sueños son poder tener un puesto fijo en el mercado para atender mejor a sus clientes y tener más productos a la venta.
texts.en:
Fátima sells fresh fish, shellfish, and shrimp for a living. She taught herself how to run this business, in hopes for a source of income to cover her family's expenses. She has done this for 4 years now; she doesn't have any outside help.

Fátima shares her life with her husband and their 3 children, who are 9, 7, and 6.

She is requesting support in the form of a loan to buy fresh fish and shrimp. She will expand her inventory and attract new customers, giving her the opportunity to earn more income. She will also rely on capital from her business to stock it when necessary.

Her dreams are to have her own space in the market in order to better serve her customers, and to have more products available for sale.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish and shrimp to expand her inventory and attract new customers

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur MOUSSA est né en Août 1978 à N’Golo-DIASSA, marié, père 3 enfants et réside avec ses femmes et leurs enfants dans la grande famille traditionnelle à N’GOLO-DIASSA un village tout près dans la ville de Sikasso  troisième région administrative de la république du Mali.
Monsieur MOUSSA est un mécanicien de profession, Pour faciliter à ses clients de s’enquérir des pièces auto, il mène des activités d’achat et vente des pièces détachées au sein de son garage. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de joindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso d’où il sollicite un huitième prêt individuel. Ses prêts précédent ont été remboursés correctement.
 Il compte acheter avec ce huitième prêt beaucoup des pièces détachées à savoir des bielles, arbre à came, pistons, jantes et enjoliveurs. Les marchandise (pièces) sont achetées sur places à travers le démontage des véhicules casses pour être vendues par pièces dans son magasin au sein de son garage.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les prêts et son intérêt  et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa was born in August 1978 in N’Golo-Diassa. He's married and the father of three children. He lives with his wives and their children in a large extended family in N’Golo-Diassa, a village very close to the city of Sikasso, third administrative region of the Republic of Mali.

Mr. Moussa is a mechanic by trade. To make it easier for his customers to buy car parts, he also buys and sells spare parts in his garage. He's very much in demand from his customers, thanks to the quality of his products.

In order to satisfy an ever-increasing clientele, he decided to join Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which he's seeking his eighth personal loan. His previous loans were repaid entirely.

He intends to use this eighth loan to buy a large quantity of spare parts, such as connecting rods, camshafts, pistons, rims, and hubcaps. He buys the parts locally from dismantled wrecked cars. He retails them in his shop inside his garage.

With this loan, he foresees turning an average monthly profit of XOF 80'000, to be used in part to repay the loan and interest. The remainder will be invested in his business.

loans.use: to buy car spare parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies such as bronze, iron, aluminum, plastic, and knives

loans.name: Anonymous
