loans.use: to buy a cell phone for better communication with his family.

loans.name: Ruth Anany

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal DULCE NOMBRE DE JESUS, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 37 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es conviviente, la socia se dedica al negocio de sastreria, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual leva bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos, telas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Dulce Nombre de Jesús” communal bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, Cusco department.

She is 37 years old.  She has two children and lives with her partner.  She works as a seamstress.  She has been in this business for a good while now, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her business everyday.  She wants to be able to keep working in order to keep supporting her family.

She is asking for a loan to buy thread and fabric, among other items.

She is thankful for the loan that was granted, and is committed to making her established payments.

loans.use: to buy thread and fabric, among other items.

loans.name: Savithramma

texts.en:
Savithramma was born and brought up in Konnanur Playa in the Mysore district. She studied up to 10th grade. At the age of 16 she got married to Mahadeva and settled in Chennapattana village, which is located at Nanjanagudu Taluk, surrounded by Rajeev Gandhi National Park in the Western Ghat region. The village is at the border of the forest area and has very few basic facilities. There is a school up to seventh grade in the village but for higher studies the children have to go to a nearby village called Hura, which is 12 kms away.
 
Her main occupation is agriculture; she also goes for casual labor in her free time. They have three acres of land that comprises black soil and red mixed sand. They grow cotton, millet, horse gram, and other vegetables depending upon the season and rain. The connecting road to the village is bad and there is very little transportation to the village.
 
Savithramma’s son, Sagar, is in 11th grade and her daughter, Sushma, studied till 12th grade and discontinued studying. 

Their economic condition is very poor as the productivity of the land is less. They are living in a small tiled house with no ventilation to their residence. They spend most of their income on health every year, since the hygienic condition of the house is very bad.

Savithramma is requesting a loan of INR 50,000 to reconstruct her house so that they can have a healthy life.

loans.use: to reconstruct her house.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James, 65, is a resilient smallholder mixed farmer who resides in Riabai village in Central Province of Kenya. He has five children but he's living only with his 60-year-old wife. They have been active farmers for more than a decade to sustain their livelihood. Their primary income sources are milk, eggs, tea and other crops.

James stated that he enjoys making income and fending for himself at this age. He would like to take his farm's operations to another level but lack of funds is still an obstacle.

James is seeking a loan of KES 65,000. He plans to spend KES 20,000 on a chaff cutter, KES 30,000 on poultry and KES 15,000 on feeds for the poultry.
 
James takes animal feed and nutrition very seriously. Animal feed plays an important part in the food chain and has implications for the composition and quality of the livestock products (milk, meat and eggs) that his customers consume. A chaff cutter will help in feed preparation for his dairy animals while he will purchase poultry feed straight off the shelves, which will be consumed not only by the poultry existing at his farm, but also the poultry he will acquire with your loan investment. 

James stated that an increase in income will change the life he is leading with his wife. Financial security is very important to them so as to relieve the burden from their children who are raising their own families.

loans.use: To purchase a chaff cutter, poultry and feeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his building to become a store of cements.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 54 years old and married with five children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Letecia has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from fishing.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 48 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for 17 years and also earns an income from buying and selling livestock. 

She requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, bread, soft drinks, chips, spices, etc.

Rosalinda has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Rosalinda aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, soap, bread, soft drinks, chips, spices, etc.

loans.name: Erick Jose

texts.es:
Erick tiene 39 años de edad es acompañado y padre de dos hijos, es de oficio comerciante se dedica al oficio de taller de soldadura. El primer préstamo lo utilizo para comprar materia prima y le fue de mucha ayuda porque también logro obtener una maquina con la cual trabaja. Su esposa ha sido su ayuda en el transcurso de su negocio y juntos han logrado salir adelante.
Solicita un segundo crédito para la compra de materia prima tales como: hierro, perlines entre otros. Dentro de sus planes futuros está montar otro negocio en sociedad con su hermano.
texts.en:
Erick is 39 years old. He has a partner and is the father of two children. He runs a soldering workshop.

He used his first loan to buy raw materials, and it was very helpful to him because he was also able to buy a machine that he uses in his work.

His partner has been a source of support throughout the course of his business, and together they have succeeded in always moving forward.

He is requesting a second loan to purchase raw materials, such as iron and perlines. His future plans include starting another business in partnership with his brother.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as iron and purlines

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
Miguel de 49 años de edad, estudio nivel básico , esta casado , sus  esposa   se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar  y sus hijos estudian y conviven en la misma casa  y  de penden de ellos.

Miguel es pastor evangélico en la iglesia del mismo cantón donde vive, quien tiene 11 años dedicándose a esa actividad,pero ademas cultiva 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz e imparte clases de música a unos jóvenes de la iglesias que pastorea.


El crédito sera utilizado para comprar abono y herbicidas para su cultivo de maíz.  El cual espera invertir en la milpa y tener mejores ganancias para los gastos de su familia y poder cancelar la cuota del crédito.


 Los sueños de  Miguel, son preparar académicamente a sus hijos  y poder comprar un terreno para construir su propia vivienda.
texts.en:
Miguel is 49 years old, with an elementary school education. He is married, and his wife takes care of the household; his children are in school, and they live with and depend on their parents.

Miguel is an evangelical pastor in the church in his canton [territorial unit smaller than a province]. He has been doing this for 11 years, but he also grows 7,000 square meters of corn and offers music classes to youth from his church.

He will use this loan to purchase fertilizer and herbicides for his corn crops. By investing in his corn, he will earn a better income to cover his family's expenses and pay back the loan.

Miguel's dreams are to academically prepare his children and to be able to purchase land to build his own house.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and herbicides for his corn crops

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 28 years old and single. Grace works very hard to provide for herself.

Grace runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like coffee, snack foods, chocolate drinks, milk, juice, cereals, canned goods, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

Grace has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, snack foods, chocolate drinks, milk, juice, cereals, canned goods, soft-drinks, etc. 

In the future, Grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like coffee, snack foods, chocolate drinks, milk, juice, cereals, canned goods, soft-drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Daisy works hard to support her family.

She has an internet cafe business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Daisy is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy another computer unit and other materials to sell for her internet cafe business.

Daisy has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy another computer unit and other materials to sell.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin, 49, is a hardworking, self-driven and dedicated farmer who is based in Kerugoya, a remote rural town in Kenya. 

This area has harsh weather conditions and poultry farming is a profitable business venture. For the past 20 years he has been involved in mixed farming and through milk and egg selling he has been able to earn a decent income. Although he makes profits, of all the activities he is involved in, poultry farming is closest to his heart. Waking up every morning to feed and collect eggs from his poultry makes him very proud. Feeding his poultry is his hobby. 

Demand for poultry is high in Kerugoya and the supply is low. Edwin being an enterprising farmer will want to take advantage. He is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Because of the harsh weather conditions and rough terrain, poultry farming is the only profitable business venture in Kerugoya. He plans to buy exotic breeds of poultry that have high productivity and high resistance to diseases. 

Through your loan Edwin is going to meet the demand in his area and local market and this will translate to increased income levels and increased profit margins. With your loan, Edwin is going to transform and completely improve his living conditions. 

Increased profits will be used to repay the loan and secure the future of his children through education since education is the key to success.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius, 50, is a spirited, jovial, 50 year-old, smallholder farmer from Bomonyaka village in Kisii, Kenya. Julius has a lovely 43 year-old wife with whom they were blessed with 6 children. For the last 12 years, their primary income sources are milk, sugarcane and profits from a personal business.

Julius is worried about climate change. Crop farming is heavily affected by these changes. He plans to focus on expanding dairy farming since he might be forced to heavily rely on it in future. 

Julius is seeking a loan to purchase a dairy cow. The milk the new cow will produce combined with that of the existing cow will significantly increase the volume of milk sold which means he will make more money. The money will be ploughed back into the business in order to fund expansion and integration of new modern techniques of farming to cut costs and improve efficiency. 

When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?" Julius replied, "Improve living standards."

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Jenifer Yarixa

texts.es:
Jenifer, atiende una tienda de productos varios, vive con su esposo y dos hijos que dependen económicamente de ella, no tiene ayuda del extranjero; su negocio fue fundado por esfuerzos propios, ofrece variedad de productos como papel higiénico, jabón, detergentes, aceite, etc.,  con los que satisface las necesidades de sus clientes, la tienda está ubicada en su vivienda, la abre al público a las 8:00 a.m. y cierra a las 5:00 p.m.; en este momento no representa dificultades.
Invertirá el préstamo en la compra de bebidas, granos, básicos, huevos, pan, golosinas entre otros productos que sean necesarios para tener un negocio más surtido, espera incrementar la mercadería para aumentar sus clientes, ventas y ganancias con las que cubrirá los gastos familiares y respaldara el pago de la deuda.
Jenifer anhela tener un negocio más rentable, tener estabilidad económica para mejorar las circunstancias familaires.
texts.en:
Jenifer runs a general store. She lives with her husband and their two children, who depend on her economically. She doesn't have any outside help.

Through her own efforts, she started her business where she offers a variety of products such as toilet paper, soap, detergent, oil, etc. to fulfill her customer's needs. The store is located in her home, which she opens at 8am and closes at 5pm. At the moment this doesn't present any difficulties.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of drinks, basic grains, eggs, bread, and other products necessary to have a well-stocked store. She hopes to expand her merchandise to have more customers, sales, and income to cover her family expenses and contribute to the loan repayments.

Jenifer dreams of having a more profitable business, giving her the economic stability to improve her family's circumstances.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, basic grains, eggs, bread, etc. to better stock her store

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 35 year old Ugandan man who is married and has four children. All of them attend school. A house helper also stays with them. They are residents of Ikuma in Kagadi.

John is a farmer and a poultry keeper, which is his main source of income, but he also gets additional income from transport. He describes himself as honest and hardworking

John has applied for a loan of 3,000,000 UGX to buy poultry feeds for his chickens and also to buy more chickens.

He dreams of growing his poultry farm to be one of the biggest in the region and also of buying another car to assist him in transporting his products.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Vilma Floridalma's Group

texts.es: Solidario Cosechando Metas La encargada de este grupo es la señora Vilma Floridalma quien desde hace 40 años se ha dedicado a la venta de comidas porque tiene un comedor y también venta de tortillas. Ubicada en la calle principal de su colonia y a un costado del estacionamiento de los buses, ya es muy conocida por los señores pilotos y vecinos, pero más por sus deliciosos platillos que prepara. La demanda de almuerzos ha crecido y ella se ve en la necesidad de solicitar otro préstamo para comprar algunos artículos que le hacen falta en su comedor como carnes, pollo, cerdo, res, mariscos, también la compra de verduras como, tomate, güisquil, papa, arroz, frijol y algunos quintales de maíz para la tortillería.  El dinero que tiene no le alcanza y no les quiere quedar mal a sus clientes. Cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo y sus hijos.
texts.en:
"Cosechando Metas” [Harvesting Goals] solidarity group.  The leader of this group is Vilma Floridalma, who has been working as a food vendor for forty years.  She has a food stand and also sells tortillas.  Located on the main street of her neighborhood, next to the bus parking lot, she is very well-known to the bus drivers and her neighbors alike, especially thanks to the delicious meals she prepares.  

The demand for lunches has grown, and she recognizes the need to ask for another loan in order to buy some items she is missing for her stand, such as meat, chicken, pork, beef, and seafood.  She also needs to buy vegetables such as tomatoes, chayote, potatoes, rice, beans, and some quintals of corn for tortilla-making.  The money that she has won't cover it, and she doesn’t want to fall short for her customers.  

She has the unconditional support of her husband and children.

loans.use: to buy products for her food stand.

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Jenard

texts.en:
Jenard is studying Deck Watch Keeping in the university. He has five siblings and his father is earning from farming. 

He recently joined Gata Daku MPC and has borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester.

Jenard says that his biggest desire is to continue and to finish his studies. By doing this, he will have more financial stability and can enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to pay the school tuition fee for the first semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the maintenance and cleaning of her grape crop

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 58 years old, married and has eight children. 

Erlinda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Erlinda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Erlinda has been raising pigs for ten years now, and has borrowed in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Magali

texts.es:
La socia Magali  ,la socia continua con su negocio de venta  de pollos, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos y alimentos.
La socia se siente contenta por el préstamo pues se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y agradece por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Magali continues with her business selling chickens.  She has had this business for years, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day.  She wants to keep working so that, in this way, she can keep supporting her family.

She is asking for this loan to buy chickens and feed.

She is happy because of the loan, and so she is committed to making her payments on time and is thankful for the help given to her.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed

loans.name: Deguberto

texts.es:
Deguberto tiene 36 años de edad, vive al lado de su cónyuge, no tiene hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia de un piso de material rustico, en una comunidad pequeña, en la parte rural del Caserío Viza, sector la Tuna, vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua. Deguberto mantiene buenas relaciones con los miembros de su comunidad, es natural del Caserío Viza del Distrito Santo Tomás, provincia de Cutervo, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Su comunidad se dedica básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

La actividad que realiza Deguberto es la agricultura, cultiva una has de cafe variedad catimor, de tres años, su predio se ubica en el Sector la Tuna en el Caserío Viza del Distrito Santo Tomas de Cutervo, se dedica a la agricultura hace 25 años, cuenta con mucha experiencia en el rubro; su producción de cafe lo comercializa en el Distrito Santo Tomas de Cutervo. También cultiva dos has de maíz criollo y vende en su mismo distrito.

El destino del crédito será para mantenimiento de una has de cafe de variedad catimor de tres años de edad, con ello asegurará campaña 2015 con una mayor y mejor producción y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Deguberto is 36 years old. He lives with his wife and does not have any children in his care. He lives in his own house made of rustic material, in a small community in the rural part of Caserío Viza, the Tuna sector. His house has running water.

Deguberto maintains good relations with the other members of his community. He is a native of Caserío Viza in the district of Santo Tomás, Cutervo province, Cajamarca region, in Peru's northern mountain range. His community is dedicated mainly to farming, livestock, and commerce.

Deguberto makes his living by farming. He cultivates a hectare of 3-year-old catimor coffee. His piece of land is located in the Tuna sector in Caserío Viza, in the Santo Tomás district of Cutervo. He has farmed for 25 years and has a lot of experience in that line of work. He sells his products in the Santo Tomás district of Cutervo. He also cultivates 2 hectares of creole corn, which he sells in the same district.

The loan will be used to maintain a hectare of 3-year-old catimor coffee, ensuring him a larger and better production for the 2015 season. As a result, he will obtain more income, so he can improve his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to maintain a hectare of catimor coffee

loans.name: Reland

texts.en:
Reland is a 31-year-old fisherman from Concepcion, Iloilo. 

Reland has been in the fishing business for more than six years now. Fishing has provided the income that Reland needs.
 
Reland wants to expand his fishing but lacks the financial resources to do so. He is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, floaters, hooks and buckets. 

Through this loan, Reland will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, floaters, hooks and buckets.

loans.name: Marjorie Joyce

texts.en:
Her name is Marjorie Joyce, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Marjorie Joyce is married to Christopher, an OFW (overseas worker), and is blessed with one child in the elementary level. She manages her own household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income for their daily household needs and for the schooling of her child.

Marjorie has a direct selling business. She sells mostly footwear, cleaning products and some jewelry as well. She buys them at wholesale prices and sells them by the piece at a profit. People nowadays prefer to buy products from dealers for quality and convenience. Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 3,500 in sales every week.

To help her sustain her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan that she will use to buy merchandise items, orders of shoes and add RTW (ready-to-wear) to sell to her customers. Her customers are asking for ready-to-wear clothes they can choose from at their convenience. Filipinos love to dress up in nice but reasonably priced clothes. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her and for a good return of her investment.   

Marjorie dreams of having her own boutique to grow her business so she could send her child to the best school possible. She dreams that she  will finish college and that they live a quiet life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy merchandise items, orders of shoes and ready-to-wear clothes to sell.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 46 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Gemma has been raising pigs for eight years and also earns additional income from fishing.

Gemma is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feeds for her pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Rosa Karina

texts.es:
Rosa de 34 años de edad, vive con su esposo y su dos hijas. Ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas y elotes ya que sus padres no la pusieron a estudiar, debido a que no le veían la importancia que tiene el estudio. 

Rosa se dedica a la venta de pupusas desde hace unos 8 años,  su mamá le enseño el oficio que hoy en día ya tiene experiencia.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar madera, lamina, clavos, para construir una galera para instalar su negocio, ya que esta careciendo del techo. cuando los días que esta vendiendo y se viene la lluvia le toca que andar a la carrera.

Desea principalmente tener su galera para poder instalar su negocio, también  poder comprar mas mesas y sillas  para que cuando los clientes lleguen se sienten cómodos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 34 years old and she lives with her husband and two daughters. She makes a living by selling pupusas and elotes (typical foods) because her parents did not support her going to school because they didn't see the importance in an education.

Rosa has been selling pupusas for 8 years, her mother taught her this skill and today she has lots of experience.

The loan she is asking for will be used to purchase wood, metal sheets, nails etc. so she can build a roof for her business because her locale currently lacks one. On days that she goes out to sell her pupusas and it rains she currently ends up having to leave.

She wants to build a roof first and foremost so she can have a more permanent establishment, she would also like to buy tables and chairs so that her customers can sit comfortably. .

loans.use: purchase wood, nails etc.

loans.name: Mery Ingrid

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal DULCE NOMBRE DE JESUS, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 42 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es soltera, la socia se dedica al negocio de brosteria, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pollos, aceite, entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This woman is a member of the Dulce Nombre de Jesus Community Bank which is located in the district and department of Cusco. She is 42 years old and is a single mother of two children. She has earned her living running a rotisserie for a long time and all is going well thanks to the effort she puts in every day. She wishes to keep on working so that she can continue to support her family.

She is seeking a loan to buy chickens, oil etc. She is grateful for this loan and promises to pay it back according to the established schedule.

loans.use: buy chickens, oil etc.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal DULCE NOMBRE DE JESUS, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio tiene 35 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es conviviente, el socio se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi, él socio  lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de llantas.
El socio se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member pictured here is part of the communal bank DULCE NOMBRE DE JESUS (the sweet name of Jesus). The group is located in the district of Cuzco. The member is 35 years old and has a one year old son. He also lives with his long time girlfriend. He makes a living as a taxi driver and he has run his business for some time now. Everything is going well thanks to the hard work he puts into it every day. He would like to continue working so he can support his family.

He is asking for a loan to purchase new tires.

He is thankful for the people at Kiva and for the loan because it will allow him to meet his pre-established quota.

loans.use: purchase tires.

loans.name: El Esfuerzo 2 Group

texts.es:
El Esfuerzo 2 es el nombre que eligieron los integrantes para identificarse y hace referencia a su esfuerzo para salir adelante.

La localidad donde se encuentra el grupo está rodea por cerros los cuales regalan una vista hermosa al amanecer. Frente al lugar de reunión del grupo hay una pequeña explanada donde los domingos acuden a observar los partidos de futbol de las diferentes comunidades. Cabe mencionar que el mayor atractivo de la localidad es la cascada que se encuentra escondida entre los cañales y el cerro. Tras la cortina de agua hay una entrada a una cueva donde se pueden encontrar pinturas rupestres y estalagmitas. Para entrar al lugar es necesario ir acompañado de una persona especializada y equipo adecuado.

Las integrantes son:

Viviana-Tienda de Abarrotes
Adela- Venta De Mole
Modesta- Venta De Pan 
Laura-Venta De Mojarra
Cruz Inés-Venta De Cosméticos, Perfumes Por Catalogo
Rosalía- Servicio De Molino
Marcela-Venta De Calzado Por Catalogo 
Felicita- Servicio De Molino
Maura-Venta De Abarrotes 

Viviana está casada con el señor Abel, tiene 26 años de edad y un hijo de 1 año. Comenta que la edad de su hijo es la misma que tiene de haber establecido en casa una tienda  de abarrotes pues para comprar café, arroz, huevos, etc. Las ganancias, las invierte nuevamente en la compra de mercancía para la tienda y apoya a su esposo con los gastos de la casa. Con el préstamo otorgado comprará arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, detergente, galletas, café, sopa, harina, frijol y huevos, que es la mercancía que más compran los clientes.

*En la imagen: Viviana viste de blusa rosada y se encuentra de pie.
texts.en:
El Esfuerzo 2 is the name that the members of this group chose and makes reference to their push to be successful.

The town where the group lives is surrounded by mountain peaks that are a beautiful sight to see. In front of the place where the group meets there is a small terrace where they meet on Sundays to watch soccer games. It is worth mentioning just how beautiful this place is with waterfalls hidden between the rivers and mountains. Behind the curtain of water there is an entrance to a cave where one can find cave paintings and stalagmites. In order to get there, you need a specialized guide.

One of the members of this group is Viviana. She is married to Abel, she is 26 years old, and has one son who is 1 year old. She says that her son's age is the reason why she opened her own store, which is located in her home, where she sells grocery items like coffee, rice, eggs etc. The earnings she makes she invests back into purchasing more product for her store like cookies, coffee, soup, flour, beans and eggs because these are the items that her customers purchase the most.

In the photo, Viviana is in a pink blouse and is standing.

loans.use: purchase rice, sugar, milk, oil, detergent, cookies, coffee and more.

location.town: Cañada san Antonio,  Acatlan de Perez Figueroa, Oa

loans.name: Maxima

texts.en:
Maxima is thankful that she was granted a 10,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their basic daily needs. 
 
She would like to apply now for another loan in the amount of PHP 11,000 which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. More items displayed at the store will mean more sales, and thus an increase in her earnings. This will definitely help to sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to her.

Maxima hopes to expand her store and to grow her business. She dreams of giving her family a better life and of sending her children to the best schools. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Teodora is 41 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines, and she is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional rice seeds for her business. She has been farming rice for 15 years and she also earns additional income from food vending.

Teodora is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional rice seeds for her business

loans.name: Uthuman

texts.en:
Uthuman used the previous loan to buy solar panels for his house. His business is running a retail shop. He gets additional income from phone charging, motorcycle transportation and teaching. He is facing challenges of the high costs of products and general price fluctuations. However, he has a vision of having a steady business fully stocked to capacity so as to attract more customers and increase his profits plus lighting his house with solar power since they don't have hydro electricity in his village. 

Uthuman has asked for a loan to complete payment for land for his house construction at home.

loans.use: To complete payment for land for his house construction.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 54 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. Bernadeth works very hard to provide for them.

Bernadeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Bernadeth has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Bernadeth would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Armenda

texts.en:
Armenda is 38 years old and married with five children, and she works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Armenda has borrowed and repaid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Elsie works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. 

Elsie is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell for her general store business. Elsie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 16 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en:
Elnora is 45 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Elnora has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Elnora aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders! Meet Meshack, 44, who lives in his own home that is made out of rustic materials. He has 7 children. He has very good personal and work references in his community, located in the remote village of Bonyamara, Kisii Kenya. Meshack is a farmer with 10 years of experience, specifically in practicing dairy farming. He passionately loves dairy farming. Milking and feeding his own cow is the most enjoyable part about farming. 

He is very appreciative that dairy farming has been able to sustain farmers in his village. Profits from milk sales have enabled him to take care of his family, and he has always yearned to have more dairy cows. Accordingly, he is seeking a loan to buy a good breed of dairy cow. He has already identified the breed of cow that he will buy. The cow will be producing between 15-20 liters of milk daily. This breed of cow will be producing milk referred to as the ideal drinking milk, because it will contain adequate amount of fat and the desirable quantities of protein. This cow will certainly boost milk production on his farm, which will translate to more sales volume and better income for him and his family. Because of this high milk production potential, he will save more money to fully repay the loan. He believes that through careful selection and the application of the strict standard of excellence in keeping his dairy cow, he will have more income which will improve his living standards.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Nelson Antonio

texts.es:
Nelson  de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta 4º grado. Su compañera de vida, realiza los quehaceres del hogar y sus hijos estudian y conviven en la misma casa,  vive su suegra con ellos.

Nelson es  agricultor, cultiva 21,000 metros cuadrados de maíz, ademas efectuá viajes en un camión transportando materiales. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para realizar unas mejoras a su camión y comprar fertilizantes para su cultivo de maíz.  

 Los sueños de  Nelson son preparar académicamente a sus hijas  y poder mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Nelson is 38 years old. He studied through 4th grade. His life partner performs household chores. His children are in school, and they live in the same house. His mother-in-law also lives with them.

Nelson is a farmer. He cultivates 21,000 square meters of corn. In addition, he drives a truck that transports materials.

He is requesting a loan to make some improvements to his truck and to buy fertilizers for his corn crops.

Nelson's dreams are to prepare his daughters academically and to improve his house.

loans.use: to make some improvements to his truck and to buy fertilizers for his corn crops.

loans.name: Dúo Rosas De San Juan Group

texts.es: Dúo Rosas de San Juan este grupo esta conformado por la señora Carmen Alicia de 37 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de refacciones, desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para la elaboracion y venta de refacciones agradece a Fape y Kiva la oportunidad que le han dado con el apoyo de creditos.
texts.en:
“Rosas de San Juan” is comprised of two members. Carmen Alicia, 37, has been preparing and selling meals for some years now.

Carmen Alicia is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to prepare and sell meals. She appreciates the opportunity that FAPE and Kiva have given her through their loans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare meals to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 27 years old and married with one child who is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Josephine's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her manicure  business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Josephine is taking out a PHP 9714 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Josephine has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, She will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 27 years. Vilma earns more income from buying and selling fish.

Vilma is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional fishing net for her fishing business. She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fising net

loans.name: Ruditha

texts.en:
Ruditha is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell for her business.

Ruditha has been in this business for 10 years. Ruditha earns additional income from a general store.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Grupo Las Competidoras Group

texts.es:
Magdalena  emprendedora y con mucha ambición hacia el futuro de poder llegar a ser alguien diferente en la vida es soltera de 20 años de edad tiene 2 hijos  el primero tiene 6 años de edad y es  buen estudiante en la escuela de la comunidad donde residen y el segundo apenas tiene 6 meses de nacido, sus hijos han sido el motivo por el que ella se ha decidido a emprender un negocio. (La representante del grupo es la que se encuentra de 1ra de derecha a izquierda la que tiene puesta una blusa de color café)

El trabajo que ella realiza con tanto esmero es la compra y venta de ropas típicas dicha actividad lo realiza en su casa y en lugares cercanos de su comunidad donde ella vive, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de refacciones negocio que realiza con una hermana por más de 2 años porque les genera una ganancia para el bienestar de su familia y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su comunidad.

Ella ha sido un ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se han unido a Magdalena para poder emprender sus negocios para que cada uno de ellas pueda súper y tener ingresos importantes.

El uso que ella le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de mercadería o ropa típica para luego su respectiva venta por los alrededores de su comunidad y así tener un ingreso económico para el beneficio de su familia. 

Uno de sus aspiraciones en los próximos años es ver a sus hijos convertirse en mejores profesionales y que ellos tengan ese futuro de éxito en sus campos laborales y en la vida
texts.en:
Magdalena is a businesswoman with ambitious hopes for the future. She wishes to make something of herself, become someone different. She is 20 years old, single and has two children. Her elder son is 6 and is a good student at the local school. Her second son is just 6 months old. Her children are the reason why she decided to open her business. (She is the group’s representative and is located on the right of the photo wearing a coffee-colored blouse.)

Magdalena has a business buying and selling traditional clothing from her house and in nearby locations. She also sells snacks, a business she started over two years ago with her sister. It provides them with an income for their families and improves the economic conditions of their community.

Magdalena has been an example for the community. Because of her a group of women has started their own businesses so that each of them can get ahead and earn valuable money.  Magdalena herself plans to use the loan money to buy merchandise or traditional clothing and then resell in the surrounding communities. Then she will earn money for the benefit of her family.

One of her goals in the next few years is to see her children with professional jobs so they can have a successful future in the field of work and in life.

loans.use: buy traditional clothing

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy products for training dogs, rubber items, and special food for pets.

loans.name: Edis De Jesus

texts.es:
Edis, es propietaria de una tienda de artículos de primera necesidad, tiene 32 años de edad y su compañero de vida tiene 31 años de edad, tienen tres hijos, un varón de 12 años y dos niñas gemelas de 2 años de edad, todos viven juntos; su negocio está establecido desde hace un año, lo atiende a tiempo completo, la ventaja de dicho negocio es que le permite estar al pendiente de los cuidados de su familia.
Invertirá el crédito en la compra de huevos, aceite, azúcar, granos básicos, bebidas, pan, entre otros productos que son necesarios para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes, espera mejorar el inventario para tener mejores ventas y ganancias.
Sus sueños son crecer con su negocio y dar a sus hijos la oportunidad de convertirse en profesionales.
texts.en:
Edis owns a grocery store. She is 32 years old and her life partner is 31. They have three children: a 12-year-old boy and two two-year-old girls who are twins. They all live together. Edis started her business one year ago and works full-time. The advantage is that she can continue to take care of her family.

Edis will use the loan to buy eggs, vegetable oil, sugar, grains, beverages, and bread, among other products she needs to fulfill her customers’ demands. She hopes to increase her stock levels in order to sell more and make more profits.

Her dreams are to expand her business and give her children the opportunity to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy eggs, vegetable oil, sugar, grains, and bread, among other products for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is a fisherman from Concepcion, Iloilo. He is a widower and a father of three grown up children. Isaac has been in the fishing business for more than 30 years now. This is the source of his income.

Isaac is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets and a new boat engine. Through this loan, Isaac hopes of improving his catch so that he will be able to sell more fish to the market.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and a new boat engine.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a widow residing in Tukuran with her two children. She has been operating a farm, planting and harvesting rice and corn to earn a living. 

She used her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC to buy manure fertilizer for her corn farm and it was successfully repaid. Her rice field needs fertilization and she took a new loan recently to purchase fertilizers. 

She plans to develop cultivated land, to have an abundant harvest and to gain more income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh cabbages for resale.

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es:
José de 30 años de edad,  se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 12 años de edad, este trabajo se lo enseño un tío que siempre lo apoyaba a él en su trabaja y así fue como aprendió el oficio; pero también José por las tarde se dedica a la venta de pan, anda en una motocicleta vendiendo pan por los cantones aledaños, en este trabajo de la panadería le ayuda al hermano y en la mañana hace el trabajo de la agricultura esto lo hace de las 7:00 am a las 11:00 am y la venta de pan de las 2:00 pm a las 6:00 pm 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar 5 sacos de abono para 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y el resto para comprar una ternera que le venden que ya le falta poco tiempo para tener criá.  


Los sueños de José son siempre que Dios le preste vida para seguir cultivando la tierra y vendiendo pan, que el mayor de los sueños es tener una propia panadería, ya que ese negocio da muchas ganancias y de eso sacar adelante a los hijos y que sean unos profesionales en un futuro.
texts.en:
José is 30 years old. He has worked in agriculture since he was 12. An uncle taught him this trade and then helped him with the work. That is how he learned to farm. In the afternoons José also sells bread. He rides his motorcycle selling bread in the neighboring cantons. His brother helps him with the bakery work. He does his agricultural work in the morning from 7am until 11 am and he sells bread from 2 pm until 6 pm.

The loan that he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy 5 bags of fertilizer for 7,000 sq meters of corn and the rest to buy a calf that is for sale that is ready to give birth soon. José's dreams are to continue to cultivate the land as long as God gives him life and sell bread. His biggest dream is to have his own bakery as this business produces lots of profit. With this he could get his children ahead so that they can become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of fertilizer and to buy a calf.

loans.name: Fraida

texts.en:
Fraida, is aged 57, married to a farmer and blessed with three children. 

She owns and manages a business retailing home products in their village. She has had this business for almost 15 years and earns a net income of PHP 400 daily. Her net income on this business is usually spent on their electric bills, and their daily expenses. 

Due to insufficient funds in her business she would like to obtain a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase insect spray, soaps, shampoo, lotions, and dish washing liquid. 

She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase insect spray, soaps, shampoo, lotions, and dish washing liquid to sell.

loans.name: Elias Ivan

texts.es:
Elias es un hombre muy responsable y emprendedor, trabaja en un Estudio Contable de su ciudad natal, Nazca. Estudió con mucho esfuerzo la carrera de contabilidad y hoy que ha terminado su carrera la ejerce con mucho entusiasmo, él cree que le está yendo bien por su buen desempeño laboral y la ética intachable con la que día a día actúa.
Elias está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar un televisor y un equipo de sonido para mayor comodidad en su casa. Más adelante quiere estudiar una Maestría para crecer profesionalmente y amplair sus conocimientos.
texts.en:
Elias is a very responsible and entrepreneurial man. He works in an accounting office in his hometown, Nazca. He studied accounting with great effort, and now that he has finished his career, he practices with great enthusiasm. He thinks that he is doing well as a result of his good performance at work and the perfect ethics with which he proceeds day after day.

Elias is grateful for the support that Kiva lenders have given him. With this loan he will be able to buy a television and a sound system to improve the comfort of his home. In the future, he wishes to get a masters degree in order to grow professionally and expand his knowledge.

loans.use: to buy a television and a sound system.

loans.name: Lolie

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Lolie works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Lolie is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell for her general store business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Lolie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 30 loans from NWTF.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Irene Marie

texts.en:
Irene Marie started the business a year ago. She settled for a living in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, with her family. She has a retail store, selling a variety of grocery goods in their village. 

To allow her to keep her business open in order to continue stocking up with more products, she took a new loan from Gata Daku MPC to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will result in higher sales and a higher income for Irene Marie.

Irene Marie tells us that her biggest desire is to continue working at her store, offering better service and new products to her customers. She wants to improve the general living situation of her family, and with her business, all of this will become possible.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
In 2011, Isaac started farming on a rundown farm in Gesoni village in Kisii area of Kenya. Today, Isaac is 22 years old, married, and has one child. He  provides for his family with the income he earns from crops such as tomato and bananas. In the Kisii community, bananas are very valued. It is a key ingredient in Matoke, the community's staple food.

Isaac is worried about climate change and what it means for his business. Tomatoes also get affected by diseases. Isaac is requesting a loan to diversify into dairy farming. Dairy production is less reliant on weather. Provided the animals get proper health care, feeds, and water, they will produce milk. This
loan will help Isaac to mitigate risks associated with focusing on crop farming alone. Dairy cows provide a regular source of income since the cows are milked every single day. Isaac can sell the milk and use the income to repay the loan and use the remaining amount to settle other business and personal costs. Isaac is striving to be a man by providing his family with a decent quality of life free from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Amanda Miguel

texts.es: Amanda es una joven de 27 años de edad. Desde niña ella ha sonado trabajar y verse como una oficinista es por tal razón que actualmente está estudiando Administración de empresa para hacer realidad unos de sus principales sueños.  Amanda solicita un préstamo para pagar su curso de titulación. Estimando que el préstamo a solicitud le será de mucha ya que podrá desempeñarse profesionalmente cuando termine su curso. Sus principales metas son obtener su título y como su plan a futuro es seguir estudiando y tener un postgrado.
texts.en:
Amanda is 27 years old. As a child she dreamed of working as an office worker; she is currently studying Business Administration to fulfill this dream. 

Amanda is requesting a loan to pay for her degree. The loan will be a great help to her, as she will be able to hold a professional position upon graduating. Her main goals are to get her degree, and to eventually continue her education by getting a graduate degree.

loans.use: to pay for her university education.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en: Elvie is a responsible mother who engages in a hog-raising business to supplement her husband's income. She is 42 years old and blessed with three children. Elvie and her husband aimed to improve their status of living in order to educate their children and give them a better life. In this regard, Elvie wants to acquire more piglets to raise. Having inadequate capital, she would like a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy hog feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. Being a hard-working mother, she believes that someday she will improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Barbara

texts.en:
Barbara is 45 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She has been running this business for 10 years and also earns an income from farming rice. 

Barbara requested an 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of charcoal to sell. She has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan.

Barbara aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina, a mother of three children, resides in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, with her family. For many years, she has sustained her general store and provided for her family. 

Marcelina successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used to improve her inventory. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery items for her retail store. The store is her main source of income, and she needs to offer more goods to increase her sales.

In the future, Marcelina wants to renovate her house and see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items for her retail store

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Nestor

texts.en:
Nestor is grateful that he was granted a 50,000 PHP loan which he used to buy tons of fish needed in his fish vending business. Through his earnings he is able to support his family and meet their daily basic needs.

He would like to apply for another Php 50,000 loan which he will use to buy several tons of fish to sell. It will definitely help maintain and grow his business. His earnings cover his family’s daily needs and his children’s education expenses. He is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to him. 

Nestor dreams of having another place for his fish selling business. He desires to give his children the best education possible so they can have a bright future. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fishing net, gasoline, wood and more for her fishing business.

Analyn has been in this business for nine years. Analyn earns additional income from buying and selling fish.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, so she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Analyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to afford sending her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing net, gasoline, wood and more for her fishing business

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Francisca successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is presenting Francisca's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer de 35 años de edad,  estudio hasta el sexto grado debido a que decidió dedicarse a trabajar con su padre a ayudarle en los cultivos de maíz y frijol y dejo la escuela para poder ayudarlo.

 Él vive solo en su casa, pero tiene una hija de cinco años a la cual tiene que darle la mensualidad para sus cosas necesarias, en su casa solamente vive él. 

Elmer se dedica a la agricultura comenta que aprendió este trabajo gracias a su padre que se dedicaba a la misma actividad y fue así que él adquirió experiencia y ahora puede valerse por sí solo de su trabajo, él trabaja para sus gastos y también sale a trabajar a otros lugares para así poder obtener ingresos económicos y poder tener lo necesario para él y para poder darle la mensualidad a su hija que no vive junto a él.  Trabaja de lunes a sábado en diferentes lugares no tiene un lugar fijo debido a que todos necesitan de su trabajo para poder avanzar más rápido con sus siembras. 


El préstamo que está solicitando, es para recoger sus cosechas, desgranar el maíz y recoger la cosecha de frijoles, y poder embodegar su cosecha.
El sueño de Elmer es seguir estudiando y tener un mejor trabajo, poder reparar su casa o construir una nueva y poder ayudarle a su hija con los estudios y con lo necesario que ella le pida, y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Elmer, age 35, went to school through the sixth grade because he decided to work with his father and help him with the corn and bean crops.  He left school to be able to help him.

He lives alone in his house, but he has a five year old daughter.  He has to give her monthly payments for her necessities.  He is the only one who lives in his house.

Elmer works in agriculture.  He says that he learned this work thanks to his father, who was engaged in the same business activity.  That is how he acquired experience.  Now he is able to get by on his own through his work.  He works for his expenses, and he also goes to other places to work.  He does this in order to be able to get income, to be able to have what he needs, and to be able to make the monthly payments for his daughter, who does not live with him.  He works Mondays through Saturdays at different places.  He does not have a fixed place because everyone needs his work in order to be able to advance more rapidly with their crops.

The loan that he is requesting is to gather the harvests, to de-kernel the corn, to gather the bean harvest, and to be able to store his harvest.

Elmer’s dream is to continue his education, to have a better job, to be able to repair his house or build a new one, and to be able to help his daughter with her education and with the necessities she asks him for.   This way he will be able to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to gather the harvests, to de-kernel the corn, and to store the harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
A hardworking single mother charged with taking care of five children aged two, five, seven, nine and thirteen, Harriet operates a bar in Hoima, Uganda.  She earns additional income from a transport business.

Harriet will use this loan to buy more beer to sell. She hopes to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more beer to sell.

loans.name: Juan Irene

texts.es: Juan  a sus 67 anos de edad es uno de muchos senores que obtenido los beneficios de Kiva.MiCredito de los cuales se siente muy agradecido ya que pudo comprar todos los materiales necesarios para hacer crecer su negocio y junto a el su clientela. Juan solicita un  nuevo prestamos para comprar tela para elaborar camisas y pantalones y leche para comercializarla. Estimando que el préstamo a solicitud le será de mucha ayuda que podrá mejorar sus condiciones de vida y consigo las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio las invierte en la mejora de su humilde casa. Sus principales metas son solicitar un nuevo préstamo para seguir mejorar las condiciones de su casa.
texts.en:
Juan, who is 67 years old, is one of many gentlemen who benefits from KIVA, MICREDITO. He is thankful because he was able to buy all the necessary materials to make his business and his clientele grow. 

Juan is requesting a new loan to buy fabric to make shirts, pants, and to buy milk to sell it. He thinks the requested loan is going to be very helpful, and it will contribute to improve his life conditions and the earnings from his business. He will invest the profits in the improvement of his modest home.

His main goal is to request a new loan to be able to improve his home.

loans.use: to buy fabric to make shirts and pants, and to buy milk to sell it.

loans.name: Gimena Michel

texts.es:
Gimena es una joven que tiene muchos deseos de superación, trabaja como ayudante de cocina en su ciudad natal, Parcona. Con estos ingresos de su trabajo puede cubrir sus estudios superiores en Administración, quiere más adelante convertirse en una excelente profesional y así poder sacar adelante a su familia.
Gimena está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá pagar la matrícula del instituto y así continuar con sus estudios sin ningún inconveniente, más adelante espera convertirse en una profesional exitosa y abrir su propia negocio para que pueda apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Gimena is a young woman who has a great desire to improve herself.  She works as a kitchen helper in her native city of Parcona.  With the income from her work, she is able to cover her higher education studies in administration.  Later on, she wants to become an excellent professional.  This way she will be able to get her family ahead.

Gimena is grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with the help they have provided, she will be able to pay for registration at the institute.  This way she will continue with her education without any difficulties.

She later hopes to become a successful professional and to open her own business in order to be able to support her family.

loans.use: to pay registration fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase food for her food stand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fishing materials like fishing nets, lead weights, hooks and floaters

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita resides in Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur with her family. She has been raising pigs for over six years in order to make a living. The business is doing well, and her number of  piglets has increased

Julita joined Gata Dalu MPC in 2011 and used her previous loan, since repaid, to buy feeding supplies.  She recently requested a new loan to purchase livestock feeds and other supplies.

Julita wants to improve her business in order to improve her family's living standards and to provide her children with a better education in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feeds and other supplies

loans.name: Ariel

texts.en: Ariel is 20 years old and a resident of Poblacion Manukan Zamboanga del Norte. He is a third-year criminology student at Jose Rizal Memorial State University Dipolog City Zamboanga del Norte. With the help of his mother, who is also a member of Paglaum MPC, Ariel is requesting a loan for 7,000 PHP, which he will use to pay his school tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Febei

texts.en: Febie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested another loan from NWTF for 17,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more stocks of rice to sell to her customers. NWTF is presenting Febie's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell.

loans.name: Kerma Small Holders Dairy Group

texts.en:
Pascalia, raising her hand in the photo, is a member of Kerma Small Holders Dairy Group. She is married and has four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) to benefit from trainings on enterprise development and financial management, which has helped her improve her knowledge in business management making her manage her enterprise more effectively. 

Pascalia earns her living by operating a kiosk. She requested a loan, which she will use to further expand her kiosk by purchasing more stocks of basic household commodities, such as flour, soap, sugar, detergents, doughnuts, and rice. She hopes this will enable her to meet the rising demand for her customers, resulting in an increase in her income level. She looks forward to using the anticipated income to support her family's basic needs such as education and clothing.

loans.use: to purchase flour, soap, sugar, detergents, doughnuts, and rice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the workers to install glass in the windows of her house before the winter season

loans.name: Karamat

texts.ru: Карамат 46-летняя замужняя женщина из маленького города Турсунзаде. Она живет там с мужем и взрослыми детьми. Ее муж фермер. Одновременно он помогает жене в ее деятельности. Карамат вот уже более 5 лет занимается животноводством. Она выращивает крупнорогатый скот мясной породы. Карамат обычно закупает для откорма маленьких бычков. Вот и сейчас на сумму запрашиваемого кредита Карамат хочет приобрести еще одного маленького бычка с целью дальнейшего откорма и перепродажи. Благодаря этому кредиту она увеличит доходность бизнеса. Поэтому Карамат очень надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Karamat is a 46-year-old married woman from a small town of Tursun-zoda. She lives there with her husband and adult children. Her husband is a farmer. Concurrently, he helps his wife with her business. Karamat has been involved in animal husbandry for over 5 years. She raises cattle for meat. Karamat typically buys young bulls for fattening up. And and now Karamat wants to use the requested loan to buy another young bull for subsequent fattening up and resale. Thanks to this loan, she will able to increase her business income. This is why Karamat truly hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy a young bull for subsequent fattening up and resale

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 42 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Jacqueline is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Jacqueline has been farming rice for 4 years and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Reymonica

texts.en:
Reymonica is married with two children, and she resides in Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur with her family. To make a living, Reymonica owns and operates a vulcanizing shop business. Her husband is also working to serve their customers. She has been running this for over nine years, earning very well for the family. 

Her previous loan from Gata Daku Multi-Purpose Cooperative that she used for buying equipment has been repaid successfully. To improve her shop, she took a new loan recently to purchase a new portable tire changer and hand tool set. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a new portable tire changer and hand tool set

loans.name: Ahtamjon

texts.ru: Ахтамчон предприниматель, проживающий в городе Душанбе. Ему 53 года. В течение 3 лет он занимается продажей обуви на центральном рынке города. Его жена домохозяйка. У них двое сыновей в возрасте 23 и 19 лет. Старший сын занимается торговым бизнесом вместе с отцом, а младший сын Бехруз является студентом. Он учится во втором курсе Таджикского Национального Университета по специальности фармацевтика. Бехруз любит свою будущую профессию и поэтому с интересом и с усердием учится в университете. Годовой контракт за его учебу в ВУЗе стоит чуть больше 1000 долларов США. Ахтамчон еще в этом году не оплатил за учебу. Он не смог накопить сбережений и поэтому обратился за кредитом. Ему не хватает 1000 долларов США. Он надеется на финансовую поддержку кредиторов Kiva и заранее благодарит их за помощь.
texts.en: Ahtamjon is an entrepreneur living in the city of Dushanbe. He is 53 years old. He has been involved in selling shoes at the central market of the city for 3 years. His wife is a homemaker. They have two sons, who are 23 and 19 years old. The oldest son is involved in the retail business together with his father, and the youngest son, Behruz, is a student. He is in his second year of studies at the Tajikistan National University, majoring in pharmacy. Behruz loves his future profession and, thus, studies at the university with a lot of interest and diligence. His annual university tuition costs a little over 1000 US dollars. Ahtamjon has not yet paid for the tuition this year. He could not save enough and hence requested a loan. He is short 1000 US dollars. He hopes for the financial support from Kiva lenders and thanks them for the help in advance.

loans.use: to pay for his son's university tuition

loans.name: Roxana Carolina

texts.es:
Roxana de 23 años de edad, vive con su mamá y su hija, debido a tiene que trabajar duro para poder comprar los alimentos de cada día,  ya que el papa de su hija no le ayuda.

Roxana solo estudio noveno grado , debido a que su mamá no podía cubrir los gastos  educativos , ya que su papá las  abandono a muy temprana edad; pero su mamá le pudo enseñar los oficios suficientes para desempeñarse en cualquier área de la cocina.
¬
Roxana cuenta con 5años de experiencia en el negocio, ya que desde muy joven empezó el negocio de vender pupusas, enchiladas.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar  una plancha elaborar las pupusas ya la que tiene actualmente es muy pequeña  y para eso necesita del crédito.

Roxana  sueña con tener un mejor puesto de venta, desea con tener una caseta ampliar  su negocio para que le pueda generar más ingresos, darle el estudio a su hija, para que pueda ser una profesional y pueda tener una vida  más tranquila.
texts.en:
Roxana is 23 years old and lives with her mother and her daughter. She has to work hard every day to be able to buy the day's food as the father of her child does not help her. Roxana only studied up to Grade 9 as her mother could not afford to pay her educational expenses. Her father abandoned her at a early age. Her mother taught her enough skills to do anything in the kitchen.

Roxana has 5 years of experience in this business. She was very young when she started to sell pupusas and enchiladas. The loan that she is requesting is to buy a grill to make pupusas as the one she has now is very small, so this is why she needs the loan.

Roxana dreams of having a better sales location. She would like to have a stand to expand her business so that she can generate more income. Then she could provide education for her daughter so she can become a professional and have a more peaceful life.

loans.use: to buy a grill to make pupusas.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George lives in Hoima Uganda. He is a twenty eight year old, single, hardworking father with three children aged eight, six and four years. They all attend school.

He deals in produce, mainly buying and selling of maize, beans and rice supplemented by income from farming. 

He dreams of developing his business and educating his children. He will use the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: El Surcador Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal EL SURCADOR, él banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Pancarhuaylla distrito de Anta, provincia de Anta  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Fortunata tiene 57 años de edad tiene 05 hijos y es viuda, La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia cría a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan,  la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia  a la vez se dedica a la agricultura, la socia  desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de semillas y abono.
Los socios de sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a  cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Al momento de tomar la foto una de las socias tapo parte de la cara de su compañera con su sombrero.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "EL SURCADOR" communal bank which is located in the community of Pancarhuaylla, Anta district, in the province of Anta, Cusco department.

Fortunata is 57 years old, has 5 children and is a widow. She balances her daily activities with her business of raising small animals. She raises the animals to later sell them to her clients that want them. She has been involved in this business for a long time and things are going well for her thanks to the determination she brings to her business each day. She also farms.

She wants to continue to work in this manner so that she can continue to support her family. Fortunata is requesting the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. The members feel grateful for the loan being offered to them and promise to comply with the payment of the installments. At the instant the photo was taken one of the members obscured part of the face of her co-member with her hat.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix and maintain his mototaxi (motorized rickshaw).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tomatoes and irish potatoes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy wax oxide, paraffin and other raw materials for making floor polish.

loans.name: Santa Fe Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SANTA FE” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Reyna es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de comida, venta de abarrotes, artesanía, venta de mantas, servicio de transporte.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Reyna es integrante, ella indica que hace cinco años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de invitación de una campaña de promoción de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicia recientemente, con un pequeño capital y con el aprendizaje obtenido desde niña al apoyar a su madre.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de abarrotes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.
