Un grupo de mujeres se decidieron unirse con Pascuala para poder sacarles el provecho máximo de las tierras de su comunidad ya que está llena de vida para producir cualquier producto agrícola.

Los sueños de ella es la plantación de más banano en las tierras fértiles con que ella cuenta y de esa manera ella quiere apoyar al medio ambiente y así mismo sacar un provecho económico para su familia para que lleguen a profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
There is no shortage of enterprising woman in the country of the eternal spring that is Guatemala, where the woman forms an important part in working the fields. Such is the case of Pascuala, 36 years old, who has 2 children who are students in their community school. (Pascuala is the first one from left to right in the row that is standing in the photo.)

The activity that she carries out with so much pride is banana production in the fertile fields of her community. She has been doing this work for 20 years. She generates good earnings for her family finances, since it is the inheritance that her father was able to give her so that she would have a better quality of life in the future.

Pascuala will use the loan that she is applying for to maintain the banana crop so that it produces its fruit to be taken to the community markets for their subsequent sale.

A group of women decided to get together with Pascuala in order to take maximum advantage of the lands in their community, since it is full of life to produce any agricultural crop.

Her dream is the field with the most banana plants in the fertile lands that she has. In this way, she wants to support the environment and at the same time get an economic benefit for her family, so that they can become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to maintain the banana crop.

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en: Marie Louise is 40 years old. She is married with three children aged between 18 and eight years; all of them go to school. She has a bar and has been working in a business for the past 10 years. After getting her loan, she would like to buy more beer and soda for resale. The profits from the business will be used to buy land for building a house.

loans.use: to buy more beer and soda for resale.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is 27 years old. He is married with two children aged between four and two years, who do not go to school yet. He is a motorcyclist and has been driving for the past four years. With the loan, he would like to buy more spare parts for repairing his motorcycle. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for repairing his motorcycle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes in bulk, to obtain lower prices from wholesalers.

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
Julita is 54 years old and married. She has three children, two of them currently in school. Julita works very hard to provide for them, running a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items, such as soft drinks, canned goods, coffee, sugar, and noodles.

She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. In the future, Julita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business directly selling personal collection and Avon products in the Philippines. Estrellita has been in this business for 13 years now.

She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more Avon and personal collection products to sell to her customers. Estrellita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more Avon and personal collection products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en:
Leila is 57 years old, married, and lives in the village Ghari. She has a husband who gets social assistance from the local government for her family's poor living conditions. Both are involved in agribusiness; in particular they own a vineyard and also two pigs. The income from this activity is hardly enough to meet even basic needs and that's why Leila requested a loan. Her loan application was rejected several times as she was considered as a high risk borrower. Finally, her loan request was approved within the joint initiative between Kiva and Credo.
 
Leila plans to renovate her house and open a family hotel. She will get her own customers seasonally and will be able to generate her own income. The loan will greatly assist Leila and her family, enabling them to improve their living conditions. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to open a family hotel.

loans.name: Greda Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Greda and are on their sixth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The group is made up of two members who are involved in different businesses including car rims, tires, inner tubes and rice. 

The loan that they are seeking will help the small businesses of the group members. Emmanuel is the featured borrower and he states that he joined ID-Ghana four years ago after having been invited by a friend who is a client of the institution. Currently, he has a business selling car rims, car tires and inner tubes. He started this business 14 years ago based on his father's advice.

The loan that they are seeking with help him purchase car rims, car tires and inner tubes in bulk that he will purchase from wholesalers in the city of Accra, and later resell in his shop. He also offers vulcanizing service. This line of work allows him to earn an income with which to support his family financially as he is married and has three children. When asked what he likes about ID-Ghana, he states that he likes the healthcare facility offered by the institution.

loans.use: To purchase car rims, tires and inner tubes in bulk

loans.name: Shanthamma

texts.en: Shanthamma was born and brought to N.R. Mohalla in Mysore town. She did not go to school. At the age of 15, she was married and settled in Chennapattana village located at the border of a forest area with very few basic facilities. They have 1.5 acres of land where they grow cotton, millet, horse gram, and other vegetables depending on the season and the rainfall. Two of her sons are married and settled with their families. They have three grandchildren who are studying in primary school. There is an institution in the adjacent town that is engaged in purchasing organic cotton. Shanthamma supplies cotton to the institution and gets good rates. Shanthamma wants to purchase two milking cross breed cows. She plans to supply milk to the milk collection center every day, which will be the income generation program for her as her income from agriculture is unstable.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Solidaridad Cachimayo Group

texts.es:
La socia Visitación  pertenece al banco comunal SOLIDARIDAD DE CACHIMAYO, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cachimayo, en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

 La socia tiene continua con su negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas entre otros, la socia continua criando a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
Este  préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio, siendo este un grupo que cumple dichas características.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas. 
Los demás socios se dedican a la crianza de animales, tienda de abarrotes, confección,  venta de golosinas, venta de comida, venta de pollipapapas.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en:
Visitación is a member of the communal bank "SOLIDARIDAD DE CACHIMAYO" ["Solidarity of Cachimayo"]. The bank is located in the district of Cachimayo, in the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco.

The borrower is continuing to operate her business raising small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens, among others. She is continuing to raise these animals in order to sell them later to her customers who request them. The borrower is a responsible and hard-working person, and in this way she is helping her family get ahead. 

This loan forms part of one of the lines of credit of the Arariwa Association; its name is "Credi Yapa." This line of credit is provided to borrowers with a good credit history, and this is a group which fulfills these characteristics. 

The borrower is requesting the loan to buy guinea pigs. She feels grateful for the loan provided to her, and she is committed to fulfilling her payment schedule. 

The other members work raising animals, operating a grocery store, making clothing, selling snacks, selling food, and selling pollipapapas [a local food]. 

The person whose face is covered in the photo does not belong to the communal bank.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Edina

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Edina, an ever-smiling young farmer from Kisii County in Kenya. She has defied the common thinking of most Kenyans about agriculture. She is a proud owner of a small parcel of land, on which she has been practicing mixed farming for the past five years. Her primary sources of income are selling eggs and milk, and through this venture she has earned a decent income. She also engages in personal business, in order to make ends meet.

Edina passionately loves dairy farming, and taking care of her cows gives her great joy. She is an early riser and wakes up every day in the morning to go and milk her cows. Although this humble mum has been making profits by selling milk to her neighbors and the local market, she is faced with the challenge of meeting the demand. She is known for having the best quality milk. Through word of mouth, customers have been flocking to her farm for milk. Edina is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow that will produce milk that is high in nutrients and will be able to satisfy the demand. With the loan capital, she will buy a dairy cow that will produce between 10 and 20 litres of milk a day. This will help to fully satisfy the demand.

Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a field partner, she attended training sessions and was taught the best financial management skills. This will help her save more money, in order to repay the loan fully and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a quality breed of dairy cow.

loans.name: Cleopatra

texts.en:
Cleopatra is an entrepreneur from Matobo District, in Zimbabwe. She has been in the business of selling clothes for adults and children for nine months. She also volunteers as a community health trainer, who disseminates health information to the people of her community and in schools.

With the loan that she is requesting from Kiva, she would like to purchase clothes in bulk from wholesalers, where the costs are lower, so that she would be able to sell at favorable prices and attract more customers. This would help her benefit from increased sales and profits. With the additional profits, she would like to pay school fees for her siblings and become financially independent.

loans.use: to increase her stock by buying in bulk, at lower prices, from wholesalers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in the purchase of seasonal clothes for her business.

loans.name: Sugutek Women Group

texts.en:
Ann, raising her hand in the photo, is a member of Sugutek Women Group in Nakuru. She is a single mother, 45 years old, and she has five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her to improve her knowledge in business management.

Ann's economic activity is maize and bean farming. She has borrowed a loan to pay for an extra plot of land for farming, so as to increase her production volume. This will ensure that she satisfies her customers' increasing demand, thus increasing her level of income. She hopes to use the anticipated income to cater to her children's education. 

Ann is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to pay for an extra plot of land for farming.

loans.name: Oyniso

texts.ru:
Ойнисо жительница района Вахш без высшего образования, ей 42 года. Она работает швеей и предоставляет свои услуги у себя дома. Этой деятельностью она занимается на протяжении 10 лет. Ее муж дехканин. У них есть сын и двое дочерей. Их сын Абубакр студент, а дочери София и Судоба учатся в школе. Абубакр учится на первом курсе Медицинского колледжа района Вахш по специальности "Фармацевтика". Его годовой контракт за учебу составляет 820 долларов США. 
К сожалению Ойнисо и ее муж сейчас не имеют таких сбережений, чтобы произвести оплату за этот год. В свзяи с этим Ойнисо решилась обратиться за кредитом в размере 1000 долларов США. Из этой суммы 820 долларов пойдут на оплату годового контракта, а остальная часть на учебные принадлежности. Она надеется, что поймут ее трудное положение и окажут ей финансовую поддержку, в котором она нуждается.
texts.en:
Oyniso is 42 and a resident of the Vakhsh region. She doesn't have a higher education and works from home as a seamstress, a business she has had for 10 years. Her husband is a farmer. They have a son and two daughters. Their son, Abubakr, is a university student, and their daughters Sofiya and Sudoba are in school.

Abubakr is a first-year student in the regional medical college majoring in pharmacy. His annual tuition is $820 USD. Unfortunately, Oyniso and her husband don't have enough resources to pay this sum this year. Therefore, Oyniso decided to look for a loan of $1,000 USD. $820 of this will be used to pay her son's tuition, and the remainder will be used for school supplies. She hopes that her difficult situation will be understood and that she will receive this financial support that she needs.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition and school supplies

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Lucia works hard to support her family.

She has a pig-raising business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Lucia is borrowing PHP 23,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase vaccines, feed, and other supplies for her pig-raising business.

Lucia successfully paid back her previous loan and she is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Lucia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feed, and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Carmencita works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from food vending. Carmencita is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional box of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Carmencita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional box of fish to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Evangeline is 42 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Evangeline has a business selling tobacco in the Philippines. Evangeline requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of tobacco to sell.

Evangeline has been in this business for two years. In the future, Evangeline would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tobacco to sell

loans.name: Ma. Jocelyn

texts.en:
Maria Jocelyn is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ma. Jocelyn is 55 years old and has one child who is still in school.

Ma. Jocelyn has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma. Jocelyn has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Agnes Need

texts.en:
Agnes is 29 years old. She is married with 2 children aged between 5 and 3 years, and one of them goes to school.

She is a tailor and has been working in a business for 4 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more cloth for tailoring. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for consumption and to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for tailoring

loans.name: Razak

texts.en:
“Central University College is the name of my school where I am pursuing a Bachelors of Science degree in Administration as a second year student. Upon completion of this program, the knowledge I acquire will help me to take up any managerial position in a financial institution in Ghana. This means a two hundred percent increment of salary minimum, in which case I will be able to be a bread winner for my extended family and serve as a resource person to my people.
 
Brian Tracy is my role model and he really motivates me to achieve my goal. He has always inspired and educated me on what to do on a daily basis to succeed as a sales person. Brain Tracy has helped me to achieve my full potential and do things beyond my imagination.

Currently I live in Mataheko, a suburb of Accra, but I was born in James Town. James Town is a community in the heart of Accra Central where education is a privilege and not a right. The standard of living is very low, so the little income that people earn is spent for their livelihood and it is hard to save for education. Yet, such people are naturally skillful and talented because part of it comes from the experience living in the area”.

loans.use: To pay his tuition and accomodation fees

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 34 years old. He is married and he and his spouse have been blessed with three children, aged 12, 8 and 2 years.

David is a carpenter. He has been in this business for the last 4 years, earning a monthly income of 9,000 KES. David has requested a loan of 10,000 KES, which he will use to buy more lumber for his carpentry work. With the anticipated profits, he will be able to pay the school fees for his school-going children. This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to open another business and to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy lumber

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy products for use in her salon.

loans.name: Maria Luzviminda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Maria Luzviminda works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from raising pigs. Maria Luzviminda is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Maria Luzviminda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 27 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 42 years old and married with four children. With one child currently in school, Margie works very hard to provide for them.

Margie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stock like canned goods, seasonings, cereals, snack foods, soft drinks, detergent soap, etc., to sell.  She has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, seasonings, cereals, snack foods, soft drinks, detergent soap, etc. 

Margie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock like canned goods, seasonings, cereals, snack foods, soft drinks, detergent soap, etc., to sell

loans.name: Anisie

texts.en: Anisie is 45 years old. She is married with three children between 24 and 20 years old and all of them go to school. She sells clothes and has been selling in this business for the past 10 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more clothes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm inputs

loans.name: Jean Marie Vianney

texts.en: Jean Marie Vianney is 30 years old. He is married with one child, who is one year old. He sells clothes and has been running a business for the past eight years. With the loan, he would like to buy more skirts and blouses for sale. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

loans.use: To buy more skirts and blouses for sale.

loans.name: Ruvy Jane

texts.en:
Ruvy Jane is 29 years old and married, with two children who are currently in school. Ruvy Jane works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her store. Ruvy Jane has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, biscuits, noodles, chocolate drinks, and coffee. 

In the future, Ruvy Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Dative

texts.en: Dative is 31 years old. She is married with two children who are between 11 and 3 years old. One of them goes to school. She sells clothes and has been running a business for the past six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more clothes to sell. The profits from the business will be used to improve her standard of living and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock

loans.name: Adan

texts.es: Don Adán de 50 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de frijol desde hace 28 años se dedica a esta actividad por esa razón coseche buenos cultivos, comercializa sus productos en las agencias de compra-venta de granos básicos, Don Adán vive en casa propia con sus cinco hijos, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de  semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía ya que la zona donde el siembra es muy pedregosa, y así obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Adan is 50 years old and has been farming for several years, especially raising beans for the past 28 years so he has good harvests.  He sells his products to agencies that buy and sell basic grains.  Adan lives in a home of his own with his five children.  He is asking for this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, insecticide, herbicide, etc. so he can improve the land in the image.  This is where he farms and he wants to obtain a better income.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy concrete blocks, cement, sand and iron for construction.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement and concrete blocks.

loans.name: Jose Hugo

texts.es:
José Hugo tiene 39 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y un menor hijo. Vive en casa propia por más de 15años. Él cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. Su familia es muy unida; y la comunidad donde viven está dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería; y está ubicada en distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

José Hugo se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, tales como patos, conejos, cuyes, pollos, gallinas, entre otros. Desde hace más de 05 años aproximadamente. Él necesita del préstamo para la compra de animales menores (patos, conejos, cuyes, pollos, gallinas, entre otros) y alimentos de engorde balanceado para poder aumentar y diversificar su stock de animales; y así poder satisfacer las diferentes necesidades y gustos de sus clientes, lo que se reflejará en un mayor volumen de ventas, lo que le generará mayores ingresos, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejora en su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose Hugo is 39 years old and lives with his wife and son.  He lives in a home of his own and has for 15 years.  He has good personal and professional references from his neighbors.  His family is very united.  His community is a farming and livestock community and is located in the Saña district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Jose Hugo raises and sells small animals such as ducks, rabbits, Guinea pigs, chickens, and others.  He’s done this for about five years and is asking for this loan to buy small animals (ducks, rabbits, Guinea pigs, chickens, and others) and feed so that he can increase and diversify his stock and be able to satisfy his customers’ different needs and likes.  This will increase his sales and income so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a farmer and has been farming for three years now. He is reaping tangible results. He is the breadwinner for his family of five. He lives in his own house, and his dream is to see his family attain an average standard of living.

Joseph used the previous loan to buy fertilizers for his banana plantation. His intention for this loan is to rent a Kisubi banana plantation.

loans.use: to rent a Kisubi plantation.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Susana has requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her store. She has been in this business for five years now.

Susana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Nyanko Do Group

texts.en:
This group was created in October 2013. It is made up of members from the Teshie community and their principal activity is trading in spare parts, noodles, tea, salted fish, millet, maize, and electrical parts.

Amina, who is the featured borrower of this group, is 28 years old, married and has two daughters.

She sells engine oil, gear boxes, spanners and steaming oil. She buys the items from the market and sells to customers at her shop.

Her aim is to expand her business, increase her savings and guarantee the school fees and medical expenses of her children.

The group is in its second loan cycle and will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy engine oil, gear boxes, spanners and steaming oil

loans.name: Ana Marlene

texts.es: Ana tiene 25 años de edad y habita ne casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad. Ella se gana la vida por medio de la venta de pupusas y lácteos. De esta forma junto a su esposo quien es jornalero mantienen la economía del hogar. Ana  desea construir las paredes para un cuarto dormitorio en su vivienda para lo cual solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de hierro, cemento y lámina galvanizada. Expresa que ya cuenta con ladrillo y arena para la construcción.
texts.en: Ana is 25 years old and lives in a home of her own with her husband and four year old son.  She earns a living selling pupusas and dairy products and this is how she and her husband, who is a laborer, support the household.  Ana wants to build the walls of a bedroom in her home and is asking for a loan through FUSAI so she can buy iron bars, cement, and galvanized metal.  She already has sand and bricks.

loans.use: to build bedroom walls.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a furniture making business in the Philippines.

Vilma requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials like wood, nails, paint, etc. for her business.

She has been in this business for seven years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Vilma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials like wood, nails, and paint for her business

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward used the previous loan to buy a motorcycle for his transport business. The responsibility to look after the family rests solely on him. He still has dreams of educating his children up to the university. 

He has operated a retail shop and has also been in a transport business for 20 years now, and his main constraint is inadequate capital to invest in his shop. His dream is to own a wholesale shop and to buy a motorcycle for the transport business so as to increase his daily income. He intends to get another hired driver to ride the motorcycle, who will remit to Edward 80% of his daily earnings. 

Edward needs the loan to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for the transport business.

loans.name: Yane

texts.en:
Yane is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Yane is 28 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her business.

Yane has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and gasoline for her motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Grupo Mujeres Del Socorro Group

texts.es:
Devora es casada y tiene 43 años de edad y es originaria del sector el socorro aldea el triunfo, San Antonio, Suchitepequez lo cual vive ahí más de 20 años, actualmente tiene 2 hijos que están estudiando en el colegio siglo de paz, de San Antonio Suchitepequez y son cursantes de Tercero Básico. (Devora es la que se encuentra de 1ra de derecha a izquierda en la fotografía)

Su actividad productiva para sostener a la familia es la Compra y Venta  de abarrotería lo cual   puso una tienda, en ese sector ya que antes no avía tiendas, y fue ahí donde Devora pensó que una tienda en ese lugar con el fin de dar un servicio a la gente que vivía ahí, ella  lleva más de siete años de realizar esta actividad lo cual le ha funcionado muy bien y la ha dejado una buena ganancia.

El uso del préstamo es para comprar más artículos de consumo diario para la ampliación de su negocio con el fin de proveer y darle un mejor servicio a los clientes a si mismo dar un cambio para que su tienda se vea mucho mejor.

Ella se ha convertido en un ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se decidieron a emprender junta con Devora los negocios para que ellas también mejoren sus condiciones de vida.

Su anhelo más adelante es ampliar mas su negocio con la ganancia que le dejara su tienda y a si  mismo sacar adelante su familia, darles una mejor vida para que ellos se sientan cómodos también construir una casa para que sus hijos hayan donde vivir.
texts.en:
Devora is married, age 43, and is from El Socorro sector in Triunfo village, San Antonio Suchitepequez and has lived there for more than 20 years.  She has 2 children who are currently studying in Siglo de Paz school in San Antonio Suchitepequez and are in secondary school.  (Devora is the first one on the right in the photo.)

The work that she does to sustain her family is buying and selling groceries, which she sells in a store in this area that before didn't have any stores. It was there that Devora thought to establish a store with the goal of providing a service to the people who live there. She has been doing this work for more than seven years, which is going very well and has left her with a good profit. 

The loan use is to purchase more daily staples to expand her business with the goal of providing and giving better customer service and also to change her store so that it looks much better.

She has become an model in the community and for this reason, a group of women decided to undertake their businesses with Devora so that they, too, improve their living conditions.

Her future desire is to expand her business more with the profits that her store will give her and also to get her family ahead, give them a better life, so that they are comfortable and also to build a house so that her children have a place to live.

loans.use: To purchase staple goods for daily use.

loans.name: Dorice

texts.en:
For the past two years Dorice has been selling both new and secondhand clothes and earns a monthly income of about KES 8,000. She is widowed with one child who is 15 years old.

She has applied for her first loan of 20,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan amount to buy more clothes to sell, both new and used. 
 
Dorice will use the anticipated profits to provide for the family's basic needs. She hopes to grow her business and go to a school to learn dressmaking.

loans.use: to add more clothes to sell, both new and used.

loans.name: Dorine

texts.en:
Dorine is 36 years old. She is married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 4 children. Her husband helps provide additional income for the family.

Dorine sells cereals and also weaves baskets to sell. These have been her primary businesses for the last 14 years, earning a monthly income of about Kshs 15,000.

She has requested her 4th loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs 6,000 which she will use to purchase a mobile phone to contact her clients, hence improve her business.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to improve her business further. This is her fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya, after successfully repaying her previous loans.

loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone to help improve her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Activas está en su 1° ciclo  del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas son mujeres muy activas y trabajadoras, es por ello el nombre del grupo, forman parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una persona que se destaca es la Sra. Ceferina quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere seguir que debe trabajar un poco mas y esforzarse de la misma manera.
Ella a través del esfuerzo y por medio de la venta de comidas rápidas que hace, se gana la vida de una manera honrada y digna. Con su sacrificio da a su familia para lo que necesiten para el día a día. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
La Sra. Ceferina  con este préstamo comprara nuevos insumos para sus comidas, como carne, verduras, condimentos, y demás en cantidad, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Activas group is in its first loan cycle in the women's committee program. They are very active and hard-working women, and that is the reason for the group's name. They are a part of the poverty elimination program, and a person who stands out is Ceferina who, in her last questionnaire, showed a poverty level within level one, which follows that she should work a bit more and also expend more effort.

Through her hard work and the sales of fast food that she does, she earns her living in an honorable and dignified way. With her sacrifices, she gives her family what they need day to day.  She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving which will be a great help to her.

Ceferina, with this loan, will purchase new supplies for her food such as meat, vegetables, seasonings, and others in bulk, which will help her to firm up her business plan, which will help her to increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase meat, vegetables, seasonings and others.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 38 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

She has a frozen foods vending business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers.

She has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Liezel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cristina is 33 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Cristina has a meat-vending business in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more meat to sell in her meat stall.

Cristina has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell in her meat stall

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a 49-year-old married lady with four children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She is a retailer, and at the same time has a mobile money business and is a farmer. She started these businesses with a hope of earning a living. 

She faces a challenge of high competition. However, she has hopes of having enough income and having a healthy family. 

Anna needs a loan to buy more sugar, cooking oil, and maize flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, cooking oil, and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 39-year-old married lady with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells timber and is facing challenges of weather changes and price fluctuation. However, she desires to become an international trader. 

Betty needs a loan to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Estrelita

texts.en:
Estrelita is 33 years old and has three children. She is married and has two children who are currently in school.

Estrelita is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines.She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Estrelita has been in pig fattening for three years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Estrelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase some home appliances and furniture for her house

loans.name: Felecian

texts.en:
Felecian is a permanent resident of Katembe, a village in Isingiro district, aged 43 years old. He is married with six children and one dependent from his uncle who died four years ago. All his children and his dependent are in school which forced him to start up a small retail shop dealing in phone accessories in order to earn a living for his family and his dependent. 

His business is running with inadequate capital but he supplements the income with small-scale farming that feeds the family. He started building and has an incomplete house and is therefore asking UGAFODE for a loan of 5,000,000 Uganda shillings to plaster and shutter his house. This will help him to improve the standard of living of his household. He appreciates Kiva lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: To buy shutters, cement, lime and paint

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is 34 years old, married, and, together with her spouse, they have been blessed with two children, ages 15 and five years old. Tabitha has a phone accessories sales business, which she has been running for three years now. She also has a mobile money transfer business. 

She will be using this loan to buy more stocks of phone accessories, such as phone covers and phone batteries. She will also add more money float to her mobile money transfer business as well as purchase phone credit cards to sell. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and also add more phone accessories.

This is Tabitha's first loan term from VisionFund Kenya and her future hopes are to be financially stable and to be able to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy phone accessories.

loans.name: Syombua

texts.en:
Syombua has a grocery business in Tala town and has been running her business for 25 years now. She is married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with 4 children. 

She will using this loan to pay school fees for her child who is in college. She will use the anticipated profits to pay her child's school fees and also to service the loan.

This is her fourth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and she has paid her previous loans successfully. In future she hopes to grow her business and be successful.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emma is 52 years old and has one child who is still in school.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years. Emma successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, shampoo, cereals, cooking oil, biscuits, diapers, etc. to sell. Emma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like canned goods, shampoo, cereals, cooking oil, biscuits, diapers, etc.

loans.name: Dancille

texts.en: Dancille is 34 years old. She is married with one child who is 6 months old. She has a shop and has been running this business for 6 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Dairy farming is something that is more of a passion for Mary than a business. She started pursuing her passion in the year 2008. She is a hardworking and honest farmer who is based in Mwembe, a remote village in the Kisii area of Kenya. She is a proud mother of seven lovely children. For the past six years she has been making a small living through practicing mixed farming. Her primary source of income has been selling milk and eggs to the nearby market. She also engages in a personal business or “side hustle” as she likes to call it, to earn additional income. 

Mary passionately loves dairy farming, but the biggest challenge she has been facing is accessing funds to increase her business. Through Juhudi Kilimo, an organization that supports enterprising farmers, she acquired her first loan which she used to buy an additional cow. She paid the loan back fully. She also benefited from training and the impact of the first loan cannot be underestimated. 

Mary is seeking another loan from Juhudi Kilimo, via Kiva lenders, to buy a quality breed of dairy cow. The cow she plans to buy is not just an ordinary cow, but a quality breed of cow that will be producing between 15-20 liters of milk a day. A liter of milk costs 50 KES; this means she will be making 11 USD a day. From this loan, the life of Mary will permanently change and she will be able to secure the future of her school-going children. She will also assure her aging parents of a secure future. Mary waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Merie

texts.en:
Merie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a rug making business in the Philippines that she has had for 5 years now.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials for her business. Merie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers. In the future, Jane would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feed.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her vegetable-vending business.

Carmelita has been in this business for five years. She earns additional money from raising livestock and food-vending.

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is 56 years old and married with five children. With one child still in school, Celsa works very hard to provide for them.

Celsa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like snack foods, soft drinks, canned goods, beer, shampoo, toothpaste, etc. to sell.

Celsa has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items. 

Celsa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like snack foods, soft drinks, canned goods, beer, shampoo, toothpaste, etc. to sell

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is single and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Evangeline has been in this business for three years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Evangeline would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel, born in 1958, is a small-holder farmer who has been doing mixed farming for the last 15 years in Litein, Kenya. He sells produce from the farm, which includes milk and other crops, at the local market. He also engages in other personal businesses to make enough money to provide for his family of three children.
 
Samwel spends a lot of time tending to his animals and land. Spraying is the activity he finds to be the most enjoyable. Samwel complains that working on the land is becoming more strenuous with age. The one factor contributing to the strain is the type of tools he employs.

Samwel is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase farm equipment. Small-holder farmers usually prefer indigenous tools because they are economical, feasible and sustainable. Despite being common, they are generally not preferred to modern tools since they are inefficient and tiring to use. With your funding, Samwel will be able to afford modern tools that are properly designed to be more comfortable to use and meet farmer's requirements. These tools will make Samwel's work easier and more efficient. This will boost his productivity and income.
 
Money from this investment will go towards his family's basic expenses.

loans.use: to purchase farm implements.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 45 years old. She is married to Johana and together they have been blessed with three children of 19, 17 and 14 years old. Johana helps provide additional income for his family.

Emily runs a food business which she has done for the last 15 years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 35,000. She has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya of Kshs. 20,000 which she will use to buy stock of cereals and food ingredients like tomatoes, onions and beef to prepare meals for her customers.

With the anticipated profits, Emily will be able pay school fees for her school-going children. Her hopes and dreams are to improve her sources of income hence have an established life and business.

loans.use: to buy stock of cereals and food ingredients like tomatoes, onions, and beef

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand his poultry business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Merabu

texts.en:
Merabu runs a clothing shop on a busy street in Mbarara. She operates her business in an area that is next to companies that have employees who want to dress well to further their careers. Her good customer service has earned her a big clientele among the corporate businessmen. 

With this loan, Merabu will buy clothing stock to meet the needs of her clients, whose tastes change from time to time. She is a hardworking woman who appreciates the help she receives from Kiva lenders because this loan will help her make her business sustainable.

loans.use: To buy new clothes for sale.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Edna is 34 years old and her two children are in school.

Edna has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Edna has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom is 42 years old, married, and together with his spouse has been blessed with two children. He does poultry farming and he has been in this business for one year. 

He will be using this loan to buy building material such as timber, iron sheets, wire mesh and nails for building a poultry house. He will be able to rear more poultry. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business. 

This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya and in future he hopes to be successful in his business and be able to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for building a poultry house.

loans.name: Josina

texts.en:
Josina is a 45-year-old woman and is married to Wycliff, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with four children. Josina has been operating a fish selling stall for a period of five years, earning her an income of 15,000 KES at the end of every month.

Josina is now servicing her second loan of 22,500 KES with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the entire amount to buy additional fish to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Josina plans to use the anticipated income to educate her children and hopes to become a successful businesswoman with a bright future.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 34 years old and single.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Gina is borrowing 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Gina has been in this business for six years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Al- Ostora Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Ostora. It consists of four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB.

Noria is the leader of the group. She is a 56-year-old married woman and a mother of six children, living with her family in a rented house in a poor area in Sana'a city. Her husband is an employee with a very small salary which isn't enough to cover the necessary needs of the family. Noria and her family live and sleep in very old furniture. Most of that furniture  is not suitable for life because of its bad appearance. The family can't afford to change that condition and they feel very ashamed because of that condition.

 Noria works hard to improve the living conditions of the household. In order to change all the home appliances and furniture of the house, she needs a lot of money. Unfortunately, she doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, Noria applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase a new bed for their house.

Noria looks forward to making a better future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new bed for her house

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 28 years old. She is married with four children, aged between one and 10; two of them go to school. She has been farming for seven years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for maize. The profits from farming will be used to pay the school fees of her children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for maize.

loans.name: Theoneste

texts.en:
Theoneste is 26 years old. He is married with one child who is four years old and who goes to school. Theoneste has been farming for seven years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizer for maize production. The profits from the farming will be used to pay school fees of his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase an assortment of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Las Preferidas Group

texts.es:
Este grupo forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, se llama “Las preferidas”, cada una pone su mejor esfuerzo para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lidia quien se dedica al comercio, es decir tiene en su casa venta de bebidas y también el servicio de gomería. Gracias a esta actividad ella puede mantener su hogar e ir aumentando sus ingresos. Según su encuesta se encuentra mejorando su línea de la pobreza. Comenta que su esposo también trabaja y se ayudan a mantener el hogar.
La Sra. Lidia pide este préstamo para poder comprar bebidas varias, y de esa forma poder surtir su negocio y dar a sus clientes lo que necesitan.
texts.en: This group is part of the program to eliminate poverty and is called "Las Preferidas" (The Preferred Women).  Each one of them puts forth their best effort to improve their living conditions.  One of the members is Lidia, who works in her home business selling beverages as well as providing tire repair services.  Thanks to these jobs, she is able to maintain her household and continue increasing her earnings.  According to her application, she has been improving her financial status.  She states that her husband also works and helps with the household.  Lidia is eking this loan to purchase a variety of beverages so that she can stock her business and provide her customers with what they need.

loans.use: purchase a variety of beverages to sell.

loans.name: Santa Teresita Group

texts.es:
Las 17 integrantes de este comité cuentan con diversas actividades, cada una de ellas ponen su mejor esfuerzo para poder ir mejorando en los microemprendimientos que hacen.
Ana es la presidenta de este grupo, una mujer muy trabajadora y ejemplo de labor y de entrega. Ella vende joyas variadas, y pide este préstamo para poder comprar mayor variedad de las mismas, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo hace.
Todas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo.
texts.en: The 17 members of this committee have different businesses. Each of them puts her best effort to get better in all the micro enterprises they have. Ana is the group's president. She is a very hardworking woman and a role model of work and dedication. She sells diverse jewelry items, and is requesting a loan to buy a larger variety of jewelry items so she can continue doing her job. All of them are grateful for the opportunity they are receiving so they can continue with their work.

loans.use: to buy diverse jewelry items to sell.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está en su segundo ciclo del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, están luchando por mejorar las condiciones de vida de cada una de las integrantes por medio del trabajo unido.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Andrea, quien se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza, ella tiene una peluquería que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo pudo montar, y con ello da a su familia todo lo que necesitan para una vida sin privaciones ni necesidades.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra insumos para su peluquería, como tintes, shampoo, cremas, enjuagues y demás para usar en su peluquería, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: This group is entering its second cycle with the poverty elimination program.  They are fighting to improve all of their living conditions by working together.  Andrea is one of the members who has improved her financial situation.  She has a small hair salon that through a lot of sacrifice and effort, she has been able to sustain.  With this salon, she is able to provide her family with everything that they need so that they can have a life without any wants or needs.  She is seeking a loan to purchase supplies for her hair salon such as dyes, shampoo, creams, rinses and other items to use in her hair salon.  This will help her to sustain her business and improve her earnings.

loans.use: purchase dyes, shampoo, creams, rinses and other items.

loans.name: Milton Eliezer

texts.es:
Hace un año, Milton estaba solicitando un crédito para hacer crecer su negocio de venta de piedras canteras, afortunadamente lo logró y se siente muy agradecido con todos los que le ayudaron a cumplir con esa meta. Con el préstamo anterior pudo comprar piedras canteras en grandes cantidades para obtener más ventas y por ende mayores ganancias para sustentar las inversiones en el hogar. 
Ahora, este comerciante de materiales de construcción de 29 años de edad, sigue a cargo de su hijo y de su esposa, por lo que desea seguir creciendo para seguir proveyendo la educación de su hijo y la comida que tanto necesita. Por esta razón, solicita de un nuevo préstamo para comprar más piedras canteras para vender y aprovechar los clientes fijos que tiene. Por el momento no se siente una persona autosuficiente, pero sabe que con el esfuerzo llegará a convertirse en una.
texts.en:
Milton requested a loan a year ago in order to grow his business of selling quarry stones.  Fortunately, he received the loan and he is very grateful for all the help that he received to reach this goal.  With the previous loan he was able to purchase quarry stones in bulk in order to increase his sales, therefore increase his earnings to sustain his household.  

Now, this 29 year old construction material salesman continue to provide for his son and wife, which is why he wants to continue growing so that he can provide his son with an education and the food that he needs.  For this reason, he is seeking a new loan to purchase more quarry stones to sell and take advantage of the loyal customers that he has.  At the moment, he does not feel as if he is self-sufficient, but he knows that through his effort he will become  self-sufficient.

loans.use: purchase quarry stones.

loans.name: Roger Antonio

texts.es:
Dirigir grandes empresas es el sueño de Roger, un joven de 22 años de edad quien estudió Ingeniería industrial para seguir el camino de sus metas. Hace tres años, aun estudiando, empezó a trabajar en el área administrativa de los negocios de sus padres, quienes como microempresarios crearon un restaurante que se ha ido extendiendo hasta tener cuatro sucursales. Los padres siempre han sido el apoyo incondicional del crecimiento de este emprendedor. 
Roger se siente realizado profesionalmente porque terminó su carrera universitaria y consiguió un trabajo, aparte del que tiene con sus padres. En esta nueva etapa laboral es inspector de higiene y seguridad de una empresa privada. Él está solicitando un préstamo para pagar una maestría, pues quiere seguirse preparando profesionalmente para aplicar a la gerencia en algún momento y también para adquirir las herramientas que exige el mercado laboral actual para dirigir con orgullo el negocio de sus padres como hijo único.
texts.en: Roger's dream is to lead large enterprises. He is a 22 year old young man who studied Industrial Engineering to follow the path to his goals. Three years ago, when he was still studying he started to work in the administrative area of his parents' businesses, who as micro entrepreneurs started a restaurant which has grown to four branches. His parents have always been the unconditional support of this entrepreneur. Roger feels professionally fulfilled because he finished his college career and found a job, besides the one he has with his parents. In this new work phase he is a hygiene and security inspector of a private company. He is requesting a loan to pay for a Masters degree, because he wants to keep on preparing himself professionally to apply to management at some point and also acquire the tools required by the current work market so he can lead with pride, as an only child, his parents' business.

loans.use: to pay for a Masters degree.

loans.name: Louise

texts.en:
Louise is 29 years old, married and has a four-year-old child who is attending school. She has been farming for four years.

Louise is applying for a 987,082 RWF loan through UOB to buy more fertilizer for her maize fields. Her profits will be used primarily to build a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for her maize fields.

loans.name: Silvia Lorena

texts.es:
Los pueblos son privilegiados cuando hay manos femeninas detrás de cualquier producción, los esposos se sienten muy apoyados por esposas así, que se dedican además de los quehaceres domésticos también se dedican a realizar actividades que les genera una ganancia.

Silvia es casada de 27 años de edad, ella tiene 3 hijos los cuales son excelentes estudiantes en la escuela que les queda cerda de su comunidad es el motivo que lo a motivado a realizar actividades en su comunidad donde ella vive para tener un ingreso económico para el sustento de su familia ya que los ingresos de su esposo no les favorece para tener una vida digna.

A la actividad que ella se dedica es a la venta de atol y granizadas porque para ella es una fuente importante de ingresos para poder sustentar a su familia y en un futuro darles educación a sus hijos para que ellos lleguen a profesionales.

El uso respectivo que ella le dará el préstamo es para la compra de terreno que desde un tiempo atrás ella ha soñado con comprar para poder dejar un recuerdo para sus hijos para que ellos mejoren las condiciones de vida en un futuro. 

Una de las metas de Silvia es ayudar a su esposo con los ingresos  económicos de igual manera para tener una condición de vida adecuada en su familia.
texts.en:
The villages are privileged when there are women's hands behind any type of production. In this way the husbands feel very supported by their wives, who in addition do the domestic chores and also carry out activities that generate earnings for them.

Silvia is 27 years old and is married. She has three children who are excellent students in the school that is near their community. They are the motivation for her to do work in the community where she lives in order to have an economic income for the support of her family, since her husband's income doesn't allow them to have a dignified life.

The work that she does is selling atol (a cornflour drink) and flavored ices, because for her it is an important source of income in order to be able to support her family and in the future give her children an education so that they can become professionals.

She is going to use the loan to buy land that she has dreamed of buying for some time in order to be able to leave a lasting memory for her children so that they can improve their living conditions in the future.

One of Silvia's goals is to help her husband with the economic income in the same way in order to have adequate living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Al- Barka Al- Geraf Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Barka Al-Geraf and consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER from AMB.

Faten is the leader of the group. She is a 30 year old, single woman, a University graduate, living with her family in very miserable conditions. Her father is the sole breadwinner of the family and his income is not enough to cover all the expenses of the family. 

Due to high rates of the unemployment of the country, Faten couldn't find a job to look after her family. In order to help her father covering the cost of some of the home appliances, Faten decided to start her own business selling ice-cream in the streets. Unfortunately, she doesn't have enough money to do that and the income of her father is not enough to support her financially. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase an ice-cream refrigerator to start her own business purchasing ice-cream and reselling it to people in the streets.

Faten hopes to open a savings account with AMB to provide her family with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase an ice-cream refrigerator and start her own business selling ice-cream.

loans.name: Evariste

texts.en:
Evariste is 33 years old. He is married with 2 children aged between 6 and 8, and both of them go to school. He has been farming for 10 years. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for maize production. The profits from the farming will be used to buy a house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wholesale corn and powdered lime

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette, 37, is married and has two children, aged five and nine, who are going to school. She has been farming for eight years.

Odette is applying for a 1,013,143 RWF loan through UOB to buy more fertilizer for her maize fields. Her profits will be used primarily to renovate her house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for her maize fields.

loans.name: Theogene

texts.en:
A farmer for the past twelve years, Theogene is forty years old and married. He has five children between the ages of three and twenty, all of whom attend school.

Theogene is applying for a 115,648 RWF loan through UOB to buy more fertilizer for his maize fields. His profits will go towards paying school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations.

For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for his maize fields.

loans.name: Marika

texts.en:
Marika is a 39 year old, single woman, from the village of Nagomari. She lives alone and works at the local kindergarten as a school-mistress. Her salary is 200 GEL, which is really hardly enough for living in normal conditions. In order to live better Marika also engages in agribusiness; she has started to grow nuts and sell them seasonally. 

Marika has a great desire to somehow make savings for the future and to be involved in the trading business. She requested a loan from MFO Credo and was approved. She will use it for purchasing a stock of used clothing and start trading locally. She will sell a wide assortment of women's, men's and children's clothing and will have her own customers among her villagers. 

This business will greatly help her to become more profitable and she will be able to make savings and provide a better future for herself. Marika is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving her a chance to generate more income.

loans.use: to start a business trading in used clothing.

loans.name: Willians Nahun

texts.es: Willians de 31 años de edad se dedica desde hace 3 años a la crianza de ganado de engorde y con ese trabajo logra solventar los gastos del hogar, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijas, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de toretes de engorde para seguir con la crianza de ganado y poder obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Willians is 31 years old. For the last three years, he has earned his living raising young beef cattle. With this work, he manages to cover his household costs. He lives in his own house with his wife and their two daughters. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase young bulls to fatten so that he can continue raising cattle and obtain better income.

loans.use: to buy a young bull to fatten

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tomatoes, potatoes, sweet peppers, bananas, plantains, etc to increase and diversify the products that she offers.

loans.name: Ulices Alexander

texts.es: Ulices de 22 años de edad habita en vivienda humilde hecha de lámina junto a su padre. Él es un joven que todos los días demuestra sus deseos de salir adelante y es por ello que se gana la vida como motorista, además su padre se gana la vida como agricultor de papayas lo que le permite aportar a la economía familiar. Ulices desea mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y es por ello que desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que actualmente es de teja las cuales se están quebrando lo que provoca que sus pocas pertenencias se mojen y dañen  y es por ello que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lamina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda.
texts.en: Ulices is 22 and lives with his father in a house made of sheet metal.  Every day Ulices demonstrates his desire to get ahead in life and because of this he makes his living as a driver.  His father makes his living as a papaya farmer which is what allows him to provide for the family.  Ulices wants to improve his family's quality of life.  He wants to replace the roof of his house because currently the roof is made of clay tiles which are breaking, causing their few possessions to get wet and damaged.  Because of this, Ulices requests a loan from FUSAI to spend on galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to replace the roof of his house.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheet metal, wood, and nails to replace the roof of his house

loans.name: Oscar Armando

texts.es: Don Oscar de 66 años de edad vive con su esposa en casa propia, sus hijos son independientes, el posee un taller de carpinteria en su casa desde hace 40 años, tiene muchos clientes establecidos que lo buscan por su buen trabajo y buenos precios, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de madera, barniz, clavos, etc. para poder continuar con su trabajo ya que esa es su unica fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Don Oscar is 66 years old. He lives with his wife in a house that they own. His children are independent.

He has had a carpentry workshop in his house for forty years. He has many established customers who seek him out for his good work and good prices. 

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of wood, varnish, nails, etc., so that he can continue with his work, since it is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy wood, varnish, nails, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Patricie

texts.en:
Patricie is 32 years old; she is married with 1 child age 10, who goes to school. She has been farming for 13 years. 

With the loan from the Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for maize. The profits from the farming will be used to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for maize.

loans.name: Yesenia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Yesenia, comparte la vivienda con su compañero de vida y tres hijos en edades de 13, 9 y 4 años; desde hace tres años fundo un negocio que consiste en la venta de tortillas, cosmético y ofrece el servicio de un molino nixtamal, negocio que nace por motivación propia y por la necesidad de ir mejorando el estilo de vida de su familia, lo atiende con ayuda de una empleada, en un horario de 4:30 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., en la zona no tiene competencia lo que la da una ventaja.
Utilizará el crédito para comprar leña, maíz y algunos repuestos para el molino, le será de ayuda para mantener materia prima en su inventario en lo que queda de la época de invierno, espera mantenerse trabajando, mejor el servicio hacia los clientes y tener ingresos estables.
La visión de Yesenia es tener una mejor estabilidad económica para ampliar su negocio con la compra de ganado y así ofrecer un mejor futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yesenia shares her home with her husband three children aged 13, 9, and 4. Three years ago she started a business selling tortillas and cosmetics, and she also runs a mill for grinding maize. She began the latter business because she needed to improve her family’s standard of living. She has one employee. 

Yesenia works from 4:30 am to 4:00 pm and doesn't have any competition in the area which gives her a competitive advantage. She plans to use the loan money to buy firewood, maize, and spare parts for the mill. These will help her maintain her supplies in what remains of the winter. She hopes to keep on working, improve customer service, and have a stable income.

Yesenia’s hope for the future is to have a more regular income so that she can grow her business by buying livestock so that she can provide her children with a better future.

loans.use: buy firewood, maize, and spare parts for the mill.

loans.name: Selaphine

texts.en:
Selaphine is aged 29 years. She is married with 3 children aged between 1 and 9 and one of them goes to school. 

She has been farming for 8 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizers for maize production. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009).
