Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers for maize production.

loans.name: Cansile

texts.en:
Cansile is 32 years old. She is married with two children, ages of 3 and 8 years old; one of them goes to school. 

Cansile has been farming for nine years. With the loan, she would like to buy more fertilizer for maize production. The profits from farming will be used to buy more maize seeds.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for maize production.

loans.name: Yehowa Akwe Group

texts.en:
The three women of the group Yehowa Akwe all live in nuclear families, and they average 45 years of age and two children, all living in the Teshie-Accra, Ghana area. The women know one another through ties of community, kinship, marriage, and their revenue-generating businesses in the district. They have small-scale businesses involving rice, plantains, yams, cooking rice and stew, and a bakery.

With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to join the micro finance institution ID-Ghana and are now on their sixth loan cycle.

Grace is a major vendor of rice, plantains and yams in Teshie. She intends to use her loan to purchase rice, plantains and yams from the market to sell to customers.

With this loan, Grace hopes to make a good monthly profit that will be used for the children’s sundry needs and also for increasing her capital.

They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase rice, plantains and yams from the market to sell to customers.

loans.name: Salihu

texts.en:
Salihu is a Ghanaian artisan who specializes in hand-carved wood masks and sculptures. He would like to buy raw materials in bulk, including wood, beads, paint, and sandpaper, and hire additional carvers in his workshop.

Salihu has been selling through NOVICA since 2003. This is his story:

"Upon the death of my father, I was sent to live with one of my father's closest friends, a renowned traditional carver to the then Akwamu chief and the people of Akwamu. I worked with him for about 15 years, during which time I learned the styles and techniques of the Ashanti and Akwamu people. My work began to flourish and achieve recognition, and today I have apprentice carvers working with me to learn the art of carving."

"I can't really find words to show my deep appreciation for the people who contribute to the funding of my loan. Allah will bless you all."

Use the link below to view Salihu's hand-carved wood masks and sculptures on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/3753

loans.use: to buy supplies, including wood, beads, paint, and sandpaper, and to hire additional carvers in his workshop.

loans.name: Rene Gregorio

texts.es: René de 50 años es un hombre que está casado y tiene una hija de 12 años con su esposa de 45 años de edad. Él es un hombre reconocido en su cantón por ser trabajador y solidario con sus vecinos, actualmente se desempeña como fontanero en una empresa cercana, en la que trabaja desde hace 16 años. René desea cambiar el techo de la cocina de su vivienda ya que actualmente se encuentra en muy malas condiciones por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de la cocina de su vivienda.
texts.en: René is 50 years old. He is married and has a 12 year old daughter with his wife who is 45 years old. He is a well known man in his canton, considered hardworking and helpful to his neighbors. Currently, he is working as a plumber at a nearby company, in which he has worked for 16 years. Rene wants to change the roof of the kitchen of his house, because it is currently in very bad condition. Therefore, he is requesting a loan to FUSAI to buy: galvanized metal sheet, wood and nails to change the roof of the kitchen in his house.

loans.use: to to invest in galvanized metal sheet, wood, and nails to change the roof of the kitchen in his house.

loans.name: Leonedisa

texts.en:
Leonedisa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs for her pig fattening business.

Leonedisa has been in this business for eight years. Leonedisa earns additional income from a general store.

Leonedisa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Mariafe

texts.en:
Mariafe is 40 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Mariafe is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies for her pigs.

Mariafe has been in the pig fattening business for six years and earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: Gordon

texts.en:
Gordon is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in hand-carved wood art. He would like to buy more raw materials, including wood, sandpaper, stain and polish.

Gordon has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"I was unable to finish secondary school because of economic limitations. I was thus taught how to carve by my brother, and then I moved to the city to seek new opportunities. After a while I returned to my home city and established my workshop there, with moral support from my brother."

"Thank you very much for helping me to get a loan to do my work. I believe your assistance will help me increase sales and be able to buy some dresses for my children for Christmas."

Use the link below to view Gordon's hand-carved wood art on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/2505

loans.use: to buy aw materials, including wood, sandpaper, stain and polish

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is an artisan from Ghana who specializes in hand-carved African masks. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including wood, sandpaper, stain and polish.

Wilson has been selling through NOVICA since 2004. This is his story:

"I became interested in Ghanaian African carvings when I was a child, so after middle school I learned the trade through a man named Mr. Akoffour. Now I have my own workshop and am training three people. I carve different types of masks and each of them has a meaning. My products are unique and my target is to create more."

"I wish for long life for all the people who help make this microcredit possible. I ask for God's blessing for all of you."

Use the link below to view Wilson's African masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/4507

loans.use: to purchase raw materials, including wood, sandpaper, stain and polish.

loans.name: Kwabena Kufuor

texts.en:
Kwabena Kufuor is an artisan who specializes in paintings and batik art. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including cloth and dyes.

Kwabena Kufuor has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:

"When I was a child, I used to draw a lot. I was so interested in art that in school it was the subject I got the highest marks for. Actually, it was a gift - a talent. I later entered art college for a three year diploma in art. For my paintings, many a time I see them in dreams and visions before I actually paint them. I try to use inexpensive but high-quality material like calico, denim, military camp tents, and heavy curtain cloths. I use phone cards for the painting instead of brushes because it gives me the effect that I want."

"I am very very grateful. Previous loans helped me produce new works, and this microcredit will allow me to do the same. Thank you."

Use the link below to view Kwabena Kufuor's paintings and batik art on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/840

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including cloth and dyes.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 34 years old. She is married with one child who is nine years old and who goes to school. Jacqueline has been farming for nine years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer for maize production.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for maize production.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 39 years old. He is married with four children between the ages of 1 year old and 9 years old. Three of his children go to school. 

Alfred has been farming for 12 years. With the loan from the Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizer for maize production. The profits from farming will be used to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for maize production.

loans.name: Jeanne Claire

texts.en:
Jeanne Claire is 36 years old. She is married with two children, ages 5 and 11. Both of her children go to school. Jeanne Claire has been farming for eight years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertilizer for maize production. The profits from farming will be used to buy more maize seeds.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer for maize production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy basic grains, soft drinks, sweets, oil, etc.

loans.name: Ñaupasunchis Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Ñaupasunchis” el banco está ubicado en el departamento de  Cusco.
 Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
La socia Milagros continua trabajando como  diseñadora grafica forma independiente, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como tintes, papeles entre otros.
 La socia se siente agradecida  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
Los socios que salieron adjuntos en la foto pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
La member belongs to the "Ñaupasunchis" community bank. The bank is located in the department of Cusco. In general, the members are grateful for the opportunity provided and are committed to repaying their loans in the established timeframes.

The member Milagros continues to work independently as a graphic designer. She has been doing this work for a good while, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work everyday. The member hopes to be able to continue working in order to continue supporting her family.

The member needs the loan in order to buy dyes and papers, among other things. The member is grateful for the loan, and is committed to making her payments on time. The group members whose pictures are attached to the group photo were given permission to miss the meeting for work reasons.

loans.use: to buy materials such as dyes and papers, among other things.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es una mujer de 42 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene dos hijos de 10 y 5 años y una hija de 14 años, su negocio es la venta de fruta por mayor.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, trabajadora, paciente, luchadora y muy optimista. Su trabajo lo realiza en villa dolores’ en el tambo del barrio. Tambo se denomina al depósito o almacén de frutas, dónde llegan los productores en camiones provenientes de diferentes lugares a dejar su fruta.
Elena es de tez morena, cabello largo negro trenzado, estatura mediana, su forma de vestir es típica (manta, pollera y sombrero) y su lengua nativa es el aymara, también habla español. Ella se dedica a la venta de fruta, en sus inicios su esposo transportaba la fruta desde el norte de la ciudad hasta el Tambo. Actualmente ella realiza la compra por mayor a los productores y la reparte a mercados minoristas. Su sueño es comprarse un camión donde su esposo pueda transportar la fruta. Su vida la comparte con su esposo y sus tres hijos, que asisten a la escuela por las mañanas para ayudar en el comercio por la tarde. Ella desea realizar la compra de fruta por mayor para obtener mejores beneficios económicos y ayuda a su familia.
Es por esos motivos que Elena solicita un préstamo para la compra de fruta de temporada por mayor y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Elena is a woman of 42. She lives with her partner and has two sons, ages 10 and 5, and a daughter who is 14. Her business is selling fruit wholesale.

She is entrepreneurial, independent, hard-working, patient, determined, and very optimistic. She does her work in Villa Dolores in the 'tambo' of the neighborhood. 'Tambo' refers to the warehouse or market for fruit, where the products arrive in trucks coming from different places to leave their fruit. 

Elena has dark skin, long, black, braided hair, and medium stature. Her form of dress is traditional (shawl, skirt, and hat), and her native language is Aymara. She also speaks Spanish. She sells fruit. In the beginning her husband transported the fruit from the north of the city to the tambo. Now she makes her purchases wholesale from the producers and distributes them to the retail markets.

Her dream is to buy a truck that her husband can use to transport the fruit.

She shares her life with her husband and their three children, who attend school in the mornings in order to help in the business in the afternoon. She wants to buy fruit wholesale in order to obtain better economic earnings and help her family. It is for this reason that Elena is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruit wholesale and help her family.

loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit wholesale and help her family

loans.name: Jobito

texts.es: Don Jobito vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica al cultivo de granos basicos(maiz y frijol) desde hace algunos años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos que se le presentan en el hogar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografia para seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su unica fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Jobito lives in his own house with his family. He has grown basic grains (corn and beans) for a few years. He sells his product in the different markets located close to his house. With what he manages to get from his sales he can pay some of the household expenses. He is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc. and improve the land you can see in the photo. He will continue with his work as it is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, manure, pest control, etc. and improve the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Ines

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santa Ana, conocida por sus bellos paisajes y por sus hermosos balnearios de agua dulce que son muy visitados por muchos turistas, cada 15 días se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Nuevos Caminos.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 30 años de edad, está separada y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 10 y 2 años, el mayor estudia en escuela.
Doña Rosa con la intención de ganar algo por su cuenta y con esto salir adelante ella y  sus hijos se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, sale a recorrer por toda la localidad ofreciendo sus productos, vende a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, ella también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes más conocidos, deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, lleva más de dos años dedicada a esta actividad la cual comenzó con uno de los  créditos que recibió del grupo por lo cual esta agradecida ya que así le permiten salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, entre otras prendas. Está en el Grupo De Crédito desde hace  11 años y le gusta porque con los créditos financia su negocio. Sus sueños tener un gran bazar.
texts.en: In the city of Santa Ana, known for its beautiful landscapes and its seaside resorts of freshwater which are visited by many tourists, the members of the Credit Group "Nuevos Caminos" meet every two weeks. Rosa lives here. She is 30 years, separated, and with two children who are 10 and 2 years old. The oldest one attends school. In order to earn an income and bring up her children, Rosa works selling clothing of all types. She travels around her town offering her products. She leaves them on credit and gets paid every eight days. She also sells from her house to her better known customers. She has worked in this job for more than two years. She started it thanks to a loan she received from the group, for which she is grateful because it allows her to move ahead. She will use this loan to buy more merchandise such as: pants, blouses, t-shirts, among other items. She has been in this Credit Group for 11 years, and she likes it because she finances her business with the loans. Her dream is to have a big bazaar.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts and other clothing items.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 61 years old and married with two children.

Milagros works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, noodles, detergent soap, sugar, bread, eggs, etc. to sell at her store.

Milagros has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from a food vending business.

Milagros aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, noodles, detergent soap, sugar, bread and eggs to sell at her store.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 59 years old and single. 

Richard is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. He requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs.

Richard has been raising pigs for nine years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain his business. He successfully paid back his previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build his business.

In the future, Richard would like to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Romilyn

texts.en:
Romilyn is 26 years old and married. She has three children, one of whom is currently in school.

Romilyn is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Romilyn has been farming vegetables for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Romilyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.en:
Socorro is 51 years old and married with three children. With two children still in school, Socorro works very hard to provide for them.

Socorro runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more goods, such as rice, eggs, canned goods, soft-drinks, juice, milk and cereals, to sell at her store.

Socorro has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items, such as rice, eggs, canned goods, soft-drinks, juice, milk, cereals, etc. 

In the future, Socorro would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more goods, such as rice, eggs, canned goods, soft-drinks, juice, milk and cereals, to sell at her store.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Teresa requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Teresa has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Mary Luz

texts.es:
Mary una hermosa Antioqueña de 21 años de edad que empezó hace un año con la venta de sandalias como ayuda para sostener los gastos de su técnica en atención a la primera infancia pues viene de una familia pobre pero este no es un impedimento para que ella logre sus objetivos. 

Gracias a unas buenas amistades consiguió un excelente proveedor en la ciudad de Medellín el cual le ofreció vender jeans lo cual es más rentable para ella por eso quiere solicitar un crédito el cual invertirá en su totalidad en la compre de jeans para hombre, mujer y niños. 

Gracias a este préstamo seguirá creciendo como independiente tendrá recursos para pagar su estudio y aunque no parezca mucho darle cualquier peso a su madre que es lo principal para ella. 

Participa en este crédito para apoyar una joven que quiere triunfar devorarse el futuro, demostrar el empuje y las ganas de progresar que tienen los antioqueños
texts.en:
Mary is a lovely girl from Antioquía.  She is 21 years old.  A year ago, she began to sell sandals as a way to help with the expenses of her technical degree in early childhood care.  She comes from a poor family, but this isn’t an obstacle for her as she achieves her goals.

Thanks to some good friendships, she got an excellent dealer in the city of Medellín who offered her a chance to sell jeans.  This is more profitable, so she wants to ask for a loan, which she will invest in its entirety in the purchase of jeans for men, women, and children.

Thanks to this loan she will continue to grow in her self-reliance.  She will have the resources to pay for her studies and, although it doesn’t seem like much, she can give a few pesos to her mother, which is the main thing for her.

This loan will support a young woman who wants to succeed, tackling her future and demonstrating the spirit and the desire to get ahead that Antioquians have.

loans.use: to buy jeans in bulk to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Belarmino

texts.en:
Belarmino is an artisan in Guatemala who specializes in cotton apparel. He would like a 700 USD loan to make a bulk purchase of thread and fabric for his designs.

Belarmino has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is his story:

"As a child I developed a fascination for Central American cultures, and so my dream was to visit Latin America. I was born in Spain and moved to Guatemala in 1985. Little by little I gained access to the textile world of Guatemala, getting to know weavers and artisans, and so becoming a part of each others' life.

“I decided to work with organic cotton and natural dyes. My love for textiles grabbed me by the hand and took me places I had never before imagined.

"This microcredit will help me immensely, as I will be able to stock up on raw materials in time for the busy holiday season. Many thanks!"

Use the link below to view Belarmino's cotton apparel on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/7854

loans.use: to make a bulk purchase of thread and fabric for his designs

loans.name: Felicien

texts.en: Felicien is 31 years old. He is married with three children between the ages of 2 and 12 years old, and two of them go to school. He has been selling food items for 11 years. With the loan, he would like to buy more sorghum for resale. The profit from the business will be used to buy land.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum for resale.

loans.name: Made

texts.en:
Made is a Balinese artisan who specializes in handcrafted sterling silver jewelry. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of sterling silver for his designs.

Made has been selling through NOVICA since 2009. This is his story:

"I learned the silversmith art from a family member. He taught me after school and at that time, the tools we used were still very traditional. I first learned to hammer silver by hand and sometimes I'd miss and hit my hand! When I was learning to place tiny silver granules, I'd fall asleep. But I was eventually able to craft earrings by myself. Then I learned to design my own items and my dream is to see my jewelry worn by people around the world."

"I am happy to get the chance to receive a loan without interest. I really need that right now to buy silver material and prepare for the holiday rush. Thanks for this great opportunity."

Use the link below to view Made's sterling silver jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/7147

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of sterling silver for his designs.

loans.name: Ciro

texts.en:
Ciro is an artisan from Peru who specializes in wool tapestries. He would like a loan of 200 USD to make a bulk purchase of wool and cotton thread for his designs.

Ciro has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is his story:

"From the time I was very young, I was interested in learning the weaving art from the master weaver Gregorio Sulca. Everything I know was learned in his workshop.

“For me, no matter how simple it may be, this art is something beautiful. It's exciting when I feel the wool in my hands and begin to delineate the different forms according to my own inspiration. This is a great motivation for me. I try to transmit all the wonderful heritage of our ancestors in my work. I don't want this to die out.

"Many thanks to each of you. As a result of your ongoing support, I have been able to grow as an artist, and have been able to expand my business. This loan will allow me to create new designs that reflect current trends in home decorating."

Use the link below to view Ciro's wool tapestries on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/5925

loans.use: to make a bulk purchase of wool and cotton thread

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
El comité está conformado por 17 mujeres inspiradas en una mejor y buena calidad de vida, no solo para ellas, sino también para sus familias. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Ana, que se encuentra contenta por formar parte del comité, así ella y sus compañeras cuentan con una oportunidad de poder trabajar y generar sus propios ingresos. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas que ella misma hace y que después sale a vender de manera ambulante.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus comidas, como ser verduras, carne, jamón, queso y demás.
texts.en: The committee is made up of 17 women who are inspired to have a better and higher quality life, not only for themselves, but for their families.  One of the members is Ana, who is happy to be part of the group.  Her and her partners take advantage of the opportunity to work and generate their own earnings.  She works selling food that she makes herself and that she later sells in the streets.  She is seeking this loan to purchase supplies such as vegetables, meat, ham, cheese and other items to be able to continue making her foods.

loans.use: purchase vegetables, meat, ham, cheese and other items to make food to sell.

loans.name: Oscar Giovanni

texts.es: oscar de 32 años de edad se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta de punches (cangrejos), por los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, tiene mucha clintela por los buenos precios, vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas punches (cangrejos) por mayor para seguir con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Oscar is 32 years old and for the past several years has been working selling crabs in the different markets that are close to his house. He has a large clientele because of his good prices. He lives in his own house with his life companion. He is requesting a loan to buy more crabs wholesale to continue his sales and have more income.

loans.use: to buy crabs wholesale.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is 56 years old. He is married to Jane and together they have been blessed with six children between the ages of 8 and 21 years old. Jane provides additional income for her family.

Gabriel runs a soft drink vending business, which he has run for the past three years, earning a monthly income of 30,000 KES.

Gabriel has requested his fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya of 40,000 KES, which he will use to purchase additional crates of soda for stocking his business. He successfully repaid his previous loans.

Gabriel's hopes and dreams for the future are to become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy crates of soda for stocking his business.

loans.name: Karla Maria

texts.es: Karla de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su madre, ella es muy trabajadora, desde hace 10 años se dedica ala venta de detergentes, jabon, papel higiénico, etc. de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias, tiene clientela establecida que la prefieren por las buenos precios, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas productos por mayor para continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su madre.
texts.en:
Karla is 31 years old. She lives with her mother in a house that she owns. She is very hardworking. 

For ten years, she has earned her living selling detergents, soap, toilet paper, etc., on the streets of different communities. She has established customers who prefer her for her good prices.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of more products at wholesale to continue with her sales so that she can have a better quality of life, together with her mother.

loans.use: to buy detergents, soap, toilet paper, etc., at wholesale

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 40 years old, married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with three children. Joshua supplies bread to several shop retailers in the area and this has been profitable for the past 14 years that he has been in this business.

He will be using this loan to buy more stock of crates for packing the bread for supply. He will use the anticipated profits to add more stock of crates and also to educate his children.

This is his fifth loan from VisionFund Kenya and he paid his previous loan successfully. In the future, he hopes to open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of crates for packing bread.

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie is 42 years old and married with four children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Tessie is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Tessie has been in the pig fattening business for two years and also earns income from farming vegetables.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ni Wayan

texts.en:
Ni Wayan is an artisan from Bali who specializes in sterling silver and gold accent jewelry. She would like to invest in a purchase of semiprecious gemstones as well as equipment for her workshop, including a hand drill and gold plating machine.

Ni Wayan has been selling through NOVICA since 2011. This is her story:

"In 2009, my parents were named 'The Master's Hands' for gold and silver jewelry by The Jakarta Post. They taught me to learn patiently, work hard and never give up to achieve good jewelry. I will be a good jewelry maker like my parents and my brother, and I will make them proud of me. My husband is also a silversmith and this is part of my happiness in life, making my life worthwhile. I hope you like my jewelry and feel its beauty."

"Thanks a lot and I appreciate your help, as your support will really help me get prepared for this holiday season. The new tools will help me improve efficiency and provide better quality products."

Use the link below to view Ni Wayan's sterling silver and gold accent jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8093

loans.use: to purchase semiprecious gemstones and equipment for her workshop, including a hand drill and gold plating machine.

loans.name: Nyoman

texts.en:
Nyoman is an artisan from Bali who specializes in hand-carved masks. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of wood and bring on more carvers to help him in his workshop.

Nyoman has been selling through NOVICA since 2002. This is his story:

"Handicrafts are becoming the main wage earner in my village. My experiences have led me to concentrate on carved masks. I learned to design from my father; this craft is taught and learned from generation to generation. The material I commonly use is hibiscus wood. It has good characteristics and it isn't too heavy."

"I am glad for this opportunity to get a loan -- it is very important for us small artisans in Bali. I need some capital to prepare for holiday season sales. I will buy the wood and try to get additional carvers in order to be able to make all the stock needed. Sadly, it is difficult to find good carvers in Bali these days; many of them have changed profession and taken work as building contractors. It's a pity. I hope I can find someone to add to my team so we can create more beautiful masks. Thanks for the support that you give to me and my family, and to my carvers, so we can develop our business."

Use the link below to view Nyoman's hand-carved Balinese masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/3268

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of wood and bring on more carvers to help him in his workshop

loans.name: Sarbelio De Jesus

texts.es: Don Sarberlio de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijas, de las cuales las tres mayores trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, el se dedica al cultivo de maiz desde hace vario años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi seguir con sus cultivos para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Don Sarbelio is 47 years old. He lives in his own house with his four daughters, of whom the three oldest are working and helping him financially. He has earned his living growing corn for several years. He sells his product in the different markets that are located near his house. 

He is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, soil amendments, pest control, etc., so that he can continue with his farming in order to have better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, soil amendments, pest control, etc.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es: Beatriz de 34 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos quienes estudian actualmente, ella se dedica desde hace algunos años a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona donde ella reside, Beatriz esta solicitando un credito para la compra de semillas fertilzantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografia para poder continuar con sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 34 years old. She lives with her two children, who currently go to school,  in a house that she owns. She has earned her living for some years in agriculture, growing corn. She sells her produce in the areas surrounding of the zone where she lives. 

Beatriz is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers, soil amendments, pest control, etc., and to improve the soil that appears in the photograph so that she can continue with her farming.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, soil amendments, pest control, etc., and to improve the soil

loans.name: Crecimiento Group

texts.en:
The Crecimiento (“growth”) Group is part of the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank found in Totonicapan in the southwestern highlands of Guatemala. It is approximately 203 kilometers from the capitol of the country, Guatemala City.

These seven women speak Spanish but cannot write it, as they did not have the opportunity to attend school. They are involved in various businesses such as shoe and clothing sales and weaving and embroidering textiles.

This group’s featured member is Maria, the 29-year-old secretary of the Trust Bank. She is married and had her only daughter when she was seventeen years old. She was unable to attend school because her parents could not afford to send her.

This will be Maria’s third loan cycle. She has a textile business and creates beautiful aprons which she sells. She will use her portion of this 34,800 GTQ group loan to buy fabric, decorations, thread and needles so that she can continue production.

“Microcredit Plus” is the name that Friendship Bridge gives to the effective combination of loans and education. Each month, the Crecimiento Group members meet to make payments on their loans and to participate in educational seminars. A Friendship Bridge Loan Officer, called a “facilitadora,” brings useful and timely information to the women who are eager to learn. They learn about women’s rights, matters of self-esteem and the problem of violence against women. They gain knowledge about health, nutrition, hygiene and the use of medicinal plants to assist them in taking care of themselves and their families. They learn how to manage their loans in an effective way with classes on effective business management practices, such as budgeting, planning, marketing and customer service.

Maria and her friends in the Trust Bank are really happy to provide additional income for their families. They are hopeful for the future of their children. The women are committed to a brighter tomorrow as empowered women creating their own solutions to poverty. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to buy fabric, decorations, thread and needles

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a husband and a father of 5 who lives in the Kisii area of Kenya. He has made a living crop farming for almost 15 years. On his farm, he grows bananas, maize, vegetables and fodder which constitute his primary income sources. 

Henry is seeking a loan purchase a dairy cow. He spends a lot of time feeding his cow on the farm. With your money, he wants to purchase a more productive breed so that he can commercialize his dairy products. But in order to get this done, he needs a loan to purchase the cow.

He intends to sell the milk that he will be getting daily so that he can use the income to repay the loan and save for his highest expense - farm inputs. 

He says that his family will benefit greatly from the loan through enhanced financial and food security.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sang

texts.en:
An $800 loan is offered to Sang to improve her business. She is married and has five children. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. 

She will buy some additional supplies, including electric appliances such as electric lights and power cords, and also tools such as brake motors, motor oil, and others. 

She has been involving herself in business activities since 2008. She feels so comfortable to run her business because she can earn money every day. Running a business has made Sang independent because she can be responsible for herself and also help her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy electric appliances such as electric lights, power cords, and also tools such as brake motors, motor oil, and others.

loans.name: Dúo Luz Y Verdad Group

texts.es:
DUO LUZ Y VERDAD
Doña Mercedes, ella es originaria de la aldea xetzac, del  municipio de Tecpán, bajo su responsabilidad están sus 4 hijas, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales y a la fabricación de quesos.
Ella  empezó su negocio desde hace algunos años atrás, gracias a Dios a podido salir adelante, ahora ya tiene más animales para crianza.
Gracias al apoyo de su esposo y de sus hijas ella sigue trabajando, ya que con la ayuda de su familia ella sigue adelante con su negocio ahora ya tiene mas clientes donde entrega sus productos. 
El sueños de ella es ampliar mas su negocio tener otros animales para crianza, y tener más capital para poder elaborar sus quesos, ya que así ella tendrá mejores ganancias y poder mandar a sus hijas a estudiar para un futuro mejor ya que hoy en dia la educación es muy importante, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de animales para la crianza
texts.en:
DUO LUZ Y VERDAD

Mercedes is originally from the Xetzac village in Tecpán municipality. She has 4 children, and works raising animals and making cheese. She began her business a few years ago, thanks be to God she has been successful and now has more animals to raise. Thanks to the support of her husband and her children she continues working. With her family's help her business is successful and she can deliver products to her customers.

Her dreams are to expand her business by having more animals to raise, and having capital to be able to make cheese. This will result in greater earnings and she will be able to send her children to school so that they may have a better future as today education is very important. She is asking for this loan to buy animals to raise.

loans.use: to buy animals to raise.

loans.name: Las Vegas Group

texts.es:
Adela es una mujer de 55 años de edad casada, sin hijos, y su negocio es la venta ambulante de cosméticos.
Ella es independiente, emprendedora, paciente, constante, luchadora y muy trabajadora. Su labor la realiza en diferentes ferias y mercados del sur de su ciudad. 
Adela es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello corto castaño, 	su lengua materna es el español (de izquierda a derecha, de pie con blusa celeste). Su necesidad de expandir su negocio y generar mejores ingresos económicos la ha llevado a formar una banca de personas con negocios diferentes y necesidades similares, para solicitar un préstamo. Su negocio es la venta ambulante de cosméticos, cada día cargada de un bolso grande lleno de productos recorre todas las ferias y mercados en busca de clientes, estos se encuentran en sus locales comerciales, oficinas, tiendas, etc. Su jornada comienza muy temprano por la mañana y termina muy tarde por la noche, porque según nos comenta “no existe horario para la venta...”. ella sueña con tener una tienda donde puedo exibir y vender sus cosméticos al mismo tiempo que dejará de caminar, pues su bolsón pesa bastante. Ella desea realizar la compra de mercadería por mayor, para aumentar su capital de trabajo y tener un stock más variado.
Es por esos motivos que Adela solicita un préstamo para la compra de cosméticos por mayor y algún día tener una tienda donde trabajar.
texts.en:
Adela is a 55-year-old woman. She is married with no children, and her business is selling cosmetics on the streets. She is independent, resourceful, patient, tenacious, determined, and very hardworking. She does her work in different street fairs and markets in the southern part of her city.

Adela (standing with a light blue blouse) has brown skin, average stature, and short chestnut hair. Her mother tongue is Spanish. Her need to expand her business and generate better income has led her to request a loan. 

Her business is selling cosmetics on the streets. Every day, loaded down with a large bag full of products, she travels between all the street fairs and markets in search of customers. She finds them in their businesses, offices, stores, etc. Her work day begins very early in the morning and ends very late at night, because, as she says, "selling has no schedule." 

She dreams of having a shop where she can exhibit and sell her cosmetics; at that time, she will quit walking, as her big bag weighs quite a bit. She would like to make her merchandise purchases at wholesale, so that she can increase her working capital and have a more varied inventory. For these reasons, Adela is requesting a loan for the purchase of cosmetics at wholesale, and to one day have a shop to work in.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics at wholesale, and one day, to have a shop to work in

loans.name: Santusa

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose a la ganadería y a la elaboración   de productos lácteos como yogurt y queso, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de una vaca.
La socia está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla a desarrollarse en su actividad y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Santusa has cattle and makes dairy products such as yogurt and cheese. She has had her business for some time and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day. Through this business she supports her family.

She seeks a loan to buy a cow. She is very thankful to KIVA for helping her grow her business and promises to make her loan payments.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
La socia Flora se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de cereales y verduras, la socia lleva a diferentes lugares, la socia vende maiz,trigo y cebada y también vende cebollas, tomates y zapallos, la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales y verduras. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maiz,trigo y cebada y comprar verduras como cebollas, zanahorias y tomates. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Flora is continuing with her business  selling vegetables and cereals.  She sells her products in various places.  She sells corn, wheat, and barley, and she also sells onions, tomatoes, and squash.  She's had this business for a number of years, and it is doing very well.  Flora dreams of having her own shop where she could sell cereals and vegetables.  She is requesting a loan to buy corn, wheat, and barley, and to buy vegetables such as onions, carrots, and tomatoes. Flora is happy to be getting this loan, and she promises to comply with the payment terms.

loans.use: to buy grains and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El socio es el señor José, el socio sigue dedicándose a la Ganadería a la venta de leche de vaca, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de una vaca.
texts.en:
José is continuing with his business of cattle raising and selling milk.  He feels grateful for the loan that he is being given, and he promises to comply with the payment terms, as this is the way that he is getting ahead with his family.

José is requesting this loan so that he can buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La socia Juliana continua dedicándose a la agricultura y ganadería, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de abono y semillas.
La socia Juliana pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolomé De las Casas” ,la socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Juliana is continuing with her farming and livestock activities.  She has been doing this kind of work for years, and it is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day.  Juliana wants to continue to work so that she can support her family.

Juliana is requesting a loan to buy organic fertilizer and seeds.  She belongs to the communal bank “San Bartolomé de Las Casas."  She is grateful for the opportunity being provided through these means, and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: José Enrique

texts.es:
José de 58 años de edad, su nivel académico es de bachillerato general, no pudo seguir estudiando debido a que para estudiar una carrera universitaria se requiere de ingresos económicos para invertir en los estudios y él no tenía ese privilegio. Él es soltero vive  en su casa solo con su mamá.

José se dedica a la venta de medicina natural desde hace 8 años, decidió aventurar con este trabajo y le ha ido muy bien, gracias a los clientes que ha ido adquiriendo durante este tiempo experiencia. 

Decidió dedicarse a la venta debido a que necesitaba trabajar y un tío tenía un local de medicina natural y comenzó a vender y todo le fue marchando bien. Antes de la venta de medicina estuvo en el ejército por 20 años pero por riesgos en el trabajo decidió salirse por seguridad de la familia, y también necesitaba más ingresos económicos y la venta de medicina le pareció su mejor opción, el horario de trabajo es de lunes a domingo de 7 de la mañana hasta las 4 o 5 de la tarde y  a veces hasta que sus productos se agoten.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar más medicina natural y tener un negocio fijo abrir un local donde las personas lleguen a comprar la medicina, ya que hasta el momento él sale a los cantones y caseríos y de casa por casa, y poder distribuirla a otros locales y a personas vendedoras para que continúen vendiendo su medicina.
El sueño de José es de tener su propio local donde las personas lo busquen para comprar y además de eso tener locales en diversos municipios del país y distribuir la medicina a otras personas vendedoras ambulantes como actualmente es él, pero gracias al crédito otorgado espera que su sueño se haga realidad.
texts.en:
José is 58 years old, finished high school but couldn't attend the university as that requires funds to invest in the career program and he didn't have this privilege. He is single and lives with his mother.

José has been selling natural medicines for 8 years and has been very successful, thanks to the customers he has accumulated over time. He decided to on this business as his uncle had a natural medicine business and it went very well. Before selling medicines he was in the army for 20 years but because of the risks of the job he decided to leave for his family's security and also to earn more income. Selling medicine seemed his best option. He works Monday through Sunday from 7 in the morning until 4 or 5 in the afternoon or sometimes until he runs out of products.

The loan he seeks is to buy more natural medicines and have a storefront where customers can come and buy medicine because as of the moment he sells on the street and door to door. He would also like to be able to distribute to various locations and salespeople to sell his medicines.

José dreams of having his own locale where people seek him out to buy product and in addition have locations in various municipalities throughout the country and distribute the medicine to other salespeople like he is today. Thanks to the awarded loan he hopes to make his dream reality.

loans.use: to buy more natural medicines and open a storefront.

loans.name: Carma

texts.en:
A $600 loan is offered to Carma to improve her business. She is married and she opened her kiosk in 2009 with her own working capital. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store like Fanta, Coca Cola, oil, noodles, milk, biscuits, sugar and coffee. She is generating a good income from selling.

She has been thinking of running a big business after years of involving herself in doing business. She is living in a town with her family.

loans.use: to buy Fanta, Coca Cola, oil, noodles, milk, biscuits, sugar and coffee.

loans.name: Ossie

texts.en:
South-Land Energy Corporation (the “Company”) was established in March 2013 in California. The creator of the Company is Mr. Ossie. He built the Company from the ground up after working for over ten years in the heating, ventilation, air conditioning, and refrigeration (HVAC-R) industry. His career began after he graduated from the Los Angeles Trade Technical College with an associate degree in science of refrigeration and air conditioning mechanics; then worked as a refrigeration service technician.

The Company provides customers with the best possible products and services available and will always utilize the most qualified and certified technicians on the job. The Company recognizes the growing need to provide commercial and residential buildings with better energy efficiency service, not just for the equipment, but also for energy-consuming buildings.

Starting a business was a very bold decision for Mr. Ossie because there are many challenges, especially obtaining financing from banks. The Kiva loan came in very handy for him to use the funds as working capital. He would like to see his company grow to where he can hire some employees to help him deliver the quality service that his customers expect from the South-Land Energy Company.

loans.use: to increase working capital and pay for business expenses.

loans.name: 25 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “25 DE JULIO” iniciará el trigésimo sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lidia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa interior, tienda de barrio, venta de cinturones, venta de fiambres, venta de calzados, taller de charería.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lidia es integrante, ella indica que hace diez años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de fiambres (embutidos); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su madre hace varios años y al conseguir un capital decide emprender un negocio independiente hace ocho años. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de carne por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el las capacitaciones que ofrece la institución.
texts.en: The “25 DE JULIO” Group will start its thirty sixth loan cycle in Pro Mujer as part of the Regional Hub of Santiago II. It is formed by eight members and led by a board of directors, where Lidia is the President. The businesses of the group members are diverse. Among them: sale of underwear, neighborhood shop, sale of belts, sale of cold meats, sale of footwear, body shop workshop . The loan they get will benefit small businesswomen, where Lidia is a member. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for ten years. She joined after being invited by a promoter of the institution. Currently, she has a business selling cold meats (sausages). She says that she learned this business from her mother many years ago, and she became independent eight years ago after she got some capital. The loan she will take is to increase capital (to buy meat at wholesale prices) that she will purchase from saleswomen in the city of La Paz. After preparation, she will sell it at her place of sale. This way of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, since she is single and has a son. When they ask her what she likes from Pro Mujer she answers that she likes the training this institution offers.

loans.use: to buy meat at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de zapatos, la socia por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de zapatos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar zapatos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The partner continues to sell shoes, and desires to improve her station through this. Her dream is to expand her business of shoe sales. She is asking the loan to buy shoes.

The partner is happy for the loan and is committed to meeting her scheduled payments.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: 7 Estrellas Group

texts.es:
Las 15 integrantes de este grupo son mujeres jefas de familia, que están luchando para poder dar a sus seres queridos lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Agustina es la presidenta del grupo, una persona que se destaca por el dinamismo y el excelente trabajo que hace como la coordinadora, ella tiene una despensa y pide este préstamo para comprar insumos varios para surtirla, como verduras, condimentos, carne, lácteos y demás, y con ello poder dar a sus clientes lo que están buscando.
texts.en:
The 15 members of this group are women heads of family. They are fighting every day to provide for their loved ones what they themselves couldn't have.

Agustina is the president of the group and known for her energy and excellent work she does as the coordinator. She has a convenience store and seeks a loan to buy various items to stock it such as vegetables, condiments, meat, dairy products, and other items so that she can offer her customers what they are seeking.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, meat, dairy products and other items to stock the store.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Claudia es una mujer de 30 años, vive con su pareja, tiene cuatro hijos de 3, 8, 11, 14 años de edad, y su negocio es la venta de zapatos.
Ella es emprendedora, independiente, constante, fuerte, luchadora, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su labora la realiza en ‘El Torno’ un lugar caracterizado por su clima cálido/húmedo y la recepción de productos agrícolas en grandes cantidades.
Claudia es de tez morena, estatura alta, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el español (de pie al centro, con blusa a rayas verticales). Debido a la necesidad de generar mejores ingresos económicos, ha conformado una banca de personas para solicitar un préstamo y poder continuar con su trabajo. Ella se dedica al comercio de zapatos, su labor diaria comienza a las nueve de la mañana en su puesto fijo de trabajo y se encarga de ordenar y exhibir toda su mercadería, pasadas las 7 de la noche, recoge todos sus productos y los encajona hasta el día siguiente. Ella sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales, debido a los gastos escolares de su familia su capital de trabajo se ha reducido, y las utilidades de su comercio han bajado, ella desea realizar la compra por mayor de zapatos y aumentar su capital de trabajo para tener mejores ingresos económicos.
Es por esos motivos que Claudia solicita un préstamo para la compra de zapatos por mayor y con los beneficios ayudar con los gastos escolares de sus cuatro hijos.
texts.en:
Claudia is a 30-year-old woman. She lives with her spouse and has four children who are 3, 8, 11, and 14 years old. Her business is the sale of shoes.

She is resourceful, independent, tenacious, strong, determined, responsible, and very hardworking. She carries out her work in "El Torno," a place known for its warm and humid climate and abundant agricultural production.

Claudia (standing in the center, with a vertically-striped blouse) has brown skin, tall stature, and long black hair. Her mother tongue is Spanish. Because of the necessity of generating greater income, she has put together a communal bank of people to request a loan so that she can continue with her work.

She earns her living selling shoes. Her daily work begins at nine in the morning at her fixed work location. She busies herself organizing and exhibiting all her merchandise; after 7:00 at night, she gathers all her wares and packs them up until the next day. 

Claudia dreams of her children becoming professionals. Because of her family's educational expenses, her working capital has been reduced, and the profits from her business have decreased. She would like to purchase wholesale shoes and to increase her working capital in order to have better income.

For these reasons, Claudia is requesting a loan for the purchase of shoes at wholesale; with the profits, she will help with the educational expenses of her four children.

loans.use: to buy shoes at wholesale and to use the profits to help with the educational expenses of her four children

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Mujeres emprendedoras no hacen falta en el país de la eterna primavera que es Guatemala donde la mujer forma parte importante en los campos laborales, tal es el caso de Rosa de 44 años de edad que tiene 2 hijo los cuales son estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad.

La actividad que ella desempeña con tanto orgullo es la producción y plantación de flores en los campos fértiles de su comunidad dicho trabajo lo ha venido realizando desde hace 20 años y genera buena ganancia para la economía de su familia ya que es la herencia que su padre le pudo dejar para que ella tenga una calidad de vida mejor en el futuro.

El uso respectivo que Rosa le dará al préstamo que ella solicita es para la compra de insumos para el cultivo de flores tales como: semillas, abonos químicos, abonos orgánicos, pita, foliares y insecticidas,  para que producción de sus flores sean las mejores y sean llevados en los mercados de la comunidad para su respectiva venta.

Los sueños de ella es la plantación de más flores en las tierras fértiles con que ella cuenta y de esa manera ella quiere apoyar al medio ambiente y así mismo sacar un provecho económico para su familia para que lleguen a profesionales en el futuro.
texts.en:
There is no shortage of entrepreneurial women in the nation of eternal spring, which is Guatemala, where women form an important part of the labor force.  44 year old Rosa has two children who attend the community school.

She proudly works planting flowers on the fertile farms in her community.  She has been doing this for 20 years and it provides her with a good income for her family, because this is what her father was able to leave her so that she could have a better quality of life in the future.

She will use the money from this loan to buy supplies such as seeds, chemical and organic fertilizers, insecticide, and other things to improve her production so that her flowers will be the best and taken to the local markets for sale.

Her dreams are to plant more flowers on the fertile land that she has and be able to support the environment and receive financial benefit for her family so that they can become professionals in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for growing flowers.

loans.name: Paz

texts.es: Doña Paz de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas desde hace varios años, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela, ella solicita un crédito para poder comprar maíz por quintales y cal para seguir con la elaboración de las tortillas ya que esa es su única fuente de trabajo y asi podrá obtener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Paz is 60 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two children. She has made and sold tortillas for several years. Her business is located in her home. She has many customers. She seeks a loan to buy quintales of corn and lime to continue making tortillas. This is her only source of income and in this way she will obtain greater income.

loans.use: to buy quintales of corn and lime..

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.ru: Хафиза заботливая мать. Она разведена и одна воспитывает свою дочь. Она занимается собственным бизнесом более чем 10 лет. Хафиза продает продукты питания. У нее теперь есть магазин, где находится вблизи больницы. Она постепенно год за годом увеличивает оборотный капитал и развевает бизнес. С бизнесом она справляется одна. Хафиза с полученного дохода обеспечивает дочь едой, одеждой и образованием. Она планирует увеличить оборотный капитал в осенний сезон и поэтому она обратилась за займом. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки продуктов питания. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Hafiza is a caring mother who is divorced and raising her daughter on her own. She has been running her own business selling groceries for more than 10 years. She has a shop near the hospital and has been gradually, year by year, increasing her working capital and developing her business, which she manages completely on her own. With the help of this loan, she plans to increase her working capital for the fall season and intends to put the profits received toward her child's food, clothing and education. She is requesting a loan of 7,500 somoni to buy food products. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to buy food products to increase her working capital

loans.name: Dúo San Agustin Group

texts.es:
DÚO SAN AGUSTIN 
Este dúo está conformado por Maria Angelina originaria de Sumpango, Maria Angelina tiene una tienda que gracias a Dios y a Kiva logro abrir, ya que anteriormente se dedicaba a la agricultura pero con los créditos que ha obtenido ha logrado establecer su propia tienda, es el cuarto crédito que solicitan ya que necesitan para poder ampliar sus negocios, Angelina está feliZ de poder estar trabajando con kiva ya que sido de mucha bendición, Esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles para su tienda.
texts.en:
DÚO SAN AGUSTIN

One member of this pair is Maria Angelina. She is originally from Sumpago. Thanks to God and Kiva she was able to open a store. Previously she farmed but with the loans she obtained she was able to open her own store. This is the fourth loan she is seeking to be able to expand her business. Angelina is happy to be able to be working with Kiva as it has been a blessing. She is seeking this loan to buy groceries for her store.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for electrical goods.

loans.name: Mudiah

texts.en:
Mudiah is 52 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her children. She has sold food and cake for over fifteen years to increase her family's income. 

She wants to have access to safe water and sanitation for her family. She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 6,000,000 rupiah. This loan will be used to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at her home. Her family income is still not enough to build toilets and water resources by cash, but they are able to repay loans that they receive.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at her home.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is taking a loan of $1,000 to improve her business. She is married, and she is running a kiosk that helps her to generate income for her family. 

She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as beer, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, books, noodles, biscuits, coffee, Sprite, fish, and Coca-Cola. 

She opened her kiosk in 2010 with her own working capital of $600. She is a hardworking woman, and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy beer, cigarettes, sugar, salt, milk, books, noodles, biscuits, coffee, Sprite, fish, and Coca-Cola.

loans.name: Exaltacion

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de vidrios, el socio por medio de este negocio quiere salir adelante, el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de venta de vidrios. El socios solicita el crédito para comprar vidrios.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues to sell glass and wants to get ahead through his business.  His dream is to expand his business and is asking for a loan to buy glass.

Hi is happy about the loan and is committed to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy glass.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a 21-year-old single young man with no children. He makes and sells ice-cakes in his community to earn a living. He has 1 year of experience with this business. Michael needs a loan to buy sugar, cordials, Chinese candy, a large spoon and a new chest freezer. He plans to use his profits to pay for his family's weekly expenses. Michael has been a member of SPBD since 2014. 

He is a male dressed up as a woman, also known as a drag.

loans.use: to buy sugar, cordials, Chinese candy, a large spoon and a new chest freezer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase goods for her grocery

loans.name: Los Arbolitos Ahorros (Flat) Group

texts.es:
El Arbolito es un grupo conformado por cuatro personas responsables y pendientes del bienestar de su familia; cada una de ellas tiene un negocio del cual obtienen ingresos para sus solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña Juliana invertirá su crédito en sus pollos; Ángela, en bordados; Maximino en su tienda de abarrotes y Magdalena, en cosméticos. Todos ellos están muy agradecidos con VisionFund México pues llevan ya varios ciclos contando con el apoyo de la institución.

El nombre del grupo lo eligieron porque cuando recibieron su primer préstamo, en el lugar donde se reúnen había bastantes árboles pequeños que actualmente ya han alcanzado un gran tamaño.

Magdalena tiene 40 años de edad está felizmente casada con el señor Baldomero desde hace 22 años, ahora tienen ya tres hijos los cuales se encuentran estudiando. Ella muestra un enorme gusto por las ventas “Siempre tuve la iniciativa de emprender un negocio, tuve la oportunidad de conocer a una amiga que vendía productos de belleza, ella me recomendó la actividad y fue así como inicié". Magdalena tiene ya 15 años de experiencia en el negocio, cada mes adquiere un nuevo catálogo para mostrar los productos a sus amigos, familiares, vecinos y conocidos, en escuelas, clínicas, casas, en la calle y en cualquier otro lugar donde tenga oportunidad. Si alguien se interesa en algún producto Doña Magdalena debe entregarlo en los siguientes días, además ofrece la oportunidad de pagar en dos cuotas. Comenta que son pocas las veces que sus clientes se llegan a atrasar pero siempre los visita cada 15 días y afortunadamente siempre terminan de pagar. 

Magdalena comenta que uno de sus hijos estudia la preparatoria y que es muy responsable, además de que quiere entrar a la universidad. Doña magdalena quiere apoyarlo en todo lo que pueda porque no sólo se trata del sueño de su hijo, sino su propio suelo ver a su hijo realizado, con una carrera profesional y con mejor calidad de vida. 

*La foto se tomó en los arcos del municipio donde viven los integrantes. Doña Ángela viste suéter rosado y lleva una bolsa color café.*
texts.en:
“El Arbolito” is a group made up of four responsible men and women concerned about their families’ wellbeing.  Each one has a business by which they obtain income to pay their household expenses.  Juliana will use the money on her chickens; Angela on embroidery; Maximino on his grocery store, and Magdalena on cosmetics.  They are all very grateful to VisionFund Mexico because they have gone through various cycles of receiving their help.

They selected the name for this group when they received their first loan.  There a lot of trees in the place where they meet and they have gotten very big.

Magdalena is 40 years old and has been happily married to Baldomero for 22 years.  Now they have three children who attend school.  She shows a great love for sales, “I’ve always had the entrepreneurial spirit.  I had the opportunity to meet a friend who sold beauty products and she recommended the business that I started.”  Magdalena has been doing this for 15 years and she gets a new catalog each month so she can show her products to her friends, relatives, neighbors, and acquaintances in schools, clinics, homes, in the street, and any other place she can.  If anyone shows interest in a product, Magdalena must deliver within the next few days.  She also allows them to pay in two installments.  She says that her customers have fallen behind only a few times, but she always visits them every two weeks and fortunately they always pay in the end.

Magdalena says that one of her children is in high school and is very responsible.  He also wants to attend university.  Magdalena wants to support him in everything she can because it not just about her son’s dream, but she also wants to see her son have a professional career and a better quality of life.

* The photograph was taken under the arches in town where the members live.  Angela is wearing a red sweater and carrying a brown purse.” *

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

location.town: Tres Estrellas, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Guirellito

texts.en:
Guirellito is a businessman from Carangan, Ozamiz City. He is 43 years old, married, and has an expertise in selling. He runs a little sari-sari store and earns a meager income that sufficiently supports his family. Guirellito is a full fledged member of PMPC, and has taken several loans already. He maintains his membership in good standing without records of default. 

Now, he applied a loan to restock the store with basic commodities and other consumable items. Guirellito continues to look for better business opportunities, proof that he has the passion and the energy to make ends meet for his family.

loans.use: to restock the store with basic commodities and other consumable items

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha lives in Tudela and supports her five children by building houses from the ground up. She has successfully repaid her previous loan and would like to avail another one to buy building materials, paint, and to pay her workers. 

She wants her children to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.

loans.use: to buy building materials, paint, and pay her workers.

loans.name: Delailah

texts.en: Delailah is a retired teacher and the wife of a farmer residing in a village of Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She helped her husband working on their own farm for a living. For many years in farming, Delailah had her savings for their future emergencies. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for their farm production costs. To improve her farm, she took a new loan from Gata Daku MPC to purchase fertilizer. She wants to improve the general living of her family in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Ritchie

texts.en: Ritchie grows and harvests corn, work that he has done since he was young. He gets up early in order to work on his farm. He settled in Clarin Misamis Occidental with his family. He became a member of Gata Daku MPC this year. Ritchie is requesting this loan to purchase additional organic fertilizer for his corn production since his farm needs improvement.  In the future, he wants to have a better house than he has now and to be able to give his child the education he did not have. He is sure that he can achieve his goals with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to buy additional organic fertilizer for his corn production

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 43 years old and is a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines.  She is married to Rofino, a tricycle driver and has three children who are in college, high school and elementary school. She and her husband work hard to meet their daily household needs and for the schooling of their children.  

Nenita owns a tricycle unit and she also has a food business. In the Philippines, especially in the provinces like Coron, a tricycle is the more common means of transportation.  Buses and jeepneys are limited.  Her husband drives her tricycle unit and earns around PHP 500 a day. She also operates a small canteen in their area. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan which she will use for repairs and maintenance of her tricycle and also to add some grocery items for her small variety store.
