She is positive that this will boost her income as tricycle transportation and a variety store is really a need in their place.


Nenita dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the education of her children for them to have a bright future.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of a tricycle for transportation services and ingredients she needs for her variety store.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 55 years old, married and has children. As a way of generating income, she has engaged in a tailoring business within her community in Cavite, Philippines for years now. She, together with her husband, works hard to provide for the everyday needs of their family.

She mainly offers lace, curtains, and other home trappings. Seasonal demands for clothing like uniforms and such are available all year round. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales everyday.

Due to financial insufficiency, Remedios wants to make her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan amounting to 8,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy more quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other items needed. She is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Remedios hopes that her business will continue to operate and help her to provide their needs. In the future, she dreams to have a peaceful and sufficient living with her family. She meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for a sewing machine, fabric and cloth for her sewing business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
This is Susan, a 37-year-old, resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Eduardo, a welder. She manages her own household while operating her variety store business. She is working hard to continually provide income to meet her family’s daily personal and household needs. 

Susan operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighbourhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns an income by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling them individually. She also sells direct sale products to her customers. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbours and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business and increase her sales she is requesting a PHP12,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. This will definitely boost her income as she expands her business. 

Susan hopes to be able to grow her business and give her family a better life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. There she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items, beverages and toiletries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel is grateful that he was granted a 50,000 PHP loan, which he used to purchase feed and hogs for his piggery business.  He recently got married to Florencia.  He is more inspired to work harder for his wife and future kids.  

He would now like to apply again for a 50,000 PHP loan which he will use as part of his working capital to buy an additional hogs, crabs and vegetables.  He also sells crabs and vegetables. His income from his business is a stable source to sustain his family's personal and household basic needs. He is thanking God, and you, in advance for the financial help that will be given him.

He aims to grow his business to prepare for his family. He dreams to have kids soon, and to have a happy family. Every week, he meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which he studies .

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay additional hogs, crabs, and vegetables

loans.name: Zosima

texts.en:
Zosima is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Zosima is 55 years old and has two children who are still in school.

Zosima has a buy-and-sell goods business in the Philippines. Zosima requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stocks of goods like bags, t-shirts, slippers, etc. to sell.

Zosima has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Zosima would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of goods like bags, t-shirts, slippers, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalie is 36 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Rosalie has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fish containers, fishing net, rope, etc. for her business.

Rosalie has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fish containers, fishing net, rope, etc. for her business

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 30 years old and married with five children and four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Nenita has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 27,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials and fishing gear for her business.

Nenita has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Nenita would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and fishing gear for her business

loans.name: Narine

texts.en:
Narine is an experienced farmer from the village of Agarakadzor village of Vayots Dzor region. She lives with her husband and little daughter. Narine is self-employed in her agribusiness. With the help of her husband, she is involved in beekeeping and in aviculture as the only source of income for her family. Her husband helps her by selling honey in the local market. 

To continue her agribusiness, and to start cultivating vegetables, the family needs to invest some financial resources. They particularly need a loan of $3000 to purchase 17 colonies of bees and to hire workers for land cultivation. As this is Narine's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who have not had access to credit products in the past because they have no credit history.

Narine and her hardworking family will be grateful to the lenders for helping them with a loan, which will have a great impact on their agribusiness and their lives in general.

loans.use: to pay for 17 colonies of bees and to hire workers for land cultivation

location.town: Agarakadzor village of Vayots Dzor region

loans.name: Supriyadi

texts.en:
This is the story of Yoga, grandchildof Supriyadi:

"I live in the village of Mount sari with my grandparents, and have lived here since birth. My parents live in the village of Sarwadadi. When i was a baby my parents left to work, so I stayed with the grandparents. Until now, my schooling has been financed by my grandparents. My grandparents are not working anymore, because they are too old to work, and my parents cannot afford my school, because my parents' income is uncertain. My parents work just as ordinary farm workers; their income is not enough to pay for my school. Therefore, I am very grateful to Kiva for this program, which enables me to go to school and not rely on parents or grandparents."

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Rukiya

texts.en:
Rukiya is a 32 year old woman. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of three children.

Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He has been running an auto rickshaw for the last three years. For the past several days his rickshaw has not been not working properly because of regular usage. He feels that most of its parts are out of order. This means he is unable to generate any amount of income. 

He wants to buy a new auto rickshaw. However due to the lack of money he finds it difficult to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. Therefore Rukiya has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, to help her husband to cover the cost of a new rickshaw. This will help him to continue his business. 

Rukiya is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new rickshaw for her husband.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en:
Zubaida is 45 years old; she is the mother of three children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store for many years near his house, and the business is operating very well.

Earlier he was selling bakery items in large quantities, but to meet customer demand, he wants to offer rice, sugar, flour etc. He does not want to refuse to stock any product and disappoint any of his respected customers. He wants to offer all those products which are necessary and consumable in a daily routine. In this way, he will successfully win the trust of his customers and increase his income as well.

Therefore, Zubaida requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could buy sacks of rice, sugar and flour for his general store. She is very glad after having taken this loan and hopeful that her husband will be able to successfully fulfill each request for any item and prevent the disappointment of his customers. Zubaida is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her husband's general store

loans.name: Bernadus

texts.en:
This is the story of Lia, daughter of Bernadus:

I live in the village of Karangsari, in the corner of the city of Cilacap. Every day I go to school on foot because the school is close to home (approximately 100m) . I’am the third child, and my parents work as ordinary farm laborers. The results of my parents are very minimal. Crop yields are dependent on the weather. In the rainy season, sometimes there is crop failure. Meanwhile, my brother needs money to attend school. I myself want to go to school because I want to develop in the future. I'd love to make my parents happy, as long as they work hard for my sister and I, so we can all go to school. Every school day I help my mom do the housework after I study. I joined the program of Kiva because my parents are unable to pay for school in a timely manner. I am very grateful to those who have provided loans for my school fees. In the picture, Bernadus and wife, Lia daughter of Bernadus.

loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Fany Marisol

texts.es:
Fany Marisol tiene 32 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia la cual es muy unida y cuentan con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos; la comunidad en la que viven está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura y ganadería; y está ubicada en el distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Fany Marisol se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, huevos, menestras, entre otros; con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en domicilio. Ella solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo, en compra de más mercadería, pues desea comprar mayores cantidades de productos (arroz, azúcar, menestras, aceite, entre otros) para aumentar y diversificar su stock de los productos que ofrece en su tienda; dicha inversión le servirá para incrementar sus ventas, ya que podrá satisfacer todos los gustos y necesidades de su público consumidor. Lo que en un corto plazo le reflejará en mayores ganancias y por ende una mejora en la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fany Marisol is 32 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives with her family and they are very united and she comes with good references from her neighbors.  Her community is basically a farming and livestock community, located in Oyotún, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

Fany Marisol sells groceries such as rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil, eggs, soups, and other things.  She has been doing this out of her home for more than 10 years.  She is asking for this loan to buy more merchandise because she wants to buy in quantity (rice, sugar, soups, cooking oil, etc.) so she can increase and diversify her stock of products in her store.  This investment will help her increase her sales, income, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rowena is 40 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Rowena has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Rowena has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rowena has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets, feed, vitamins and other supplies for her business.

loans.name: Porvenir De Viacha Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PORVENIR DE VIACHA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Marina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: salón de peluquería, librería, venta de celulares, costura de mandiles, costura de polleras, venta de salchipapas, venta de verduras.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Marina es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su amiga que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de trenzado de mantas; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años al observar a sus amigas y la amplia producción que tenían decidió aprender la técnica del tejido para utilizarla como fuente de trabajo. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de flecos e hilos por mayor) que adquirirá de las tiendas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación que ofrece el personal de la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Porvenir de Viacha" will start its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, in the Cascada central office.  This group has 8 members and is led by a board of directors where Marina is the president.  The members of this group have a variety of businesses including: beauty salon, stationery store, cell phone sales, the sewing of aprons, the sewing of traditional skirts, the sale of sausages with fried potatoes, and the sale of vegetables.

This loan will benefit these small business-people, including Marina.  She states that she joined Pro Mujer a year ago at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution.  At this time she has a business making braided rugs.  She got to know this business by watching her friends.  Seeing the extensive production they had, she decided to learn the technique of weaving so that she could use this as a source of work.

The loan that she is taking will be used to increase her capital (to buy fringe and yarn at wholesale).  She will buy these items from the shops in the city of El Alto.  Later, she will sell her items from her sales post.  This way of working enables her to generate resources to support her family financially, as she is married and has 3 children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the training offered by the people at the institution.

loans.use: to buy fringe and yarn at wholesale

loans.name: Tarav

texts.en: Tarav, 57 years old, lives with his wife in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a sentry at a high school since 2009. His wife used to run a grocery store and now she sells shoes which are sent from Korea by their son. They have four children and all of them live on their own. He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as planks, shingles and fiberglass for house renovation. By doing so, he and his wife will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating and then fewer pollutants are released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Elisur

texts.en: Elisur is a 53-year-old married man from Concepcion, Iloilo. He is a fisherman and has been in the fishing business for more than five years now. He is asking for a loan to buy a propeller and propeller rod and a boat hull. Through this, he will be able to improve his fishing business and augment his income. In the future, Elisur hopes to make his business more profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy a propeller and propeller rod and a boat hull.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita manages a small business in Cadanay Norte, Siquijor, Philippines. Her store has supported their family, bringing a meager income of PHP 3,000 per month. Rosita has set savings out from her earnings. Now she wants to repair their roofing. She availed herself of a loan to pay for labor.

Rosita is thankful that she is able to seek financial help from the Cooperative.

loans.use: to pay for labor for house repair.

loans.name: Marian

texts.en:
Marian is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marian is 37 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Marian has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Marian requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials and equipment for her business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marian has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Marian would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and equipment for her business

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, se dedica a la crianza de pollos de engorde, vive con su compañera de vida y dos hijas; el negocio lo atiende de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, los pollos los comercializa vivos y en ocasiones el mismo los destaza para venderlos en piezas. En este momento no representa ningún problema en su negocio.
 Utilizará el préstamo para comprar pollos recién nacidos y concentrado para alimentarlos, la inversión será de ayuda para tener más pollos y así atraer nuevos clientes para tener mejores ingresos que le servirán para cancelar la deuda adquirida.  
Los proyectos de don Miguel son tener una granja de pollos mejor establecida que le dé una buena rentabilidad para subsistir con su familia.
texts.en:
Miguel raises chickens and lives with his wife and two daughters.  He tends to his business from 7:00 am to 5:00 pm and sells his chickens live and sometimes butchers them to sell in pieces.  He has not had any problems with his business so far.

He will use the money from this loan to chicks and feed.  This will help him to have more chickens to serve his customers and improve his income so he can also pay off the loan.

Miguel wants to have a better chicken farm that will be more profitable so he can support his family.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia Nancy continua dedicándose a la  ganadería, la socia Nancy pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolomé de Tambo Real”, la socia agradece el crédito otorgado y  se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia, la socia a la vez continua dedicándose a la agricultura.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de abono y semillas.
texts.en:
The borrower, Nancy, is still raising livestock. Nancy belongs to the “San Bartolomé de Tambo Real” communal bank.  She is grateful for the loan granted, and promises to make her payments, as this is how she is helping her family get ahead in life.  At the same time, she is continuing to engage in  agriculture.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a 46-year-old married woman and the mother of five children from Concepcion, Iloilo. Catalina has been engaged in the fishing business with her husband for more than three years now. Fishing has provided them with the income that they need to support the daily needs and school expenses of their children.

Catalina wants to expand their fishing business but lacks the capital to do so. With this, she wants to borrow a loan to buy a new boat engine and fishing nets. She believes that this loan could help them in improving their fishing business. In the future, she wants to make their fishing business a success.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine and fishing nets.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new fishing nets and crab traps/cages

loans.name: Rodimin

texts.en:
This is the story of Khusnun, son of Rodimin :

My name is Khusnun and I live in the village of Ajibarang, Bringkeng. Every day I go to school by motorcycle because my house is quite far from the school, about 10km. I am a child of farmer parents with erratic income. And lately the crops are not satisfactory. After school, I help both parents and with grazing for my guinea pigs. I try to be  independent and do not ask my parents, for money. I just want to excel in school and my parents can boast of  my success. Therefore I am interested in this KIVA program, and I say many thanks to the lenders. 

In the picture, Khusnun appears with Rodimin, his father, and Rasmi, his mother.

loans.use: to pay education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a cultured seaweed business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year now.

Ailyn requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

In the future, Ailyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Arcadia

texts.en:
Arcadia is 46 years old and married with twelve children. With five children currently in school, Arcadia works very hard to provide for them.

Arcadia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items like candies, cooking oil, noodles, shampoo, detergent soap, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

Arcadia has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as candies, cooking oil, noodles, shampoo, detergent soap, soft drinks, etc.

In the future, Arcadia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like candies, cooking oil, noodles, shampoo, detergent soap, soft drinks, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, 50, is a resident of Binondo, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Norberto, a driver. Lydia manages her  household while operating a food stall business. She works hard to augment the family's income to meet their daily personal and household needs. 

Lydia has operated a small eatery stall for a number of years. In the Philippines, a food stall is a common sight, especially in populated areas. Working class people usually buy their meals at food stalls at reasonable prices for convenience and to save money instead of cooking at home. They just eat their home-cooked meals at the end of the day with their family. Since Lydia cooks well, her food stall is popular in her area with her neighbors and the local working community as her regular  customers. She earns a minimum net income of PHP 1,000 daily.

To help her maintain her business, Lydia is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan to buy packs of charcoal, oil and soft drinks needed for her business. She believes that her sales and earnings will increase with this financial assistance. She thanks God in advance for your great help.

Lydia dreams of being more successful in her business and having a bigger space for her eatery. She prays to stay healthy and lead a happy and quiet life. Lydia meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, oil and other ingredients needed in cooking dishes for her food stall.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina. She previously accessed a 20,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more stock of mineral water needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy additional stock of mineral water needed in her business. The more mineral water displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gina still looks forward to going abroad and she wants to earn more through her hard work in business. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of mineral water to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 57 years old and widowed with two children.

She earns a living by running a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Aurelia is borrowing 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Aurelia has been in the pig-fattening business for 20 years and also earns additional income from rice farming.

She works tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gabina

texts.es:
La socia Gabina se sigue dedicando al trabajo como limpieza y cocina, la socia por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor para su carro.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Gabina continues to work cleaning and cooking.  She supports herself through this work and wants to get ahead.  Her dream is to have a grocery store.  She is asking for this loan to buy a television.  She is happy about the loan and is committed to making her payments.

loans.use: to buy a television.

loans.name: Dindo

texts.en: Dindo is a 37-year-old married man and a father of three children from Leyte, Philippines. He earns a living through his dried fish vending business. Dindo has been in the business for more than a year. He is asking for a loan to buy more fish to be dried for selling. In the future, Dindo hopes to expand his business and make it more profitable and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy more fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Baby

texts.en:
Baby is 25 years old and single.  

Baby is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Baby has requested a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs. Baby has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Baby would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vaccines and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is a married woman with ten children. She is 60 years old and has two children who are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Bibiana has a cultured seaweed business in the Philippines. Bibiana has requested a 9,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business. She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Bibiana would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is married and she works hard to support her family. For the past 3 years, she has operated a fishing business in the Philippines. Cecilia has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials and equipment for her fishing business. Cecilia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials and equipment for her fishing business

loans.name: Clarisa

texts.en: Clarisa, 60 years old, is married and has four children. Clarisa works very hard to provide for them. For the past 5 years, Clarisa has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as detergent, soap, salt, coffee, sugar, shampoo, candies, biscuits, etc. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more of these items to sell. Clarisa would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as detergent, soap, salt, coffee, sugar, shampoo, candies, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a 46-year-old married woman from the town of Dulag, Leyte. she is a mother to four children. Her eldest is now 27 and her youngest is 12. 

She has been a fish vendor for 20 years now. She is asking for a loan to buy more fresh fish that she can resell for a profit. Her income goes mainly to buy healthy meals for her family and pay for school fees.

In the future, she hopes to make her business more profitable. Currently, she is only using a spare table, but she hopes to find a better place where she can sell her fish in the future.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Ledilita

texts.en:
Ledilita is 49 years old and is from the community of Dulag, Leyte. She is married with five grown children. For the last three years, Ledilita has been engaged in buying and selling fresh fish as well as making peanut butter. From these businesses, she usually earns 16,000 PHP per month. She is asking for a loan to buy peanuts, sugar and fresh fish.

Her income will provide healthy meals and pay for household needs like electricity and water. In the future, she hopes to expand her business and make it more stable.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, sugar and fresh fish

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma is a 48-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Leyte, Philippines. She earns a living from her hog-raising business. She also earns additional income through her vegetable farming. Elma works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family, especially for their children's schooling. Elma is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets, feed and fertilizer for the farm. With this, she will be able to grow healthy pigs and augment her harvest from her farm. In the future, Elma dreams of expanding her ventures so that they will generate more revenue.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets, feed and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Glenn

texts.en:
Glenn is 29 years old, and  from McArthur, Leyte. She is married with two young children, aged 2 and 3. For two years now, she has been making hollow blocks. This usually earns her 10,000 PHP per month which she used to provide for her family.

Glenn is asking for a loan to buy sand and pay for transportation of these materials. Glenn hope that she can expand her business and make it more profitable in the future so that her children can continue going to school.

loans.use: to buy sand and pay for transportation

loans.name: Jose Amilcar

texts.es:
José, ha mejorado parcialmente su  negocio de venta de sorbete y paletas, con ayuda del préstamo anterior, comenta que ha contado con producto suficiente para bastecer a los clientes ya establecidos y  ha ganado nuevos clientes, las ventas y ganancias son mejores, su grupo familiar se mantiene igual pero vive en mejores condiciones de vida.
Se decidió por solicitar un nuevo préstamo para comprar variedad de paletas y sorbete por caja, surtirá su inventario para continuar teniendo recursos económicos y subsistir con su familia, espera seguir progresando con ayuda de préstamos.
texts.en:
Jose is improving his ice cream and frozen treats business with the help of his previous loan.  He says that he has enough product to meet his customer demand and has gained new ones.  His sales and income are better. His family remains the same but have better living conditions.

He decided to ask for another loan to buy more ice cream and frozen treats by the case.  He will diversify his inventory and continue having financial resources and supporting his family.  He hopes to continue making progress with the help of the loans.

loans.use: to buy ice cream and frozen treats.

loans.name: Ma. Mariel

texts.en:
Ma. Mariel works hard to support her family. She is married and has a farming seaweeds business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for one year now.

She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more materials and tools for her business. Ma. Mariel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials and tools for her business

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de escuela de choferes,por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de escuela de choferes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar herramientas para los carros para su escuela de choferes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues to run a driving school and wants to get ahead through this business.  Her dream is to expand her driving school and is asking for this loan to buy car tools for the school.

She is happy about the loan and promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to buy tools.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Leyte, Philippines. She earns a living through her hog raising and vegetable farming business. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more piglets to raise and fertilizer for the farm. Through this loan, Francisca will improve her businesses as well as her income.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise and fertilizer for the farm

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca has faithfully paid back her previous loan which she used for her business. She has been operating her own “sari-sari” (variety) store for seven years and she earns well from this. She sustains all her needs through her business while ably helping her family at the same time. She also works hard with the determination of having better income.

To improve sales, Francisca would like to apply for a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. With PHP 25,000, she could already purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business. She sincerely lets you know her heartfelt thanks and appreciation for this assistance in advance.

In the future, Francisca hopes to open a new business and she only desires that her family will always stick together. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en: Rosalia is a 54-year-old married woman and a mother of six children from Leyte, Philippines. Rosalia is engaged in retail sales of soap and detergents, among other items. Her husband is a farmer. Rosalia needs a loan for additional capital for her business. She is requesting a loan to buy more stock to sell, such as detergent, fabric conditioner, shampoo, beauty soap and other items. With this, she will be able to improve her stock, thus allowing her to sell more products to her customers. Rosalia dreams of making her business more sustainable and profitable. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, such as detergent, fabric conditioner, shampoo, beauty soap and other items

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 58 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like soft drinks, chocolate drinks, coffee, eggs, detergent, soap, etc., to sell.

Evangeline has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, chocolate drinks, coffee, eggs, detergent, soap, etc. 

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks like soft drinks, chocolate drinks, coffee, eggs, detergent, soap, etc., to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with twelve children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 49 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials like fishing net, bamboo, wood, etc., for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

Gemma has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials like fishing net, bamboo, wood, etc. for the maintenance of her fishing boat

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 46 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and has been in this business for two years. Jovita requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials and gear for her business.

 In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials and gear for her business

loans.name: Maricela Elizabeth

texts.es:
Maricela, actualmente vive con su compañero de vida y su hijo de 8 años; Maricela se dedica a cultivar jícama y maíz, también realiza la crianza de ganado, estas actividades las aprendió a desarrollarlas dentro de su familia y ya hace 20 años que lo hace de manera independiente para generar ingresos con los cubre las necesidades de su familia, trabaja en un horario de 6:00 a.m. a 1:30 p.m.
Invertirá el préstamo en la compra de insumos agrícolas, como abono e insecticidas, de esta manera tendrá una mejor cosecha, espera incrementar sus ventas y ganancias para respaldar el cumplimiento de sus compromisos.
Los sueños de  Maricela son tener una ganadería mejor establecida, remodelar su vivienda y dar a su hijo la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Maricela lives with her life’s partner and 8 year old son.  Maricela raises jicama and corn.  She also raises livestock.  She learned these activities within her family and has been doing this on her own, to generate income, for 20 years.  She works from 6:00 am to 1:30 pm.

She will use the money from this loan to buy farming supplies such as fertilizer and insecticide so she will have a better harvest and increase her sales and earnings with which to meet her obligations.

Maricela’s dreams are to have a better, an established income, remodel her house, and provide a university education for her son.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Magnolia

texts.en:
Magnolia is 46 years old and married with four children. 

Magnolia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. Magnolia has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending.

Magnolia aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Bakhtygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул успешно погасила свой предыдущий кредит, она использовала его по назначению. Бактыгул очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей с финансированием. На сегодняшний день у Бактыгул есть 3 швейные машинки, ее ежемесячный доход составляет 30,000 сом (KGS). Также Бактыгул выращивает кукурузу на собственной земельной доли мерою 0,25 Га. Бактыгул обратилась в  Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом, в сумме 50,000 сом(KGS) на покупку материалов для производства, таких как ткани, фурнитура, пуговицы и т.д. Бактыгул планирует и в дальнейшем увеличивать объем заказов, чтобы накопить средства на постройку дома для сына.
texts.en:
Bakhtygul successfully paid off her previous loan, which she used as intended. She is very thankful to Kiva and to everyone who gave her financial support. 

Bakhtygul currently has three sewing machines with a monthly income of 30,000 KGS. She also grows corn on her own 0.25 hectare plot of land. She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase materials for her sewing business such as fabrics, accessories, buttons, etc. In the future she plans to increase the number of orders she takes in order to save toward building a house for her son.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as fabrics, sewing accessories, buttons, etc. in order to provide better variety for her customers

loans.name: Humberto

texts.es:
Humberto de 20 años de edad, es un joven muy trabajador aplicado a todas las actividades que desarrolla a diario. Él estudio hasta cuarto grado debido a que en el lugar donde vive es bien extraviado y no hay la oportunidad de estudiar y también por las condiciones económicas de su familia.

Humberto es soltero, vive junto a sus padres en su vivienda y 4 hermanos menores que él, junto a su padre y dos hermanos más trabajan para el sustento diario de la familia.

La principal actividad que desarrolla Humberto junto a su padre es la siembra de hortalizas como pepino, tomate, ejote etc.  Tiene ya aproximadamente 4 años de dedicarse a esta actividad que es tan importante para ellos; porque allí sacan sus ingresos económicos atreves de sus ventas. Los cultivos los tienen cerca de su casa por eso ellos siempre están pendientes de sus cultivos, aparte de dedicases a la siembra de hortalizas, también trabaja de jornalero pues es otra actividad que le genera ingresos para su familia. 

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar fertilizantes, preparar la tierra para cultivar pepino pues la semilla ya la tiene. Gracias al préstamo tendrán otros cultivos que le generen mayores ingresos para su familia.

Humberto para el futuro desea poder tener un sistema de invernadero para cultivas, pues dice que hoy en el invierno es bien difícil tener cultivos porque hay mucha plaga que afecta a los cultivos, también poder construir su propia casa y formar una familia.
texts.en:
Humberto is 20 years old. He is a very hardworking young man who is dedicated to all his daily activities. He went to school until fourth grade, because the place where he lives is quite isolated and there aren't educational opportunities, and also because of his family's financial situation.

Humberto is single. He lives with his parents in their house along with four younger brothers. With his father and two other brothers, he works for the daily sustenance of the family.

The main activity that Humberto carries out with his father is growing vegetables like cucumbers, tomatoes, green beans, etc. He has already been working for approximately four years in this business, which is so important to them. That's where they get their income, through their sales. 

They have their crops close to their house, so they are always tending to them. In addition to growing vegetables, he also works as a day laborer, as it's another activity that generates income for the family. 

The loan he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to buy fertilizers and to prepare the soil to plant cucumbers; he already has the seed. Thanks to the loan, he will have other crops that will generate greater income for his family.

For the future, Humberto would like to be able to have a greenhouse system for his crops, because he says that nowadays it is quite difficult to have crops in the winter because there are many infestations that affect the crops. He would also like to build his own house, and have his own family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and prepare the soil to cultivate cucumbers; he already has the seed.

loans.name: Nikki

texts.en:
She is Nikki, 28, a resident of Tondo, Manila, Philippines. She is married to Ronnie Roy and a mother to her three children. Two of her kids are in the elementary level and the youngest is not of school age yet. She manages her household while her husband oversees her Piso Net business. She and her husband work had to continually provide income for her family’s needs.

Nikki operates a "Piso-Net" business. Piso Net is basically a merge of PC rental and Arcade rental services wherein customers can use the services by inserting coins to the machine. There is a big need for services like these in the Philippines since only a few own a Personal Computer.  Her main patrons are students who do their school requirements.  It serves business purposes like writing resumes, office documentation, and legal documents. It also serves the youths' and adults' hobby of surfing the net and any social networks. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 a day. It greatly helps to meet her family's daily basic personal and household needs and for the schooling of her kids.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan and will use the loan to buy additional Piso Net units. She is positive that it will help improve her earnings as she adds another PC unit to her shop. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given her.

Nikki dreams to give her children a bright future and send them to the best schools. She prays that she will be able to send them up to college. She also wants them to lead a quiet and godly life.  She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for an additional Piso Net unit.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her as she was able to buy more stocks of mineral water needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional stocks of mineral water needed in her business. The more mineral water displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her business profits will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Carmelita dreams of having a bigger water station someday. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of mineral water to expand her product inventory

loans.name: Yulisa Yecenia

texts.es:
La socia Yulisa Yecenia se dedica al negocio de transporte, la socia tiene un carro que hace servicio a la ciudad de lima llevando carga, la socia trabaja 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es comprarse un carro nuevo. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar llantas para su carro.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Yulisa Yecenia provides transportation and has a car that she uses to transport cargo to Lima.  She has been doing this for seven years and things are going well for her.  Her dream is to buy a new car and is asking for a loan to buy new tires.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy tires.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 61 years old and single.  She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Estelita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines ,and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lorena, se mantiene trabajando con el negocio de venta de ropa, ha mantenido a sus clientes satisfechos, mejorado la situación económica y cancelo su deuda, estos son resultados positivos que ha tenido al invertir el crédito anterior en su negocio.
Opta por un nuevo préstamo para comprar variedad de prendas de vestir diversificadas en estilos, colores y tallas, para dama, caballero y niños/as, así tendrá un mejor inventario para atraer nuevos clientes y seguir teniendo buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Lorena continues to work her clothing business and keeping her customers happy.  Her financial situation improved and she paid off her debt.  These are the positive results of the previous loan.

She is asking for a new loan to buy a variety of men’s, women’s and children’s clothing of various styles, colors, and sizes.  This way she will have a better inventory with which to attract new customers and continue having good earnings.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

She has a business farming seaweeds  in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like rope, etc., for her business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like rope, etc., for her business

loans.name: Painah

texts.en:
This is the story of Wiarto, Son of Painah :

"Wiarto is my name. I live with my parents. I am from a mediocre family. My mom and dad work and are earning less than IDR 50,000 per day. I am the sixth of eight children. I always help my mom make money after school at my cousin's place. Although the results are meager, it is enough to help my parents because I no longer ask for an allowance from them. With the Kiva program, I am grateful because it can ease the burden of my parents who are just low paid workers. Thank you to the lenders, so I do not trouble to think about the cost of education."

loans.use: to pay education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga is married and has a daughter. She works selling housewares at the market. She lives in a house with her parents and is a responsible, persistent and hardworking person. In the future she plans to open her own store.

Olga is requesting a loan of 25,000 griven to build two rooms in her house. The loan will allow her to improve her living space and create a bedroom for her child.

loans.use: to build two rooms in her house

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 40 years old. She is a mother to three children aged 11, 14 and 16. 

For eighteen years now, she has been engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business. In addition to that, she is also into renting out videoke service. She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks of merchandise such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, toiletries, eggs, condiments and chips.

Her goal is to maximize her income by offering her customers variety of items, and this way will not have to go far. In the future, Marissa hopes to make her store bigger and more profitable.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of merchandise such as canned goods, soft drinks, noodles, toiletries, eggs, condiments, and chips

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion settled for a living in Molave, Zamboanga del Sur with her family. 

To make a living, she has been operating a general store in their village. She earns well from this, aside from her husband's income from working as an OFW. The business is doing well and she has sustained it.  

Improving her business is her desire for she wants to have a better source of income for the family in the future. Concepcion took a new loan recently to purchase more stocks of grocery goods for her store. She found GDMPC as her partner in improving the general living of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of grocery goods for her store

loans.name: Maharlika

texts.en:
Maharlika works hard to support her family.   She is married and has a seaweed-culturing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.

She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials and tools for her business.  Maharlika would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more materials and tools for her business
